story:
Help Build a Sculpture for the Gregg Museum in Raleigh.

UPDATE: As of 12/1 we have received over $14,000 from our IndieGoGo campaign, private donations and in-kind donations to build a sculpture for the Gregg Museum of Art & Design. Thank you for your support as we continue our campaign for the Gregg Tree Project!

-Ann, Mike, Justin and the Gregg Tree Project Team

Like you, we know that with growth comes inevitable impacts to the environment, and we love the idea of deliberately re-purposing the trees, rather than running them through the wood chipper and turning them into mulch.

With your help, we hope to fabricate the sculpture for the Gregg lawn using the smaller (9,000 Lb +) of the two trees.  The larger tree (20,000 LB +) will be slabbed (3 1/2" - 4" slabs), ricked and air-dried (3 years minimum) by the sawyer as preparation for future custom furniture or art for the Gregg or another location at NCSU. Our dear friend and local filmmaker David Hambridge will document the fabrication and installation process over the next several months. 

Why Does this Matter and What Can We Achieve?

We hope the sculpture will remind us to pay attention to the growth, decay, or destruction that happens around us constantly, so that we might be compelled to reuse, recreate, or even better, find ways around destruction of the natural environment.  We are excited by the growth and cultural developments in Raleigh, but we also recognize that we bear a responsibility to lessen the negative impacts where at all possible.  This gives us all a way to demonstrate a respect for, and commitment to, the trees that have been here much longer than we have. 

www.greggtreeproject.com

What We Need & What You Get

  • Needs: Our funding needs reflect design, fabrication and transportation of the log, with a more detailed breakdown on our website.
  • Perks: We don't have stuff to give, but we'll thank you on the Gregg Tree Project site and social media, and we'll wine and dine our major supporters at the studios (we're all great cooks.)  

Why We're Doing This

We are passionate (and we know you are too) about honoring the environment and these trees, not only as objects of North Carolina State University's history, but also as testaments to their perpetual worthiness in Raleigh’s landscape. We are confident in our collective ability to deliver a meaningful and relevant piece of sculpture, and we’d be honored to do so for the Gregg and for Raleigh.

ABOUT THE GREGG MUSEUM

The Gregg did not begin as a museum; it became one. It began when a former NC State chancellor and dean sought to enhance NC State’s mission by acquiring and exhibiting art that reflected the university’s curricula. By the late 1970's this program had evolved into the Visual Arts Program. With the opening of an addition to Talley Student Center in 1992, it became the Visual Arts Center and accommodated  a collection of up to 5,000 objects. Today, the Gregg Museum holds a collection of nearly seven times that.

ABOUT EIDOLON DESIGNS

Ann Cowperthwaite and Mike Parker co-founded Eidolon Designs, which has over three decades of experience in fine custom craftwork and sculpture. Mike’s focus is engineering and flawless craftsmanship; Ann’s is design and sculpture.  Additionally, Eidolon is a foundational member of the local design and craft community, and, as such, will be similarly foundational in engaging Raleigh in this endeavor.

www.eidolondesigns.com

 

ABOUT ARROWHEAD DESIGNS

Arrowhead Construction is a specialty design / build contracting company focusing on modern architecture, energy efficiency, and exceptional craftsmanship. Arrowhead designs and constructs modern furniture and structures, utilizing various media including steel, lumber, concrete, and more.

www.arrowhead-nc.com

 

ABOUT DAVID HAMBRIDGE

David is a local commercial and documentary filmmaker - his interest lies in personal, truthful, and intimate storytelling. His approach relies on mutual trust between the filmmaker and his subjects, which over time produces honest, personal moments on screen. Currently, David is the director for the feature-length documentary film "The Last Male Standing" about the last male northern white rhino in the world and his caretakers, set to release Fall 2017.

www.davidhambridge.com

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out! Follow us on Instagram and Facebook
  • Host a contest on Instagram in support of the project, hold a porch party, or meet people for coffee and tell them about the project
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gregg Tree Project is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Gregg Tree Project must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.    Note: While the tree project will be a special addition to the new Gregg, this work has been commissioned out to local artists and any additional money donated to the project will be processed through a nonprofit not associated with NC State University.  As such, these gifts will not be recognized or recorded by the university.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gregg Tree Project is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Gregg Tree Project must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.    Note: While the tree project will be a special addition to the new Gregg, this work has been commissioned out to local artists and any additional money donated to the project will be processed through a nonprofit not associated with NC State University.  As such, these gifts will not be recognized or recorded by the university.

story:
What is REACTOR? 

REACTOR is a 15 foot winding, shiny,LED lined, steel tree that will be driven down to Burning Man this summer in a rented truck, and assembled in a selected space on the playa for maximum sensory effect, day and night! This project is spearheaded by Ryan Longo, creator of the Intergalactic Garden Supply (IGS) and maker of party deco pieces you may be familiar with such as Magic Plants, Desert Flowers and Flying Stingrays. REACTOR promises to propel the Intergalactic Garden Supply into new galaxies and uncharted party territories! 

Our Team is: 

  • Ryan Longo: Everything Man and REACTOR's papa 
  • Jaclyn Potechin: Merch, Materials, and Transportation Coordinator
  • Kevin Flynn: Organizer, Liaison with other maker space, Build team  
  • Cortney Lush: Camp Organizer, Assemblage and Tear down support
  • Tiphaine Leonard: Artist Support and Playa Crew 

 

REACTOR's Manifesto

The amazing feedback received by Ryan with past IGS installations helped set the intention for how REACTOR might contribute, that is, by creating a space for reflection, meditation, and retreat in a whirlwind of other energies. 

Our sculpture has been in the planning phase since late 2015. This is the final stretch, with all contributors working daily to bring a test version of REACTOR to Playground Festival (https://www.facebook.com/events/929526100473156/).

Our aim is to accumulate enough funding to add some stellar finishing touches to the Burning Man 2016 model. The REACTOR build is currently financially backed by Intergalactic Garden Supply and a few key partners who are eager to see the final result. We have help from Burning Man with site selection and with providing passes for artists. We are asking you to pitch in to encourage our team during the build, and help alleviate some costs of materials and transportation. It takes time, patience, and good will to collaborate and bring something together to share with like-minded communities. We aim to bring magic and wonder to events not just as contributors, but as participants as well. Thank you for your support.

Another way to show your support is by purchasing a custom REACTOR t-shirt (40$) or hoodie (100$) or hand written post-card from the playa (20). 

Donate here!   http://www.intergalacticgardensupply.com/

 

Financial Stats 

REACTOR is made of steel sheet metal, rods and mesh. individual LED lightings will line the interior of the structure with magnet powered access panels to reach the inside. We are painting the sculpture with a magnificent purple/green chrome finish. REACTOR  is very inexpensive considering its size and weight- only $5000.00 in material costs! It will be disassembled and driven down to the playa in a rented truck. This rental is another $5,000.00.

Our total minimum overhead is 10,000.00$

We are looking for funds to rig the sculpture up with a surprise additional sensory experience. With hard work and your support, we hope to push towards new opportunities and bigger projects for future events! 

 

Our Journey

Hauling REACTOR down to the desert for most of our team's first Burn, in a rented truck, and towards new friends (Camp Unicorners at Cosima and 2:45) will be challenging. We will be away with the sculpture for 18 days. If this commitment seems crazy, imagine us rolling into another Ontario festival immediately after the Burn, just in time for a fall equinox celebration. What a trip!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

REACTOR t-shirts, zip up hoodies, and post-cards are available in limited supply. Please contact myself(Tiph) 647-891-8873 or Ryan Longo 416-556-6173 to arrange delivery in Toronto or by mail.  

No worries! If a monetary donation isn't for you, we'd also hugely appreciate sharing our project with others. Do this either online or through word of mouth! 

Thank you! For any attention you've dedicated to this project. Every bit helps!

Hope you get to experience REACTOR with us very soon. 

 

Intergalactic Garden Supply

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Kay and I run Conlang Calligraph, your one-stop shop for conlang art and merch.  I create designs in conlangs--constructed languages--and fictional writing systems.  I specialize in Vulcan and Gallifreyan, but I've also worked with Klingon, Unown, Hylian, Tengwar, and several others!

So far, I've worked entirely online.  But now I'm getting ready to take a big step and venture out into the world of vending at conventions!  But that takes resources, from things like making sure to have a size-inclusive stock of t-shirts, to one-time purchases like a banner for my table, to having all of my queer identity designs available, to business cards and fliers and sample pieces of the merch I don't have room to stock. 

This is the biggest project I've ever undertaken, and with your help, it might just be the best! 

What We Need & What You Get

First off, I need stock!

$700+.  T-shirts. That's the bare minimum to have a chance of having what people want actually at the table where they're spending money--as much as $1000 to be more plus size-inclusive.

$100: Sample items.  These are things like leggings and skirts--the ones I want to have visible so that people will order them from my shop, but don't have the room or resources to offer from the table.

$200: Mugs and socks.  Mid priced items where I don't have to worry about sizing--I'm really hoping these are some of my biggest sellers!

$100: Change.  Gotta have those fives and tens for the cash customers!

$50: Credit card chip reader

$250: Banner.  I need to be visible and get my name out there!

$250: Signs, fliers, and business cards.  People have to be able to find me again.

$150: Miscellaneous supplies buffer.  All the little stuff I haven't thought of yet that will inevitably come up at the last minute.

$150: Booth fee

$250: Perk fund, to make sure donors get my thanks!

As for those perks!

Any Level: My unending thanks and gratitude.

$15: Your name (or favorite word) in Vulcan!

$30: Your word or phrase in Gallifreyan!

$45: A pair of socks with your favorite (premade) design on them!

$55: A coffee mug, also with your favorite design!

$80: Your favorite screen printed t-shirt, any size, any color!

$100: Your name or word in ornate, highly stylized Vulcan!

$150: A unique Vulcan or Gallifreyan design, printed on the mug, socks, or shirt of your choosing!

$250: Unique design for you in any fictional universe's alphabet.

The Impact

If this con is successful, it will allow me to devote more time and effort in my craft!  I'll be able to create more art.  I'll be able to add more queer identities, more words of wisdom, and of course, more hilarious profanity.  Sometimes all at once.

So far, I've managed to grow this thing from a hobby done purely for love into a reasonably successful online business.  It's time to branch out into offline space, and I think we can do this!

Risks & Challenges

The main risk is that the con will be a bust.  No one will buy ANYTHING, I won't even start to make back my investment.

Realistically, even if I don't make back my full investment, I'll be able to get my name out there, and have memory and word of mouth bring in a steady trickle of new customers to my online store.

Other challenges include having to guess and what will be popular and within con-goer's budgets.  But I've made my best guesses and have a free shipping coupon ready to go so that con-goers can get exactly what they want even if I didn't bring it.

This is definitely a leap out of my comfort zone, but I think it will be worth every challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Broke? That's fine, I know the feel.  You can still earn my undying gratitude by sharing this campaign or my store with your nerdy friends!

Kinda broke but really want that one perk? Most of them are also available in my shop, and that helps too!

Thanks so much for reading this far, and have a very nerdy day.  Qapla'!

story: .

The Giving Arts

The Giving Arts is a virtual art gallery that donates proceeds from every single purchase to a foundation, fundraiser or person in need. 30% of each purchase goes out the door in the spirit of charity. 

The Giving Arts was founded out of the desire to contribute to all that ask, as well as provide a platform for artists to share their arts and crafts. 

Our first very first gifts have gone to our dear friend Dee Dee M. Cocheta, a mother of 7, grand mother of 3, and an entertainment industry vet that has breast cancer. Our contributions enabled her to continue her path of healing.  A portion of the funds raised from this campaign will continue to assist her in purchasing the supplements and procedures that are necessary for her to continue her healing journey. 

We are now ready to take our gifting and contributions to the next level. With your help, The Giving Arts will be able to do just that. Your contributions will assist us in a couple of very important ways:

 - The Giving Arts website, so that our visitors can easily contribute to the person or cause of their choice with a click of a button.

 - A portion of the proceeds from this very campaign will also go toward a local Atlanta food bank or pantry, just in time for the holidays.

 - Funds will allow us to continue to purchase jewelry and art at wholesale prices for amazing and reasonable options for the visitors to the site. 

Your support will not only make a difference with The Giving Arts, but the impact that we can make together will mean the world to those that are in need. 

Please join us in being in contribution. No amount is too small and we appreciate every single penny. :-) 

Thanks so much,

Raychelle

story:
WHO R U?

I am Genevieve Belleveau, a social practitioner and artist living in Brooklyn, NY.  My work encompasses a broad range of methods and mediums to challenge the accepted modes of operating within the structure of civilized society.  I have been exhibited internationally from large scale immersive installations in Sweden to intimate gatherings of feminist visionaries.  I was recently called "the Queen Bee of the Brooklyn contemporary art scene" by Interview Magazine and have a rich history of working collaboratively with artists, night life organizers and creatives from all walks of life.

I have worked as an Mister Softee truck driver in Manhattan for 6 years and more recently as a truck manager for the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck.  I consider my experience with mobile vending to be foundational to this endeavor and consider my knowledge of truck mechanics, street culture, traffic laws and general hustle essential to the success of this project.

photo by Angelina Dreem

WHY, THO?

This progression in  my work is a natural extension of my growing concerns with networked culture and the toll it takes on individual spirituality.  The idea of the online acting as a divine space has influenced my work for the past 3 years and is now coming to fruition as the New Ascetic; a tonsured monk avatar I enact on my social media that urges others to examine the roles that the internet plays in their lives and offers helpful suggestions on how to mediate modern age metaphysical dilemmas. 

In immersing myself in the unfamiliar challenges of the mobile monastery I am acknowledging the need to reflect inwards in order to better serve the community I am asking these questions.  The mobile monastery pushes my work one step further into an active exploration of solitude and sanctuary in the midst of urban chaos.  This physicalization becomes the metaphor for life now increasingly lived in constant connection.  I have been in a period of deep research into cenobites, hermits and monastic life and believe walking the walk can only aid in talking the talk.

My companion, Cuckoo, the teacup cat

WHAT'S THE DEAL?

The contributions of donors will help me fund an RV that is efficient and modest but can protect myself and my teacup cat, Cuckoo, from the NYC elements.  It will also serve as a hub for outreach projects with the community and with my peers. 

I am asking for my goal amount in order to purchase, license, insure and inspect a 20' mobile home.  I am looking at models that are post 1980 for maintenance reasons and that are all-inclusive so I won't have to purchase an additional vehicle to haul a camper. I have been looking at used mobile homes on Craigslist in the $2,000-4,000 range.  I cannot ensure that the purchase will be made in state so I am also accounting for license plates/title (est. $45), state inspection (est. $35), a years worth of insurance (est. $500) and the purchase of a NYS reduced cost solar panel (est. $250) to minimize emissions from a propane generator.  Any additional funds will be used to modify the RV with a simple sanctuary aesthetic, inside and out.

My timeline for moving into the RV is based on finding my dream home-on-wheels, but I am aiming for mid January 2014.



Example of a beautifully modified RV mobile home

In the spirit of a traditional monastery, I will include social outreach as a part of my life in the RV.  As part of an ongoing study in civil disobedience I have begun dumpster diving as a part of my practice and would like to devise a way to use my vehicle to donate recovered food to shelters or under-resourced members of the Brooklyn community.  If you are unfamiliar with the practice and logic behind dumpster diving and food reclamation I suggest the insightful and smart documentary Dive! .

Additionally, I have been recovering gorgeous flowers from the trash and using them in recent artworks as floral healing and generally spreading good-will around the city by handing them to people I strike up conversations with.  I'd like to use the Monastery as a place to perfect the art of Ikebana flower arrangement and offer this form of meditative healing to others.

Performance of floral healing at The New Museum for Performa13

OK, HOW CAN I HELP?

Any amount helps to defray the cost of this investment.  Due to the price of rent in NYC I have been unable to save very much for this transition and while I am I comfortable with the challenges of making it work on my own, your donation would help me realize the very highest and best iteration of this dream.

If you are unable to contribute please feel free to share with friends who can.  If you know any press outlets that might be interested in covering this story that would also help, as my mission is not only monetary, but metaphysical: I want to challenge people to re-examine the way they have been programmed to live and discuss alternatives for these lifestyles.  In exploring this project I hope to establish guidelines for one way to live outside of the grid while still embracing the sacred nature of urban space.
story_txt:
WHO R U?I am Genevieve Belleveau, a social practitioner and artist living in Brooklyn, NY.  My work encompasses a broad range of methods and mediums to challenge the accepted modes of operating within the structure of civilized society.  I have been exhibited internationally from large scale immersive installations in Sweden to intimate gatherings of feminist visionaries.  I was recently called "the Queen Bee of the Brooklyn contemporary art scene" by Interview Magazine and have a rich history of working collaboratively with artists, night life organizers and creatives from all walks of life.I have worked as an Mister Softee truck driver in Manhattan for 6 years and more recently as a truck manager for the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck. 
 I consider my experience with mobile vending to be foundational to this
 endeavor and consider my knowledge of truck mechanics, street culture, 
traffic laws and general hustle essential to the success of this project.photo by Angelina DreemWHY, THO?This progression in  my work is a natural extension of my growing concerns with networked culture and the toll it takes on individual spirituality.  The idea of the online acting as a divine space has influenced my work for the past 3 years and is now coming to fruition as the New Ascetic; a tonsured monk avatar I enact on my social media that urges others to examine the roles that the internet plays in their lives and offers helpful suggestions on how to mediate modern age metaphysical dilemmas.  In immersing myself in the unfamiliar challenges of the mobile monastery I am acknowledging the need to reflect inwards in order to better serve the community I am asking these questions.  The mobile monastery pushes my work one step further into an active exploration of solitude and sanctuary in the midst of urban chaos.  This physicalization becomes the metaphor for life now increasingly lived in constant connection.  I have been in a period of deep research into cenobites, hermits and monastic life and believe walking the walk can only aid in talking the talk.My companion, Cuckoo, the teacup catWHAT'S THE DEAL?The contributions of donors will help me fund an RV that is efficient and modest but can protect myself and my teacup cat, Cuckoo, from the NYC elements.  It will also serve as a hub for outreach projects with the community and with my peers.  I am asking for my goal amount in order to purchase, license, insure and inspect a 20' mobile home.  I am looking at models that are post 1980 for maintenance reasons and that are all-inclusive so I won't have to purchase an additional vehicle to haul a camper. I have been looking at used mobile homes on Craigslist in the $2,000-4,000 range.  I cannot ensure that the purchase will be made in state so I am also accounting for license plates/title (est. $45), state inspection (est. $35), a years worth of insurance (est. $500) and the purchase of a NYS reduced cost solar panel (est. $250) to minimize emissions from a propane generator.  Any additional funds will be used to modify the RV with a simple sanctuary aesthetic, inside and out. Additionally, I have been recovering gorgeous flowers from the trash and
 using them in recent artworks as floral healing and generally spreading
 good-will around the city by handing them to people I strike up 
conversations with.  I'd like to use the Monastery as a place to perfect
 the art of Ikebana flower arrangement and offer this form of meditative healing to others.Performance of floral healing at The New Museum for Performa13OK, HOW CAN I HELP? Any amount helps to defray the cost of this investment.  Due to the price of rent in NYC I have been unable to save very much for this transition and while I am I comfortable with the challenges of making it work on my own, your donation would help me realize the very highest and best iteration of this dream.If you are unable to contribute please feel free to share with friends who can.  If you know any press outlets that might be interested in covering this story that would also help, as my mission is not only monetary, but metaphysical: I want to challenge people to re-examine the way they have been programmed to live and discuss alternatives for these lifestyles.  In exploring this project I hope to establish guidelines for one way to live outside of the grid while still embracing the sacred nature of urban space.

story:
ACT-SO is a year-long achievement program designed to encourage high academic and cultural achievement among African-American high school students. Several students compete each year to go the national level.  This year, seven Baltimore County students won and will travel to Orlando, Florida to compete in the sciences, humanities, visual and performing arts, among others.

Each year poses a financial hardship on many of the competing students' families from general preparation just to be able to compete, i.e. art materials, tools, classes, travel, etc.; to providing travel, lodging, meals, etc. for the actual winners.  Your contributions will relieve some of the burden off of the families and allow these students to have an experience of a lifetime.

As stated earlier, your support will fund travel to and from Florida, shipping costs for some of the larger art projects, meals and incidentals for all students, and lodging.

No gift is too small.  If you cannot contribute, please tell a friend and help spread the word.  We need your support.  It takes a village to raise, support and develop our children into high functioning men and women in our society!

 We thank you in advance for your contributions and support.

 We thank you in advance for your contributions and support.

story:
IAM Summary

Home to the largest international airport in the world and a diverse population, Atlanta offers the ideal location to launch the IAM brand. This all-weather, fun and enriching social experience targets the technologically savvy segment of the population as well as art enthusiasts.  We plan to open our doors by the end of 2014 and will be located “inside the perimeter” (ITP).

Never before has Atlanta had an entertainment venue quite like IAM. Rain or shine, IAM provides a stage for guests to make faces, pose, take pictures and discover new things about themselves, family and friends. Paintings, illusions and sculptures set the stage for individuals and groups to create their own masterpieces.  The art is purposely made incomplete and can only be made whole by individuals. We encourage everyone to break out of their normal, hectic, everyday routine and enjoy this carefree experience using the creative right-side of their brain. Let your personality shine and bring out your inner-actor. 

Guests are also invited to share their masterpieces on Facebook and Instagram through posted hashtags. And don't worry, while fun and laughter is a big part of what IAM offers locals and visitors, we also have a focus on being educational and informative about art.

The Impact

The IAM mission is to introduce the Millennial Generation to contemporary and fine art in an interactive and creative way. Our venues will also permit contemporary artists to display their art and expand their following. 

Through partnerships with other organizations, IAM will become a new educational ground, Atlanta tourist attraction, and a primary community destination.

The IAM vision is to make art cool, accessible and democratic.

The concept of interactive art informally originated in early years of photography when people took photos against backdrops. It resurfaced in Japan during the study of optical illusions and was popularized in South Korea in 2010.  In recent time with the popularity of smart phones and social media this concept has gained new appeal. One way or another, when a person takes a photo they become integrated with the background. In case of IAM, the backdrop is the real art that is created and signed by the artist. Our goal is to entertain and introduce guests to interaction with art.

IAM Team Members

Vas Paris, Creator and Co-founder  - holds an MBA degree and a certificate in International Finance.  With a passion for the arts, he has an extensive knowledge of the contemporary art market and artists. In addition to his corporate career, he is a Sunday artist himself.  He creates art, designs jewelry and graphics in his spare time.

Michael Martynov, Co-founder - is a published author on Russian Philosophy and has over 20 years of experience in IT industry where he currently manages consultants and architects.  As a part of his work, he was privileged to visit nearly 60 countries and to be exposed to the variety of cultures on 5 different continents.  He holds MBA degree in Management of Technology from Georgia Institute of Technology. 

Rebecca Covington - earned her Bachelor's of Science degree in Business Administration at the University of Southern California. She currently resides in Atlanta and works in the marketing and brand management field. In her spare time she enjoys traveling, yoga and creative writing.

Juan Peralta - is a Co-Founder of Nukanti Foundation for Children, an entrepreneur at heart, his passions include public service and social projects. He currenly works as a Risk Manager Advisor and you can find him training capoeira or practicing public speaking in Atlanta, Ga. where he resides.

What We Need & What You Get

IAM offers an  all-weather, entertaining social experience in a safe and fun space!  IAM plans to regularly rotate exhibits to keep gain repeat visits, hold contests for the most creative interpretation of the art, and ask guests and the community for feedback on how the museum can be dynamic, fun and entertaining.

The entire project is estimated to cost $100,000 and we are half way short of this goal. We are asking anyone who is passionate for the Atlanta community or The Arts to help us raise the remaining $50,000 we need to open the first exhibit.  

We have finalized a portfolio of sketches that need to be produced to scale.  Brush-for-hire specialists will bring these sketches to life and the money we raise here will pay for the materials to produce the art, the artists and construction of the first exhibit. For your donation we have a range of IAM branded his and hers offerings that you will receive in addition to tickets to the museum (see concepts below).

We will provide regular updates of our progress on our Facebook and Twitter accounts. You can also reach us at (678) 400-9035.


If you prefer to donate via check:

Interact Art Museum LLC
PO Box 76456
Atlanta GA, 30358


Challenges & Plan of Action

During the Civil Rights movement Atlanta was known as "the city too busy to hate".  Unfortunately, at times it also seems to be too busy to love or to have fun:  how else do you explain the departure of Atlanta Thrashers -- a team that had plenty of followers, but not enough ticket buyers?  Or the whooping 9,000 visitors per year at the Museum of Contemporary Art of Georgia? 

This is why we believe that IAM is first and foremost an entertainment and social gathering space. It is somewhere you would go on a date, take your family or hang out with your friends, all for less than the price of going to a movie. Our goal is to make IAM accessible to the masses in regards to location, price and formality.

-- Marketing -- IAM will reach out to the students of Georgia Tech, Georgia State,  Oglethorpe, Emory, Clark Atlanta, and Morehouse College as well as the high schools and middle schools in 13 counties surrounding Metro Atlanta. 

Field Trips: During weekdays we will invite schools to bring students to learn about art and socialize. 

Atlanta Art Festivals: During the summer, we will utilize the almost-weekly art festivals in Atlanta to spread word of the museum, share a few pieces of art to interact with and pre-sell tickets. 

Group Events:  Wedding parties, meet-up groups, families and businesses will be invited to host private interactive parties after hours. 

-- Product -- IAM will create original pieces of art that focus on themes entertaining and meaningful to a North American audience. To gain repeat guests, IAM will adjust our collection based on demand and popularity. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We are also seeking local volunteers to help set up/construct the first exhibit and spread word of mouth.

    Or if you are a local Atlanta artist that is interested in bringing our sketches to life or sharing other work that aligns with our goals, please feel free to contact us.

story:
Please Help Us Fund the 2012 Buffalo Infringement Festival

Every summer, the streets of Buffalo come alive with scores of events by local and visiting theater and dance companies, puppeteers, media artists, poets, comics, musicians, cabaret acts, digital designers, and miscellaneous insurrectionists. The Buffalo Infringement Festival provides artists and audiences of all backgrounds the chance to come together, take chances, push boundaries, and explore uncharted territory because exciting art can happen anywhere, anytime, without a blockbuster budget, or in many cases, any budget at all.

The festival is run by a committed group of volunteers. These people are artists, musicians, educators, parents, engineers, who dedicate a significant portion of their year to putting together this festival.

What We Need & What You Get

While artists do not receive fees directly from the Festival (they do have the option to charge entry to their show), substantial costs are incurred by the organizers for:

  • publicity
  • printing the schedule in ArtVoice Magazine
  • venue fees (they can't all be free)
  • audiovisual equipment
  • other expenses.

These monies are raised via Indiegogo and fundraising events leading up to the actual festival. At the festival, 100% of any door receipts go to the artists. This event would not be possible without your generous donations.

We are offering rewards including mentioning you in our publicity materials, stickers, t-shirts, and festival passes (for those shows that do charge admission). Of course, the greatest reward is knowing that you helped fund a festival in which you can take part.

The Impact

Since 2005, this festival has run every year, and every year it has expanded. We have some new venues this year as well as a lot of new people getting involved. People come from out of town to participate, and the festival brings people to Buffalo who discover venues and local businesses. The festival is visible throughout the year through fundraising efforts and our call to 'Infringe Every Day'.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, here are other ways for you to contribute:

  • Help us get the word out using social media and word of mouth, both for our funding campaign and for the festival itself. You can use sharing tools on Indiegogo.
  • Come to the festival. The schedule will appear in ArtVoice Magazine and online in late July so you can see what is happening when.
  • Volunteer! We are always looking for some more volunteers. We will find something for you to do.

See you in July!

story:
NEWS

22.10.2013

We order the large format printer today and we will start production of the new lampshade series at the end of October. National and International shipping will start in the beginning of November

21.10.2013

MOSTLIKELY X BOICUT got featured at dezeen magazine. Read the article under this link.

18.10.2013

We won the Price for for the BEST PRODUCT at the International Tradeshow BLICKFANG in Vienna.


INTRODUCING MOSTLIKELY

The "mostlikely DIY lampshades" were founded 2012 by Maik Perfahl and Wolfgang List of the interdisciplinary design and architecture collective "mostlikely" based in Austria. The goal was to create complex objects at a low price that can be used as masks, posters, lampshades or something else. To achieve a low price and be able to ship our designs worldwide we deliver our lampshades as construction sets in a role of paper. The customers have to cut out, fold and glue the parts together by themselfes - DIY. The aim of our company is not only to design lampshades, we produce them also by ourselfs. All designs were printed on a large format printer and packed in our workshop in Vienna. In the middle of Europe.


www.mostlikely.at

OUR VISION

Untill now we only produce lampshades in a simple white design. Since some time we have the idea to bring more color in our world and to offer our customers lampshades with designs and color all over. We want to invite artists and designers from all over the world to be part of our company and deliver color designs for our lampshades. For the start of this project we teamed up with the artist BOICUT. We met BOICUT at a trade show in Vienna one year ago. We were excited about his work and the idea of a collaboration was growing in our minds and became reality 3 months ago. BOICUT made exclusive color designs for 10 of our models. We built the prototypes and now we are on the verge of production. And here you come in! For starting the production we need your help! 


INTRODUCING BOICUT

Hi. I am Boicut. I like living in Vienna. I have a strong focus on illustration. Having artistic freedom is important to me. I love table soccer. I love to experiment with new things. I like the opportunity to see new places and meet nice people while doing my thing. I love riding my bike. I like to customize objects. I like to be challenged. Boicut is 24/365. And it feels good. I love beeing passionate. I like good smelling magazines. I get inspired by people that love what they do. I like handmade stuff. I love having a beer with friends. I am thankful for being able to do what I love. This feels like a long journey full of experiences. The collaboration with mostlikely is a new trip & you can be part of it!

www.boicut.com

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

During the work with the artist BOICUT and the production of the first prototypes in full color we had to realise that the oversize printer we use in our office is not good enough to produce prints in high quality. With your help it will be possible to invest in a new oversize printer that makes it possible to deliver our customers high quality prints. With your help it will also be possible to start the production of the BOICUT X MOSTLIKELY collaboration and go on with our vision.



THE REWARDS

In return for your support, we are offering you to be one of the first to receive a lampshade with an exclusive design by the artist BOICUT. The prints are limited to 100 pieces per model. They are signed and numbered by the artist. Exclusive at Indiegogo you get the BOICUT X MOSTLIKELY lampshades with discount. If you like it more simple just choose one of our existing models in pure white design for a reduced price. Find a collection of all existing white models under this link.

CHAPA SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 23x23x18cm

CHETAN SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 25x28x18cm

WANBLI SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 19x24x23cm

CHAPA MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 30x30x24cm

CHETAN MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 35x42x27cm

WANBLI MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 26x32x30cm

CHAPA LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 39x38x30cm

CHETAN LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 45x50x36cm

WANBLI LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 34x43x40cm

GNASKA // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 22x24x59cm


MOSTLIKELY AND BOICUT IN THE PRESS

www.dezeen.com

www.coolhunting.com

www.thisiscollosal.com

www.core77.com

www.monoqi.com

www.etsy.com

www.skirmag.com

www.stafmagazine.com

www.prollyisnotprobably.com

www.ilovegraffiti.de

www.thegap.at


FAQ

How can I contribute using my credit card?

While our campaign has only Pay Pal enabled as payment option, contributors may also select the "Pay as a Guest" option to charge to a credit card without logging into a Pay Pal account. Please follow this link for more details on credit card payments. To view the link you have to switch to English language.

Is the shipping price included in my contribution?

Yes, the shipping price is included in the perks (National and International).

When will the do it yourself (diy) lampshades be shipped?

We will start shipping in the beginnig of November 2013.

When the diy lampshades are already shipped how long will it take to my home?

Shipping time in the European Union will be 5 working days with UPS. You will recive a tracking number.

Shipping time for the rest of the world will be 10 - 15 working days (because of customs) with regular post. You will recive a tracking number.

What is included in my do it yourself lampshade?

The do it yourself lampshade come as print out (Giclée Print) in a role of paper and must be cut out, folded and glued together by yourself.

Construction manual is included.

No glue,no bulb socket and no table lamp is included.

The lampshades for standing lights (Small and Medium ones) come with a "Distance Piece". This "Distance Piece" get attached to the bulb. That way it is possible to use every lamp stand. 

The lampshades for hanging lights (Medium and Large ones) work with bulbsockets that are common for regular lampshades.

What kind of bulbs can I use?

Best is to use energy saving bulbs but it´s also possible to use bulbs up to 60 Watt.

The lampshades are constructed that the paper of the lampshade does not touch the bulb.

ATTENTION: If used as a lampshade, THE PAPER MUST NOT
TOUCH THE LIGHT BULB! 

I have some more questions?

For more information write your questions to: wolfgang.list@mostlikely.at
story_txt:
NEWS
22.10.2013
We order the large format printer today and we will start production of the new lampshade series at the end of October. National and International shipping will start in the beginning of November 



21.10.2013
MOSTLIKELY X BOICUT got featured at dezeen magazine. Read the article under this link.
18.10.2013 
We won the Price for for the BEST PRODUCT at the International Tradeshow BLICKFANG in Vienna.



INTRODUCING MOSTLIKELY

The "mostlikely DIY lampshades" were founded 2012 by Maik Perfahl and 
Wolfgang List of the interdisciplinary design and architecture 
collective "mostlikely" based in Austria. The goal was to create complex objects at a low
 price that can be used as masks, posters, lampshades or something else. To achieve a low price and be able to ship our designs worldwide we deliver our lampshades as construction sets in a role of paper. The customers have to cut out, fold and glue the parts together by themselfes - DIY. The aim of our company is not only to design lampshades, we produce them also by ourselfs. All designs were printed on a large format printer and packed in our workshop in Vienna. In the middle of Europe.


www.mostlikely.atOUR VISION

Untill now we only produce lampshades in a simple white design. Since some time we have the idea to bring more color in our world and to offer our customers lampshades with designs and color all over. We want to invite artists and designers from all over the world to be part of our company and deliver color designs for our lampshades. For the start of this project we teamed up with the artist BOICUT. We met BOICUT at a trade show in Vienna one year ago. We were excited about his work and the idea of a collaboration was growing in our minds and became reality 3 months ago. BOICUT made exclusive color designs for 10 of our models. We built the prototypes and now we are on the verge of production. And here you come in! For starting the production we need your help! 



INTRODUCING BOICUT
Hi. I am Boicut. I like living in Vienna. I have a strong focus on illustration. Having artistic freedom is important to me. I love table soccer. I love to experiment with new things. I like the opportunity to see new places and meet nice people while doing my thing. I love riding my bike. I like to customize objects. I like to be challenged. Boicut is 24/365. And it feels good. I love beeing passionate. I like good smelling magazines. I get inspired by people that love what they do. I like handmade stuff. I love having a beer with friends. I am thankful for being able to do what I love. This feels like a long journey full of experiences. The collaboration with mostlikely is a new trip & you can be part of it!

www.boicut.com

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

During the work with the artist BOICUT and the production of the first prototypes in full color we had to realise that the oversize printer we use in our office is not good enough to produce prints in high quality. With your help it will be possible to invest in a new oversize printer that makes it possible to deliver our customers high quality prints. With your help it will also be possible to start the production of the BOICUT X MOSTLIKELY collaboration and go on with our vision.




THE REWARDS



In return for your support, we are offering you to be one of the first to receive a lampshade with an exclusive design by the artist BOICUT. The prints are limited to 100 pieces per model. They are signed and numbered by the artist. Exclusive at Indiegogo you get the BOICUT X MOSTLIKELY lampshades with discount. If you like it more simple just choose one of our existing models in pure white design for a reduced price. Find a collection of all existing white models under this link.

CHAPA SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 23x23x18cm

CHETAN SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 25x28x18cm

WANBLI SMALL // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 19x24x23cm

CHAPA MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 30x30x24cm

CHETAN MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 35x42x27cm

WANBLI MEDIUM // Flat Size: 1x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 26x32x30cm

CHAPA LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 39x38x30cm

CHETAN LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 45x50x36cm

WANBLI LARGE // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 34x43x40cm

GNASKA // Flat Size: 2x A1 poster in a role // Folded Size: 22x24x59cm
MOSTLIKELY AND BOICUT IN THE PRESS
www.dezeen.com
www.coolhunting.com

www.thisiscollosal.com

www.core77.com

www.monoqi.com
www.etsy.com
www.skirmag.com
www.stafmagazine.com
www.prollyisnotprobably.com
www.ilovegraffiti.de
www.thegap.at


FAQ
How can I contribute using my credit card?While our campaign has only Pay Pal enabled as payment option, contributors may also select the "Pay as a Guest" option to charge to a credit card without logging into a Pay Pal account. Please follow this link for more details on credit card payments. To view the link you have to switch to English language.
Is the shipping price included in my contribution?
Yes, the shipping price is included in the perks (National and International).
When will the do it yourself (diy) lampshades be shipped?
We will start shipping in the beginnig of November 2013.
When the diy lampshades are already shipped how long will it take to my home?
Shipping time in the European Union will be 5 working days with UPS. You will recive a tracking number.
Shipping time for the rest of the world will be 10 - 15 working days (because of customs) with regular post. You will recive a tracking number.
What is included in my do it yourself lampshade?
The do it yourself lampshade come as print out (Giclée Print) in a role of paper and must be cut out, folded and glued together by yourself.
Construction manual is included.
No glue,no bulb socket and no table lamp is included.
The lampshades for standing lights (Small and Medium ones) come with a "Distance Piece". This "Distance Piece" get attached to the bulb. That way it is possible to use every lamp stand. 
The lampshades for hanging lights (Medium and Large ones) work with bulbsockets that are common for regular lampshades.
What kind of bulbs can I use?
Best is to use energy saving bulbs but it´s also possible to use bulbs up to 60 Watt.
The lampshades are constructed that the paper of the lampshade does not touch the bulb.
ATTENTION: If used as a lampshade, THE PAPER MUST NOTTOUCH THE LIGHT BULB! 
I have some more questions?
For more information write your questions to: wolfgang.list@mostlikely.at

story:
The Lowdown!


My fellow Dragon Age fans, DeviantArt watchers and Tumblr followers, friends and... family?

You all know what's up. This here is the calendar to end all calendars. This is the Dragon Age Male Pinup Calendar you've been following for the last 3 weeks. I've been posting teasers on my Tumblr, updating you all with works in progress, and asked for your input on each month. Well I'm really happy to say that it's nearing completion, and will be off to the printers in a couple days time!

For that to happen, I'm going to need to pay for the calendars up front, which is why I need YOUR help to pre-order this calendar!

Whatcha Gonna Get!


There are a couple different options for this calendar.


The $20 dollars is the main thing, the real deal, you get one copy of the calendar shipped to your address AND a copy of the digital version to tide you over while your real copy arrives!


If you are strapped for cash, or for some reason cannot accept the calendar in the mail (prying eyes) I also have an option for people to buy a digital-only version of the calendar.


For the people who want a little something special with their shipped calendar, I have the $30 option which includes the digital AND physical copy of the calendar mailed to them WITH a drawing of a Dragon Age hunk of their choice! WOWZA! There's only 20 of those you can buy, so get on that fast!


*EDIT*

Man… I HONESTLY didn’t know that the sketch option of the calendar would be so popular.

If people still want one with a sketch, just donate 10 extra dollars to the campaign, tell me you want a sketch and what of, and I’ll make sure yours gets a sketch as well!


Milestone Prizes



$5000 - Alistair marker picture collaborated between caiterhe and I


$6000 - 3 drawings (Tuxedo Alistair, Sebastian/Anders Braveheart, Once Upon a Fade sketch)


$7000 - Commission extravaganza! 3 commissions available.


1 by Milli, a 1 character sketch of the Dragon Age hottie of your choice

1 by Kamidoodles, 1 character lineart with shadows added

1 by me, 1 character of your choice with flat color


$8000 - A full set of Dragon Age dudes headshots on Kraft paper with art by me, in this style: http://jakface.tumblr.com/post/5428387444/fenris-headshot-playing-around-with-my-super of Fenris, Alistair, Anders, Sebastian and Zevran.


$9000 - A print of my piece the Hero Of Ferelden from Zazzle.com! The 17 X 34 one, mailed anywhere in the world!


$10,000 Okay this is special, guys! For one, I will do a fully CG’d special “CENTERFOLD” piece of the Dragon Age character (any of them) of their choosing. Can be another character, can be one already done. Printed out and mailed along with it with the full resolution emailed to them.


ALSO - if I manage to raise $10,000, I WILL DONATE $1000 TO CHILD’S PLAY CHARITY.


Extra Information

Guys, this calendar took me hours upon hours and weeks and weeks of solid work to do. I wanted to pour every ounce of my talent into this calendar and pictures to bring you guys something you'd be more than happy to pay money towards. That said, once you get the digital copies of the pictures - P.L.E.A.S.E do NOT redistribute the pictures anywhere online, or upload them anywhere! You can of course show them to your friends, but if they like them as well, ask them to consider donating towards the calendar so that they can get copies of their own. I am a rent-paying, food-consuming, happy starving artist just trying to make ends meet, and if one person gets the calendar only to spread the pictures/scan them and spread them around, then I would have spent the money to make the calendars for nothing! I WILL EVENTUALLY upload the pictures to the internet in a MUCH smaller file format without the calendar information, and probably crop them, but you are getting, first hand, all of the artwork in full resolution, which I don't normally dish out. Plus once I run the calendars the first time, that's it! Then they'll be gone forever!

So I thank you all in advance for reading this and following the rules. If this all goes smoothly, I am more than happy to continue with the FEMALE version of the calendar after summer!

Also just so everyone knows...
The digital calendars will ONLY get sent out once the campaign is over at the end of the 10 days. IT was going to be when I reached the target amount, but I reached that way too soon (not that I'm complaining, lol!) but I haven't finished the pictures yet, so they'll be sent out when all 10 days are up! :D So just bear with me another week and they will be off to you! <3

"IN PEACE, VIGILANCE
IN WAR, VICTORY
IN DEATH, SACRIFICE"
--the Grey Warden motto

story:
(GERMAN BELOW! FÜR DEUTSCH RUNTERSCROLLEN!)

Allow me to introduce myself

Emerging. Artist.

Austrian born-and raised, everything I have ever been good at or interested in has been art-related. The moment I could put pen to paper, I started drawing and writing my own stories, winning my first international prize at 13 years old. At age 16, I got in touch with the urban dance scene of Europe. Upon graduating from a high school with a focus in singing and music, I spent half a year travelling to New York and around Europe. In NYC was also where I was introduced to Voguing and Waacking, two dance styles I now teach as one of the pioneers in Austria. I have studied dance in Canada and am currently enrolled in a singing education in Vienna.
For the rest of this year, I have been invited to perform in various countries all over Europe. Though those opportunities are all amazing, I am usually expected to come up for the travel costs and accomodations myself. Together with money for costumes, my endeavour to build working relationships and creating my vision on stage is asking for quite a bit of a budget - a budget I do not yet have.
 
 

What you get:

If you decide to support me, you are taking me one step further down the road of becoming an established artist. The festivals I am invited to (for example, Abundance 2013 in Sweden or the MiXer artist residency in Slovenia) give me an opportunity to create and perform original work as well as establishing relationships for future projects. Also, the money will help me recreate my vision on a more polished level than now. And this is how I wanna say THANK YOU:

  • My visual artwork called "trans:forming beauty" focuses on the aesthetic of drag queens and transgendered women. You could find a drawing as a personalized postcard in your mailbox!
  • The fairytale of HanZ and Gretchen, my two stage personas, is told in my voice. Be the first to listen to one of my original songs!!
  • Have you ever wanted a  private dance class? Personal make-up tips from a drag queen? A one-on-one singing lesson via Skype? Well - here you go!!

Please check out the gallery to see more of my work and a taste for how the perks will look like!!

 

What you give:

If I reach my goal, I will be able to go places I have never been, while sharing my art with a community that has never been exposed to what it is that I am doing. You can help me stand on my own feet as an independent artist and create work in a quality that speaks for itself.
 

Can't donate?? If you can't give any money at this point, please consider sharing this campaign via e-mail, on your Facebook or Twitter page. I would be very grateful if you gave me more exposure that way.

Love,

HanZ

 

 

Das bin ich:

Nachwuchs. Künstler.

Geboren und aufgewachsen in Österreich, hatte alles, was mich je interessiert und das Beste aus mir herausgebracht hat, mit Kunst zu tun. In dem Moment, in dem ich einen Stift in der Hand halten konnte, begann ich, meine eigenen Geschichten zu schreiben und illustrieren. Meinen ersten internationalen Preis gewann ich mit 13 Jahren, und mit 16 kam ich zum ersten Mal mit der urbanen Tanzszene Europas in Berührung. Nachdem ich mit musikalischem Schwerpunkt vom Gymnasium maturierte, verbrachte ich ein halbes Jahr damit, New York und verschiedene Städte Europas zu besuchen. In New York wurden mir auch zum ersten Mal die Tanzstile Voguing und Waacking vorgestellt, die ich nun als einer der Pioniere in Österreich unterrichte. Ich studierte zeitgenössichen Tanz in Kanada und befinde mich derzeit in einer Gesangsausbildung in Wien.

Für das restliche Jahr wurde ich in verschiedene Länder in Europa eingeladen, um dort zu performen. Obwohl jede einzelne dieser Möglichkeiten großartig sind, wird üblicherweise von mir erwartet, Reise- und Unterbringungskosten selbst zu decken. Gemeinsam mit dem Geld, dass ich für Kostüme ausgebe, ist mein Vorhaben, Arbeitsbeziehungen zu schaffen und meine Vision auf die Bühne zu bringen mit einem nicht unansehlichen Budget verbunden - einem Budget, dass ich derzeit nicht habe.

 

 

Was du bekommst:

Falls du dich entscheidest, mich zu unterstützen, begleitest du mich auf dem Weg, ein etablierter Künstler zu werden, ein Stück. Die Festivals, zu denen ich eingeladen worden bin (wie z.B. Abundance 2013 in Schweden oder die MiXer Künstlerresidenz in Slowenien) erlauben es mir, meine eigene Arbeit zu kreieren und performen. Sie helfen mir auch dabei, Beziehungen zu bilden, die für Kollaborationen in der Zukunft wegweisend sein werden. Das gespendete Geld wird auch dafür hilfreich sein, meine künstlerischen Vorstellungen präziser umzusetzen.

Und so will ich dir DANKE sagen:

  • Meine bildnerisches Kunstprojekt, das den Namen "trans:forming beauty" trägt, nimmt die Ästhetik von Drag Queens und Transgender-Frauen unter die Lupe. Du könntest eine meiner Zeichnungen in deinem Briefkasten finden!
  • Das Märchen von HanZ und Gretchen, zwei Charaktere, die ich auf der Bühne verkörpere, wir mit meiner Stimme erzählt. Hör eines meiner selbstkomponierten Lieder als einer der Ersten!!
  • Wolltest du immer schon einmal eine private Tanzstunde? Persönliche Make-up Tipps von einer Drag Queen? Eine Gesangsstunde via Skype? Jetzt kannst du das alles haben!

Bitte schau auf der Gallerie vorbei, um mehr meiner Arbeit und die oben genannten "Perks" anzusehen!

 

Was du gibst: 

Falls ich mein Ziel erreiche, werde ich in der Lage sein, an Orte zu reisen, an denen ich noch nie gewesen bin, während ich meine künstlerische Arbeit mit Gemeinschaften teilen, die eine solche Arbeit noch nie gesehen haben. Du kannst mir dabei helfen, als eigenständiger Künstler auf eigenen Beinen zu stehen und Arbeit zu kreieren, die für sich selbst spricht.

 

Falls du derzeit kein Geld spenden kannst, würde ich mich freuen, falls du diese Kampagne per E-Mail, auf Facebook oder Twitter teilen könntest.

Alles Liebe,

HanZ

HanZ

story:
The story

During the first week of January, in a small city in South America (Pasto - Colombia), people from different regions get together, to celebrate the abolition of racism and the blending of cultures. 

During four days the whole city stops its daily activities, to observe and admire pieces of art that cover every street.

This is a unique carnival in the world, where artists work hard to bring to life myths and legends of ancient civilizations. In the last day, the floats parade is the main event. Incredible movile sculptures builded manually by artesans of the region will be shown to thousands of people. You will also be able to enjoy the event by television or ONLINE STREAMING.

Why are we here?

Building a float is not an easy task, the artists behind the projects work hard to contribute with their creations, but money is always a problem. Only one of around 20 floats will receive the prize they need to recover the investment they make to participate and keep alive this festival that has been declared intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

The risk behind participating plus the lack of resources are barriers that have a direct effect over the quality of those creations and limitate the impact of the message they try to send.

With your support, working conditions will be improved, new techniques can be learn and used, and the labor and imagination of an authentic artist will be recognized.

The Artist

His name is Raul Ordoñez, he is one the most important artesans of the Carnival because of his creativity and talent that is expressed in 9 winner floats.  

He has participated internationally, showing to the world a little sample of this Carnival and proving why it is considered the single most significant event in the country for cultural expression of different races

 

 

 

The Float

This year the work is focused on paying homage to the Amazonas rainforest with an amazing structure that will catch the attention of the crowd and will send a message of environmental awareness to thousands of people.

Amazonas, Endangered Paradise
story_txt:
The story
During the first week of January, in a small city in South America (Pasto - Colombia), people from different regions get together, to celebrate the abolition of racism and the blending of cultures. During four days the whole city stops its daily activities, to observe and admire pieces of art that cover every street.This is a unique carnival in the world, where artists work hard to bring to life myths and legends of ancient civilizations. In the last day, the floats parade is the main event. Incredible movile sculptures builded manually by artesans of the region will be shown to thousands of people. You will also be able to enjoy the event by television or ONLINE STREAMING.

Why are we here?
Building a float is not an easy task, the artists behind the projects work hard to contribute with their creations, but money is always a problem. Only one of around 20 floats will receive the prize they need to recover the investment they make to participate and keep alive this festival that has been declared intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.
The risk behind participating plus the lack of resources are barriers that have a direct effect over the quality of those creations and limitate the impact of the message they try to send.

With your support, working conditions will be improved, new techniques can be learn and used, and the labor and imagination of an authentic artist will be recognized.
The Artist
His name is Raul Ordoñez, he is one the most important artesans of the Carnival because of his creativity and talent that is expressed in 9 winner floats.  
He has participated internationally, showing to the world a little sample of this Carnival and proving why it is considered the single most significant event in the country for cultural expression of different races
 

 
 
The Float
This year the work is focused on paying homage to the Amazonas rainforest with an amazing structure that will catch the attention of the crowd and will send a message of environmental awareness to thousands of people.
Amazonas, Endangered Paradise

story:
An Artsy Winter Retreat

 Hello and thank you so much for visiting! My name is Annie Russell; I'm an artist in Charlevoix Michigan working in a variety of mediums, most prominantly acrylics in an impressionistic style depicting landscapes and architecture.

  I have an opportunity to paint in historic St Augustine this winter and I'm very excited at the prospect of working with different styles of flora,fauna,and buildings not to mention the amazing color pallet! I'm even more excited about returning to Northern Michigan to share new techniques and ideas with local artists and students. I need a little help though, and that's where you come in! 

What I need and Why

Here's the specifics-

   I am asking for $6,500  for the rent of a small house/studio space. This is for the months of January-April. This amount covers the rent and all utilities. The house is furnished and a 10 minute walk to St Augustine's Old Town.

  If the full amount is not collected I will contact the house/studio owner about adjusting the time and/or rental fee. I'm positive that this will not be necessary -- You guys rock and I just know that The Arts and Artists are still important to the health of our communities!

   I plan on using the winter to expand my artistic horizons and learn different techniques at retreats and classes offered in the area and in turn bring these new skills back to Northern Michigan to teach others at monthly workshops. Winters in Northern Michigan and very long and very cold--not at all conducive to insprational endeavors! Please support the arts by supporting an Artist's dream....

 

 

The Impact

  My family and I have lived and worked in Northern Michigan for 25 years. We've raised 2 amazing children to young adulthood and I've worked many low wage jobs in order to financially contribute to not only our family, but participation in art festivals and galleries.

 The long winters with no sunlight, very little work, and no children to keep me occupied have resulted in a door of opportunity opening; a chance to spend a warmer, lighter winter in St Augustine painting and expanding my artistic soul.

 Why should you help?

 * When you support one artist you support the greater community of The Arts

 * You can get awesome art in exchange

 * Helping another person just feels good!

Other Ways You Can Help

  Any and all help is appreciated! If you are unable to contribute to my artistic opportunity financially could you please

 * Get The Word Out! -- check out the share tools and send my campaign to your friends and to your social media pages

  * Email this link to friends and family that you think may have an interest in contributing to The Arts by way of an individual Artist

 * Take a moment and think positive thoughts for me--send those happy vibes out!

story:
Me

Hi! My name is Melissa, I'm 21 years old, and I love taking pictures more than doing just about anything else. This is my passion. I'm trying to get to art school to study what I love, but it's proving to be a little bit difficult.

I started taking pictures roughly five years ago, in my sophomore year of high school. I've been hopelessly hooked since then. I started off taking pictures digitally, but in the past year and a half or so, I have completely immersed myself in traditional darkroom photography, which I intend to formally study to the fullest extent that I can.

I specialize in portraiture, nudes and other figurative work. In my pictures, I have a tendency of exploring relatively adult themes (sexuality, fetishism, objectification, oppression, gender roles, etc.) from my own sometimes childlike perspective.

I also use photography to cope with my PTSD and subsequent OCD and anxiety disorder. Through photography, the self-expression that comes with it, and my deep connection to the process of making pictures from shutter click to finished print, I feel a lot happier. :)

 

The Story

Around this time last year, I was accepted to a wonderful art college in the Pacific northwest - my dream school, actually. Their curriculum has a strong emphasis on artmaking in many different mediums, and their photography program is deeply film-based.

I made all my necessary preparations: deposits for meal plans and housing were made, financial aid was applied for, necessary items were purchased, and all other things were put in order. There was a large portion of my tuition (about $20,000 dollars for the year) that financial aid was not going to cover, and even though neither I nor my family has enough money to even begin to cover that, I wasn't worried at the time because I was assured getting and dealing with student loans were no problem.

When the time finally came for the loan application, I was denied.

Shocked, I applied again, with a different lender. The same thing happened.

I continued to try to get approved for the loan I needed with different lenders and co-signers, but the same thing continued to happen. As it turns out, it's not as easy getting a student loan as you'd think.

I had to defer my enrollment for two semesters because of this. This upcoming school year, I'm desperate to finally get to my school. I've been working retail jobs and doing whatever I can to get myself closer to this goal. Unfortunately, the community college courses I attend now are sucking up most of my resources as it is, and I need all the help I can get to transfer to my new school this fall!

 

What It'll Take to Get Me There

The $3,000 I have set as my goal will get me through about half a semester of tuition, so I would love to exceed that goal if at all possible! If I finally manage to get the loans I need this year, I will use whatever money I get from this project to pay for housing, art supplies, and the big move up the coast from CA to WA.

I know this is kind of a longshot, but my neighbor suggested I give this a shot to raise money for my tuition, so I figured why not?

 

Where to See My Work

To see examples of the pictures I take, please take a look at my two medium-specific online portfolios:

Please note that both of the links below contain artistic depictions of nudity.

Digital photography blog

Analog photography blog

The above links go to the respective blogs I refer to in the perks on the right hand side.

A quick note regarding perks - A great deal of my work contains nudity and is considered NSFW. If you'd like to take a look at a less adult collection of my work, please look at the gallery on this campaign page. If you'd like to recieve a more SFW, no-nudity image for your perk(s), please let me know ahead of time!

 

Thank you so much for your interest in my campaign, and I hope you have a magnificent day!

- Melissa

story:
Short Summary

My name is Amanda Malkin and I am a conservator of works of art on paper. I have made the decision to take charge of my life by starting a private paper conservation practice, with the ultimate goal of living a more deliberate, slower-paced life.

My campaign is a humble request for funds to purchase the main piece of equipment that will help me jump start this business. The piece is called a suction platen and will be used to reduce stains on works on paper, in addition to other localized treatment techniques. A large majority of paper-based objects exhibit damaging and disfiguring staining, which have the potential to further deteriorate with age. These stains can be caused by water-damage, degraded tapes and adhesives, mold, or contact with acidic materials.  

Purchasing this suction platen, would allow me to take on the amount of work I would need to get this business started, while helping to preserve material culture and lengthen the lives of paper-based objects. These objects can include historical documents, scrapbooks, prints, drawings, watercolors, maps, or any other type of art on paper .

Creating this business will allow for the flexible career I desire, in order to live a more conscious, slower-paced life. 

What I Need and What You Get

The suction platen and vacuum pump unit will be purchased from a manufacturer of conservation supplies and equipment. The platen costs $865 and the vacuum pump costs $3,230. Total shipping is $235 making the total cost $4,330.

For your generous contributions, I will send you handmade paper-based art!

Depending on the level of contribution, I will mail you a handwritten thank you note on handmade paper, a hand-bound blank journal, or, a unique papercut, created by me. You can see examples of this work here: www.flickr.com/photos/ahmalkin/

All contributions are gratefully appreciated and will contribute to helping me start this business. Stop by my site www.paperlovesconservation.com to see me in action, once I purchase the suction platen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Tell others about my campaign and my business! The more people know, the more artwork and people will benefit.

story:
What is this show about?

My name is Lilly Scharf and I am currently in my final semester in the Arts Administration Master of Arts program at the Savannah College of Art and Design. My graduate thesis project requires me to fundraise, market, curate, and execute an event on my own, and I have chosen to create Wanderland arts exhibition. 

I asked artists to submit work to me that transported the viewer into a different world using the fantastic works from writers Lewis Carroll, J.R.R. Tolkien, and artist Henry Darger as inspirations. In return, I have received a collection of art to display that challenges ideas of reality, shows great extensions of the imagination, and ultimately, are works embodying skilled craftsmanship. 

The show will take place at Sulfur Studios in Savannah, Georgia August 6th – 8th with the opening reception the night of August 7th from 6:00-9:00 pm as a part of Art March Friday.

Funding this Indiegogo campaign will help me realize this event by purchasing the necessities that an arts exhibition requires, and to promote amazing talent from local, out-of-state, and international artists. 

What Wanderland Needs and What You Get in Return!

To fund Wanderland successfully I require a total of $1,200, and the budget is broken down as follows:

·  $500 for the gallery space rental fee

·  $350 to cover marketing expenses including posters, post-cards, stickers, and exhibition catalogs.

·  $250 to for food, drink, and utensils at the opening reception on August 7th.

·  $100 for a vinyl decal, labels, and wall hanging supplies for the installation.

If you donate to my campaign you will receive the following perks:

·  $5 – I will snail mail you a  letter that may include doodles, tea-stains, and a thank you from me.

·  $10 – you will receive the $5 perk as well as a Wanderland sticker!

·  $20 – you will receive all $10 perks AND a mystery handmade item made by me. It’s a mystery to both you and I until I make it.

·  $50 – all $20 perks including Wanderland event poster AND your name listed as a recognized donor in the exhibition catalog! What honor!

·   $100 – all $50 perks and a private tour of the exhibition with the curator, me.  (only 10 available).

·  $200 – all $100 perks and your name prominently displayed in a hand written calligraphic poster during the exhibition for all to acknowledge your greatness (only 5 available).  

If I do not reach my goal I will make sure the necessary event space and installation materials will be covered first because the show must go on. 

If you cannot donate here are some other ways to help:

·  Attend the event open August 6th-8th at Sulfur Studios in Savannah, GA hours from noon to 5pm or the opening reception on August 7th from 6-9pm.

·  Join the hubbub by sharing images, thoughts, reactions on social media using #wanderlandexhibit.

·  Join and follow updates on Wanderland Facebook event found here. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/449137308578731/

story:
Own Way is a contemplation of our desires towards higher goals.  When we choose our life path, we cannot predict where it will lead us.  In the same way we don’t know where the stairways of Own Way will lead until we actually reach the top.

The Own Way Team

Own Way project and team are from Russia.  Each member of our team is a professional in his own sphere – we are architects, engineers, designers, artists, interior decorators, camera operators, writers, translators, event managers, and mischief makers.  Together we create our art.  We have created numerous installations and art objects for festivals in our own country and several Burning Man projects.  You may already know us as the authors of the Cradle of Mir project at Burning Man 2013 and the Russian Library Souk at the 2014 festival.


This is Your Own Way

Many of us think about these things… We  set goals and have dreams, dreams which become the stars we reach for.  But none of us can tell at the beginning what awaits us at the finish line.  We take risks, make decisions, turn left or right and have the stars decide our destiny. What awaits burners at the end of Own Way’s flight of stairs remains a secret that we must discover on our own.  And if you don’t like what you find there, you can always begin a new ascent – just as in life.

What it Looks Like

Five stairways intersect, together forming a pentagram.  We chose this figure for its uniquely ambiguous and enigmatic history.  Over thousands of years, this 5-sided star has accumulated new and different meanings: a powerful and sacred symbol of freedom, a protective ward, a sign of evil, the accursed.  And that history continues – even today each of us finds in it his or her own personal meaning.


The rainbow, a symbol that connects heaven and earth, welcomes and beckons burners on our upward journey.  And even at night it will shine and help us rise ever higher. 


Construction

Our art object is thirty-eight feet high, built on a foundation sixty-two feet across.  Each of the staircases will rise eighteen feet over the surface of the Playa.


Depending upon where you stand, they may be transparent or hidden by the unusual construction of the beams.  The object is an optical illusion, like a mirage in the desert.

The object will be one of the tallest at the festival.  It will be constructed mostly of wood.  On Friday, in the last rays of the setting sun, it will burn.

What the Money will Go To

This year, Own Way was awarded a grant from Burning Man.  That grant is extremely important for the project, but in the end it only covers a portion of the materials from which the object will be built.  We will still need to be supplied with numerous power tools, workshops space, wood transport to the Playa, and much more for Own Way to become a reality.  Our expenses are higher yet as we are coming from so far away.

We are in real need of the generous support of crowdfunders – of all of you who may themselves eventually walk the stairs of Own Way, anyone who appreciates our vision and would want to see the project built.

We are on a long and difficult journey and even the smallest contribution can help us to make the next step.

We strongly believe that only together can we create our OWN WAY. 

Rewards

Check out Gallery and Updates sections for more images.
Shipping is added only for countries other than Russia and the US!




Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, Vkontakte and Twitter!
