story:
The Project

The Ritz Poster Project is a series of gig posters featuring some of the most influential musical artists to pass through South Texas during the 1970s.

In collaboration with original artist Tony Garner & Roy Smith, The Ritz Theatre has brought these iconic posters out of the vault in order to preserve the precious musical history of South Texas and to serve as a reminder of some of the greatest years of live music.

Now, for the first time in 40 years these historic posters are being made available to the public.

The Posters

During the 1970s South Texas artists Tony Garner & Roy Smith were commissioned to create over a dozen promotional posters for The Ritz. This hand-picked collection highlights their amazing artistic prowess as well as some of the most historic musical artists to hit the stage.

Willie Nelson, October 12, 1974  (Art by Tony Garner)

Bo Diddley, December 31, 1974 (Art by Roy Smith)

Jimmy Buffett, December 6, 1974 (Art by Tony Garner)

The Rewards

The Funding

Your pledge will go to the printing of the posters, all remaining funds will go toward the restoration of The Ritz Theatre.

About The Ritz

Originally a playhouse when it opened its doors in 1929, The Ritz has seen many changes during its 86 year history. Most notably, The Ritz was transformed into one of the premiere musical venues in Corpus Christi during the 1970s and 80s. Legendary artists such as Willie Nelson, Jimmy Buffett and Metallica, all passed through the doors of The Ritz leaving their mark on the historic venue.

To many The Ritz holds a special spot in their hearts for being the place where they experienced their first concert.

The Artists

Over the past 40 years, Corpus Christi native Tony Garner of Faded Love Graphics has worked on hundreds of posters, flyers, and various designs & artwork. His creations are brought to life with his distinctive hand drawn style. Each piece is filled with Garner’s unique personality and southern aesthetic.

Roy Smith of Morehead, Dotts, and Rybak was another notable graphic designer during the time. Designing dozens of posters for The Ritz in the 1970s.

They were the go-to artist for the Ritz and created original artwork for most of the concerts that happened at the music hall.

How You Can Help

Back this campaign by selecting one of our exclusive rewards and pledging the amount of your choice.

Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Google + and email by using the share buttons on the top left hand of this page.

Tell everyone you know and together help make The Ritz Poster Project come to life!

story: I want to make my room into a tropical paradise. I have some lovely plants and now have a hammock up. Im going to make some waves out of paper and put them on the wall. Next to this i want to make a fake waterfall, , however it just wont be complete without a life-sized cutout of Peter Andre with his lovely little denim shirt and curtains. I have spoken to someone and they are up for making a custom screen printed cutout. Please help my dream come true!

story:
ABOUT the Studio

Hi! We are Paige Barnes, Sheri Cohen, Anna Conner, Aiko Kinoshita and Amelia Reeber, the current and dedicated stewards of Open Flight Studio (OFS). OFS is a beautiful and historical art space in the heart of the University District in Seattle, WA. Run by artists since 1954,  Open Flight is a community space for dance and movement research, music, performance and training. 

We are asking for your support so Open Flight can serve artists, movers of all levels, and audiences for years to come.


                  

++++ WE NEED YOU ++++



Open Flight is in need of some TLC - The studio has been in use for almost 60 (!) years and needs some care and upkeep. We hope you'll pitch in so OFS can  serve the community even better.

We would like to purchase a new stereo, repaint the walls and make repairs to the wood floor.

What's more, if we reach our fundraising goals, we can bring back our beloved Flight Deck Residency in Summer 2016.

Flight Deck gives up to 40 hours of studio space to artists to use however they choose. In the past artist have used the residency to research a brand - new idea, workshop a work in progress or complete a creative project. At the end of the residency, artists share what they have been working on in an informal performance.

 Former Residents include  Zoe Scofield, Jody Kuehner, Wade Madsen, Alice Gosti, Rosa Vissers and so many others. It's an incredible program and we want it to return! 


Photo by Joseph Lambert / Jazzyphoto 

Give a little, give a lot. Any gift makes a difference.


YOUR SUPPORT WILL FUND

  • Reinstating the flight deck residency program in 2016 
  • New sound system
  • A vacuum cleaner (yes, we really do need one)
  • Operational costs for upkeep and maintenance
  • AND will help keep the space affordable for artists

The time to support is now! Please share the love with OFS and keep the longest running dance space in the city alive and thriving. Help us cherish this amazing space!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute but love our work? Please share this campaign with your people and networks. It’s easy: just use the tools provided by Indiegogo.  


WE THANK YOU SO MUCH!
Yours, The OFS Team

story:
Author James Clear has works covered by dozens of major media outlets including The New York Times, Entrepreneur, TIME, and on CBS This Morning. Clear combines ideas from biology, neuroscience, psychology, philosophy, and more in articles and newsletters written to help people live better lives. In his Make More Art article, posted in the Huffington Post, in Dec of 2016, Clear concluded that one should create more than one consumes.

https://azarts.gov/news/new-report-describes-po...

There are both physical and mental benefits from creating art, expressing yourself in a tangible way, and sharing something with the world. I’m trying to do more of it each week, and I’d encourage you to do the same.  In our always-on, always-connected world of television, social media, and on-demand everything, it can be stupidly easy to spend your entire day consuming information and simply responding to all of the inputs that bombard your life.  Art offers an outlet and a release from all of that. Take a minute to ignore all of the incoming signals and create an outgoing one instead. Produce something. Express yourself in some way. As long as you contribute rather than consume, anything you do can be a work of art.  Open a blank document and start typing. Put pen to paper and sketch a drawing. Grab your camera and take a picture. Turn up the music and dance. Start a conversation and make it a good one. Build something. Share something. Craft something. Make more art. Your health and happiness will improve and we’ll all be better off for it.

https://www.huffingtonpost.com/james-clear/make...

 

Pablo Picasso famously said, “Every child is an artist. The problem is staying an artist when you grow up.” Recent scientific research gives this axiom tangible meaning for older adults by demonstrating that involvement in creative pursuits has a positive effect on physical health, mental health, and social functioning as a person ages, regardless of their ability 

https://ohioartscouncil.wordpress.com/2014/12/1... 

 

Quincy, founder of the Work of Art Dance Theater (WOA) and subsidiary: Quincy Projects recognized and responded to the above findings over 10 years ago.  As a young performing artist himself, having experienced the life-saving benefit of the arts through dance, theater and music; Quincy founded the 501c (3) Work of Art Dance Theater to bring transformational arts to the central New Jersey community.  The Theater consists of a professional dance company and the Work of Art School of Performing Arts. The school is currently on hiatus due to funding. (Ohhhh-Nooooo!!!) A priority of WOA School of Performing Arts is to ensure the classes in various genres are available to everyone at a fraction of the cost of traditional or competition schools, as the benefits of being involved in the arts are too great to deprive anyone of them.  

The dance company is proud to have presented full-length works at: George St. Theater, Crossroads Theater, NJPAC, Westminster Theater at Bloomfield College, Middlesex County College Performing Arts Center, Hamilton Stage - Union County Performing Arts Center, Unitarian Society of Plainfield and Studio 901.  Many of these performances have hosted urban school youth, women of battered shelters and others longing to see Broadway quality productions without access to Broadway funds.

 

Is this stuff for real? Or do people just like to sing and dance so they don’t have to deal with life? IT’S REAL!

  • The time required to admire, experience or understand and quantify the positive impact of the arts or its influence on people is infinite; we would need to reside in a dimension where we aren’t contained by space and time just to scratch the surface.
  • The impact of the arts listed below are supported by years of research from Princeton University, American Journal of Public Health, dosomething.org and more.
  • Students who study art are 4 times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement and 3 times more likely to be awarded for school attendance.
  • Improves well-being by decreasing negative emotions and increasing positive ones
  • Researchers found that sustained learning in music and theater correlates strongly with higher achievement in both math and reading.
  • Improved medical outcomes, trends toward reduced depression
  • In a study of a high-poverty schools in Chicago, the schools that were participating in the Chicago Arts Partnerships in Education (CAPE) made huge strides in closing the gap between high- and low-income students’ academic achievement.
  • Reductions in stress and anxiety; increases in positive emotions
  • New brain research shows that not only does music improve skills in math and reading, but it promotes creativity, social development, personality adjustment, and self-worth.
  • Reductions in distress and negative emotions
  • Improvements in flow and spontaneity, expression of grief, positive identity, and social networks

https://www.dosomething.org/us/facts/11-facts-about-arts-education

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2804629/

https://www.huffingtonpost.com/james-clear/make-more-art-the-health-benefits-of-creativity_b_8868802.html

For the reasons listed above Work of Art Dance Theater has been providing educational programs to schools, women’s shelters, teen homes, AIDs Relief Associations and halfway houses for over 10 years.   Through the Jersey City and West Orange Boards of Education, Quincy’s “PASS IT ON” program has given children a broader experience of performance art. Our production team works hand in hand with the Board of Education to allow students to attend free performances as a day class trip, thus turning the production into an educational tool.  We offer a backstage tour and provide the chance for students to speak to the cast and creative team about their lives, their art and the development of the production.

Below is clip from one of the most recent workshops: Rutgers Summer Arts Program 2018

It’s borderline impossible to ignore the impact and benefits of creative arts to people and youth that have no other outlet for self-expression -- who suffer from stress related to peer pressure, bullying, emotional upheaval within the family structure and involvement in various forms of social media.   It's equally as hard to ignore or question why Federal funding for the arts and humanities rolls in around $250 million a year, while the National Science Foundation is funded at around the $5 billion mark.

DONATE TODAY! NO AMOUNT IS TOO SMALL!!

 

Everyone is on a Mission these days! What’s yours? Why are you here?

Work of Art Dance Theater Mission

Save and change lives through the arts with music, dance and theater; and ensure the power of performing arts is not lost from one generation to the next.

We promise to do this by:

  • Regular classes
  • Mantra – “I Matter”

I matter and so does my voice. I cannot be silenced. Whether singing or speaking, my message is important.

I matter and so does my movement. I cannot be stifled. It tells a story (maybe my story); this is my time to be in control through time, space and shape. When I dance my movement matters.

I matter and so does my soul and spirit. The deep internal connection between the two allow me to go places, experience things and explore emotions that may never have been part of my world. Only in the theater can I be anyone and share anything. My soul and spirit matter.

The arts matter to me and I matter to the world. I have something special to share.

  • Pop up (work)shops
  • Scheduled performances
  • School assemblies/ presentations
  • Exposing underprivileged communities and people to the timeless gem of the arts

Quincy “The Artist” Projects Mission

Saturate the music industry with hope, positivity and love while creating music to inspire, empower and provoke thoughts of endless possibilities; through a classic, yet neo-futuristic sound.

 

SOUNDCLOUD_Click to Listen to a different full track for free!

 

Why’d you post this campaign now?

We’ve decided to do this campaign and seek collaborative support because enough is enough!  The arts are dying day by day due to various political decisions that majorly impact funding, locally and globally to the loss of faith or lack of awareness of its real power and influence, which must be restored!!!

While the arts have not completely died, they are certainly hurting from funding to awareness. Undeniably one of the most universal and influential art forms is music.  While we are consistently introduced to new artists, the type and content of music produced has drastically changed. The sounds that transcend space, shape, time, geographic location, race, ethnicity, creed, age and gender are diminishing; and sounds that silo and separate us by appealing to a specific group or culture have increased.

Quincy has been on a personal mission to restore that universal, something for everyone, feel good, positive messaged, inspirational, strengthening, empowering and motivating vibe in his music for 7 years.

Within the last month Quincy “the artist” caught the eye of Talent Management Agency (TMA), a professional management company, who has expressed interest in expanding our footprint in the community and his work. TMA would like to spend a weekend with him and his fellow artists to review footage of performances pieces, discuss the Work of Art and Quincy Projects mission, develop his web site and make TMA’s production services, promotion, marketing, tour management and music licensing available to Quincy.  The expenses would involve: the agent’s consulting fee, his travel expense, room and board.

THIS HAS TO HAPPEN NOW!!! This break will facilitate an addition to the arts that can’t be missed. Making an artist like Quincy more visible will undeniably save and change lives. Given the scientific proof that music reduces stress and anxiety, provides a mental escape and has great ability to influence mood and action; people of all ages and cultures will positively benefit from his music and artistic creation. Preservation of the arts will be achieved by moving Quincy forward as an artist, as his heart has never left the foundation of The Work of Art Dance Theater.  This means Quincy’s success in the music industry will come full circle to give life and opportunity to the never ending Work of Art mission. THIS NEEDS TO HAPPEN NOW!!!

 

“So what exactly are you using my money for?” Another great question!

  • Obtain studio space to create a safe place for people from all walks of life to artistically express themselves and increase self-confidence.
  • Purchase equipment for pop up classes, workshops and show.
  • Solidify a team to keep “PASS IT ON” alive
  • A workshop designed for school assemblies K-12 to educate them about the history of dance, introduce them to various art forms and plant the seed of a career in the arts.
  • Obtain professional Artist management for Quincy and the company. 
  • Fund a minimum of 3 theater based, QP concerts for 2019-2020

 

HOW AND WHY SHOULD I HELP?

DONATE and SHARE EVERYTHING ABOUT US!

because the arts have been around since the beginning of time; we cannot let them dissipate AND 99.9% of people, in the world, have enjoyed art in one form or another or had their life saved by the arts.

Be part of the “Keeping the Arts Alive”

  • If you’ve ever felt and experienced happiness, sadness that needed to be released – to free you, excitement, motivation, implemented change – large or small – due to thought provoking music, mended distant relationships or severed those that were toxic, increased spirituality or connectivity to the universe, a sense of comfort by being lost in the “great escape” of music, a movie, dance, lights, sculpture, written literature, spoken word, painting or other art form…YOU UNDERSTAND.
  • If you want to donate/support a cause but weren’t sure which one – Pick Us.

  • If you are striving to become a philanthropist – Start With Us.

 

  • Follow us on    

  • Tell EVERYONE you know about us through word of mouth and all social media apps
  • Visit our website to learn more about us  https://aquincyproject.wixsite.com/aquincyproject 
  • Share this link with EVERYONE you know

DONATE TODAY! NO AMOUNT IS TOO SMALL!!

UPCOMING EVENTS 

"KEEP THE ARTS ALIVE" / DINNER GALA FUNDRAISER 

2018 NEW CHRISTMAS PRODUCTION "MY GIFT TO YOU"

story:
﻿Paracelsus, born Theophrastus von Hohenheim, was a Swiss physician, alchemist, and astrologer of the German Renaissance,author of "The Great Surgery Book", "Astronomia magna", treatises on hermeticism, astrology, divination, theology, demonology. He was a pioneer in several aspects of the "medical revolution" , emphasizing the value of observation in combination with received wisdom. During Paracelsus's lifetime and after his death, he was often celebrated as a wonder healer and investigator of those folk medicines that were rejected by the fathers of medicine (e.g. Galen, Avicenna). It was believed that he had success with his own remedies curing the plague, according to those that revered him. Paracelsus believed that true anatomy could only be understood once the nourishment for each part of the body was discovered. He believed that one must therefore know the influence of the stars on these particular body parts. Diseases were caused by poisons brought from the stars. However, 'poisons' were not necessarily something negative because only the dose determined if a substance was poisonous or not. So if a star or poison caused a disease, then it must be countered by another star or poison, and because everything in the universe was interrelated, beneficial medical substances could be found in herbs, minerals, and various chemical combinations thereof. "Paracelsus' dreams Tarot" is presented in the form of physician's diary. A powerful magical tool enriched with simbolic alchemical language that contains universal knowledge of the past and future,be it biological evolution or innate psychological processes of the human mind. The flesh and its link with the domain of sacred , interrelations between earthly organisms and stars, anatomy indistinguishable from magic- themes revealed on the edge where scientific and occult are intertwining. Truly,an invitation to apprehend the mysterious immensity of the laws of nature. -"As for the Human Skull. It has 22 bones, it sits at the top of the spinal column. The Hebrew alphabet has 22 letters, the 22nd letter, Tav, means Light. At the top of Jacob’s Ladder stood Yahweh, the Light of the world. The light of the body is the eye , says Jesus. 22 is the Number of Light." (Manly P. Hall)

 

Paracelsus'Dreams Tarot Gallery

 

Scroll down for more!

 

 

GOALS

 

This is our plan how you can make Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot better. If you like it please share the information about our campaign wherever you can! Thank you for your support!

*All Early Birds Perks will be upgraded with bag and short booklet!

How you can help?

1. Share campaign with Facebook and Twitter button.

2. Share posts from @dark.synevyr.tarot

 

 

Referral Contest Started!

 

Hello friends! We start a referal contest today!

Create your link and share wherever you can for win!

1st place reward

3pcs Ultimate Fan Set

3pcs Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot

3pcs Paracelsus' Bags

3psc Paracelsus' Posters

3pcs Paracelsus' Reading Clothes

1 for you and 2 for your friends!

2nd place reward

2pcs Ultimate Fan Set

3rd place reward

1pc Ultimate Fan Set

4-34th place reward

Collectible Signed Post Card

More information about Indiegogo referral contest here https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

 

 

PERKS

Handcrafted Poster in Wooden Frame
Handprinted Paracelsus' Ink Stamp
Darks Synevyr Wax Stamp
Old Style Designed Paper
Available Only on Indiegogo Symbolism Explanation
Item on Stock Ships Immediately

The Tower Card Meaning

We want to make 2 types of Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot:

1st it's a retail edition which will be printed in 500 copies and will be available in our store.  Full deck 78 cards with instruction booklet, box and bag. Size 65.5x120mm | 2.57"x 4.72" 320gsm Swiss quality professional linen card stock.  5 Languages Available: English, Russian, Italiano, Espanol, Chinese.

Deck prototype was printed

Cards will have black colored edge

If we reach $2500 all decks will be packed in stylish bag factory made from natural materials with hand printed Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot Stamp

Paracelsus' Dreams Tarot Bag  

Also we will make Indiegogo Limited Collectible Edition Hancrafted​ Bag using a technology of XVI century. 

2nd Perck it's a Limited Collectible Edition which we will make by hand and will charge (box only, deck wiil be printed in publishing house). We will make only 10 signed and numbered box  using a technology of XVI century. 

 Black Edition

Handcrafted Paper 

Handcrafted Vegetarian Wheat Glue

Handcrafted Black Charcoal Ink

Handcrafted Printing Process

Handcrafted Sealing Wax

 

 

Who are we?

 

 

We're http://darksynevyr.com

We make tarot.

We have succesfully finished 2 Compaignes

Unknown Shadows Tarot https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tarot-of-unk...

and

The Manuscript of Initiation Tarot https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-manuscri...

Artist Ivan Murlika

What to Expect?

 

This is a pre-order campaign! We haven’t printed the decks yet—that’s why we’re raising funds on Indiegogo.

The amount that you backed will reserve you a copy of the deck, once it’s printed. 

At the end of this  2 month-long campaign, Indiegogo will send us all the funds we’ve raised. We’ll use that to print the finished decks in whatever quantities we end up needing. 

It’ll take about a month to print the decks, and then another month to transport them from the factory to our warehouse.

Then, once we receive the decks, we’ll ship your own copy! 

We anticipate this whole process (campaign, printing, shipping, and final deliveries of everyone’s order) will take around four months. 

We will post project updates along the way to keep you informed of the progress!

If you have any specific questions about the project, you can feel free to send us a message via Indiegogo’s messaging system, or email info@darksynevyr.com.

 

Risks and challenges

 

THIS IS OUR 3RD CAMPAIGN AFTER TWO SUCCESSFUL. AND WE ARE SO IN LOVE WITH THIS DECK THAT WE WILL PUBLISH IT EVEN IF WE DON'T GET THE REQUIRED AMOUNT AND RETURN ALL MONEY. THIS COMPANY IS ALL OR NOTHING.

List of our Indiegogo Campaigns:

1. The Manuscript of Initiation Tarot

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-manuscri...

2. PinkPain Tarot 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pinkpain-tar...

1. Tarot of Unknown Shadows

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/tarot-of-unk...

Shipping

 

WE WILL SHIP THE DECK CAREFULLY PACKAGED WITH NATURAL FRIENDLY MATERIALS.

story:
Why Should You Contribute?

Through our relationship with Climate Action Business Association (CABA), graffiti artist and friend of CABA, Lawrence Ciarallo has created an inspiring mural to install in a former parking space. While the mural is not a complete or comprehensive representation of the vast number of activists and artists working to create a more loving world, we hope that these four people will inspire conversation about and actions of equity and justice in our community.

  • Melnea Cass was a civil rights activist particularly involved in local community justice initiatives in the Roxbury and South End neighborhoods of Boston.

  • W.E.B. DuBois was a civil rights and anti-war activist, cofounder of the NAACP, editor of The Crisis, academic and prolific author.

  • Mary Oliver is an American poet, who adopted Provincetown as her adult home for many years. Her poetry is centered in a sense of interconnectedness with nature.

  • John F. Kennedy was the 35th President of the United States, during which time he started the Peace Corps and signed Equal Pay Act of 1963.

The four people in this mural represent a spectrum of justice and activism. We know that those represented in this mural is not a complete or comprehensive list. But we also want to create a place that inspire conversations and actions of equity and justice in all who come by this space.

 

What We Need

All of the funds raised go directly to the artist, Lawrence Ciarallo, to support his generous gifts of time, tools, work, and talent.

Can't give money? Here are some other ways you can support the joint mission of Old West & CABA:

  • Share with your friends, coworkers, and family on Social Media! 

  • Be a social justice activist and ally!

  • Vote! (Not kidding. This is so important.)

 

Let's do this together!

Let's do this together!

story:
Help me raise funds for SAVE THE ARCTIC

I'm Glyn Macey, a British artist and serial fundraiser. I'm pretty well known for my work with organisations such as RNLI, UNICEF, National Trust and Greenpeace.

I love to get as many people involved with my projects as possible and over the last 4 years, with the help of many beautiful people around the world I have managed to raise over £70,000 ($100,000) for some great causes.

Well, next up I will be painting my way around the frozen North, and the resulting 100 original studies will be auctioned to help fund the vital work of GREENPEACE - SAVE THE ARCTIC.

This is where I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

In a nutshell I need to raise £500 ($825) towards travel costs, but more importantly I want to get as many lovely folks involved as possible, it's much more fun for me that way! And in return I have a delectable range of juicy goodies for you including exclusive Limited Edition prints, Original drawings, Books, DVD's and Vouchers.

SAVE THE ARCTIC

My goal is to paint 100 original studies whilst traveling the Arctic, everyone of which will be auctioned to raise funds for one of the worlds leading environmental campaign charities Greenpeace and their SAVE THE ARCTIC project.

My last trip in 2014 saw me travel and paint my way across the USA (see the video above), the resulting works raised my friends at UNICEF thousands of pounds helping to fund their vital work with vulnerable children worldwide.

To find out more about me and my work check out www.gullova.co.uk www.glynmacey.com or simply google Glyn Macey.

To find out more about the vital work of Greenpeace SAVE THE ARCTIC check www.savethearctic.org

Other Ways You Can Help

If you could share this campaign with your friends I will love you forever :)

story:
Offrez votre soutien à un organisme canadien qui finance la recherche sur le cancer et soutenez l'art local par la même occasion !

En avril prochain se tiendra ma 2ème exposition solo entre les murs de l’entreprise montréalaise Meubles RE-NO : une exposition d'envergure qui vous en mettra plein la vue !

Afin de mener mon projet à terme et dans le but de financer celui-ci, j’ai décidé d’associer mon art à la bonne cause en offrant de soutenir un organisme qui me tient à cœur, par l’entremise de mes ventes artistiques, entre autres.

Mon choix s’est arrêté sur la Société canadienne du cancer, un organisme axé sur le bénévole national et à caractère communautaire dont la mission est l’éradication du cancer et l’amélioration de la qualité de vie des personnes touchées par ce dernier. Deux raisons expliquent mon choix. 

Premièrement, le plan stratégique pour accomplir leur mission repose sur une méthode efficiente qui a fait ses preuves à maintes reprises. Deuxièmement, le combat que mène la Société depuis 1938 est en constance évolution et devient davantage forcené au fil des ans afin d'irradier au mieux le cancer. J'ai espoir que, dans un futur pas si lointain, chaque cancer ait son remède miracle.

Également, par cet événement, je continue une autre de mes missions, soit de rendre l'art accessible. Quant à ma démarche artistique, elle s'explique par la transparence de mes émotions qui sont transmises sur des canevas vierges. Les couleurs sont donc d'une vivacité éclatante tandis que l'aspect abstrait de mes toiles permettent une unique compréhension pour quiconque, de-là l'accessibilité à tous. 

Comment faire pour soutenir l’art et la cause ?

Afin de rendre cette exposition possible, je demande aujourd'hui votre collaboration financière. Grâce au don de votre choix, vous aidez la création d’art local et me permettez de financer le mois que je consacrerai à la création des toiles (une trentaine) qui seront présentées au public en avril 2016. En échange de votre soutien monétaire, je m'engage à verser à l'organisme choisi  30%* des profits récoltés lors de la vente des toiles. L'événement se déroulera sur deux semaines. Autrement, si l'objectif de ma campagne de socio-financement est atteint, je m'engage à remettre un 200$ supplémentaire à la Société. 

Qu’en est-il des ventes ?

Aucune vente n'est malheureusement assurée lors de l’événement. Cependant, Meubles RE-NO confirme que les artistes réussissent à vendre plus de la moitié de leurs œuvres, grâce aux acheteurs fidèles de l'entreprise.

Pour inciter les potentiels acheteurs à se munir de l'une de mes oeuvres d'art, un prix spécial sera alloué à chaque toile. De plus, une mention spéciale sous l’oeuvre précisera que 30%* des bénéfices iront à l’organisme choisi. Cette mention sera également présente sur chaque publicité de l'événement.

Qui est Meubles RE-NO ?

Pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas l'entreprise, il s’agit d’une compagnie vendant des meubles contemporains de luxe à des propriétaires d'immeubles ainsi qu’à des entrepreneurs de renom, et ce, depuis plus de cinquante ans. 

RE-NO redonne aussi à la communauté québécoise en offrant un espace aux artistes et organismes locaux en lien avec l’art et le design. L’espace, Le 2673 est prêté pour deux semaines à l’artiste qui souhaite présenter une exposition pour laquelle il a carte blanche.

Engagement tout au long du processus de création

Je m’engage à partager le processus de création ainsi que l’événement complet (et toutes informations relatives à celui-ci) sur mes plateformes sociales. Pour une expérience dynamique de collaboration, je vous invite à faire de même! 

La recherche en santé est une cause que je défends avec ferveur et qui me tient grandement à cœur. J’espère que vous saurez partager mon intérêt au sein de ce projet qui rallie art et charité.

Réseaux sociaux

Facebook : www.facebook.com/kvenefimero
Instagram : www.instagram.com/kkvenefimero
Twitter : www.twitter.com/kkvenefimero

*Advenant qu'aucune vente ne survienne lors de cet événement, je m'engage à tout de même verser 30% des profits des toiles vendues dans les six mois suivants l'événement. Ainsi, les toiles seront par la suite mises en vente sur mon site web ainsi que sur les réseaux sociaux.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
Our Story

Please help us with the construction of a 12 foot (3.657m) climbable, ridable, fire breathing Hippocamp. A giant Half horse, half fish (front and back, respectively)!!!


The core concepts behind our project are: 
 
1. To create an interactive project that is easy to assemble (disassemble),  transport, and that, when unattended, holds it's own aesthetically as a free standing art sculpture. 
 
2. Demonstrate what two people, with the help and support of our community, can design, fabricate and share with the art and eccentric building community, both locally and abroad. 
 
3. Illustrate and actualize a combination of ideas, skills, fabrication techniques, and construction mediums including but not limited to: structural engineering, layout, fire sculpture fabrication and their conceptual application of physics, mathematics and other natural sciences in relation to their building practices exemplified by Plumbing, Electrical, Welding and other metal working applications. 
 
We envision bringing these fundamental principles into our shared and celebrated community through the construction of a 12 foot (3.657m) climbable, ridable, fire breathing Hippocamp. A giant Half horse, half fish (front and back, respectively). Our personal motivations for building this particular sculpture and the qualities it will have stem from a long and much deliberated process that evolved over many... drunken nights spent in a metal shop after all the bars closed.

Both David and Noah have a significant amount of experience working within their own specialized fields of interest and involvement with the Burning Man and Burning Flipside community.

Highlights of our artistic and construction experience include:

David Salazar- Iron worker/Metalsmith, crew member for the Texas based  "Fire Tornado" Temple constructed at Burning Man 2009.

Noah Moore- Welder, Electrician, Theme Camp Coordinator, Assistant Manager of the Electrical Crew for DPW (Burning Man 2008-2010), Design and Construction lead for Center Camp and all infrastructure building at Nowhere (Burning Man regional, Spain) 2008. Once got arrested and spent four days in jail for setting off a "Flame Effect" at his friends bachelor party that "Shook windows for a half mile in every direction." And... threw up in front of Lawrence Ferlinghetti (though I didn't find out it was him until the next day). Also drove a 1979 Chevy "Monte Carlo" backwards down an on ramp while it was on fire.

story:
Our Story:

IRONBBRATZ CIC are a not-for-profit organisation which supports creative practitioners. We place a strong emphasis on community and collaboration and strive to make the creative sector in Glasgow more accessible and inclusive. We offer opportunities to our members to participate in unique projects which will improve and publicise their creative profile.


We've got high aspirations and this expansion is just the beginning.  We're not shy about letting people know that we plan to be more than just a terrific studio provider. We will be the most sought after provider of creative professional development opportunities in Glasgow.  We will have the best and most open community, run the best projects and have the most fun.  We will help emergent creative practitioners grow and flourish, keep them engaged in their practice post-study and give them a support network.  We will support discussions that challenge current notions of art and design and create new paradigms to work with.


The activities we undertake to fulfil this are:

  • Provide fairly priced, high quality studio rental (in Glasgow City Centre)
  • Offer portfolio building workshops for application to FE/HE Institutions.
  • Membership subscription to all IRONBBRATZ events such as creative show & tell nights, book clubs and various other networking events.
  • Seek commissions to undertake projects that are socially conscious and geared towards a gaining a deeper understanding of disparate groups of people in Glasgow.
  • Provide space for contemporary art & design exhibitions.

 

If you'd like to see some photos from our projects and exhibitions and learn more about our story please do visit our blog at:  http://ironbbratz.wordpress.com    

The Impact
If we reach our goal of £1500, IRONBBRATZ will be able to support more than twice as many emerging creative practitioners than we currently do. Expansion will allow us to further diversify our creative community and make us a more financially stable organisation thus in turn allowing us to provide more exciting opportunities for our members. Our ethos of community would be further developed and therefore have a larger impact on Glasgow's creative sector.  

What We Need & What You Get
IRONBBRATZ managed to completely refurbish our gallery for £600 from a drab office space to Space Odyssey 2001! With £1500 we would be able to transform another dull office space into a sparkly new set of studios. Your kind donations would be spent on building materials. 

For example:
  • £10/$15 will buy us 4 lengths of timber
  • £15/$23 will buy us 2 sheets of chipboard
  • £30/$46 will buy us 15 litres of paint
  • £50/$77 will buy us someone's labour for a day!
  • £100/$144 will build one complete studio space!
  • £200/$288 will buy us enough paint to cover the entire floor!
  • £400/$600 will build a set of 4 brand new studios! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Volunteers have been the bedrock of our organisation so far! Anyone able to give up some of their time to help us physically build and paint the new studios would be a massive help. 


Spread the word through your e-mail contacts, by word of mouth and at work!

story:
Be a part of the “Celebration!” Exhibit

 

About the Project

Hi there, my name is LaRae Lobdell and I am the founder of PhotoSister.com and the artist behind “The Working Artists of Theatre” project.

The Theatre Project started 16 months ago in January 2012 when I saw a need to give a new visual representation to the people who make up the theatre industry here in Seattle. I wanted to capture the spirit of the people who have made up Seattle theatre not only during the 2012-2013 years, but also those who have been shaping the industry for 10, 20, 30 and even 40 years. People who shaped the entire city’s art scene ON and OFF the stage.

Since then I have personally photographed over 200 individuals in over 16 theatre companies for free or for a drastically reduced rate. But I didn’t stop with just taking the images. Each artist received a full feature on my internationally recognized blog AND I was able to dedicate my professional skills in social media marketing to create a system where everyone wins: the box office had a rise in ticket sales, the artists were recognized and during this movement - for 16 months - Seattle Theatre was elevated.

 

The Impact

Now that this project has reached it’s end, it is my next goal to celebrate the unification of all the people involved with this project. On June 20th of this year, historic ACT Theatre will be hosting the grand finale of this art project in the form of an all-inclusive event titled “Celebration!”  

This large-scale exhibit of all 200 participants I photographed will be displayed over 3 floors of the historic ACT building in downtown Seattle. This entire exhibit will be on display over the course of an entire theatre-season - through October 17th, 2013 - bringing further connection and elevation to all individuals, community and industry for Seattle’s performing arts.

 

What I Need & What You Get

To help me achieve my final goal with the Theatre Project - the “Celebration” Exhibit - I have decided to bring forward this fundraising campaign, my first ever.  The prints and frames alone are thousands of dollars, and this is where you come in!

Help me reach my funding Goal of USD $9,000 - net funds will go to:

  • Printing, framing and mounting for 200 images ranging from 18”x12” to 30”x45” {$8,275}
  • Marketing materials for on-site display thanking contributors and sponsors {750}
  • If fundraising exceeds the goal, I will be able to enlarge a few of the images beyond the 30”x45” size and have a printed book on display of the entire project (contributors receive a digital copy).
  • If I do not reach the funding goal, the event will still go ahead but scaled down from the initial plan.  
  • I am working closely on my budget with the folks at ACT Theatre to make this an amazing exhibit!

Your Perks

I have AWESOME perks for those of you who are able to contribute to meet this goal in the form of individual or corporate sponsorship.

  • Everyone will receive a digital copy of the “Working Artists of Theatre” book by the end of June 2013.
  • Other Individual perks include signed prints, digital screen savers and name listed at the event and on website event page.
  • Corporate Sponsorship is encouraged as 300-500 people will be in attendance on opening night and thousands of people will walk through the exhibit over the 6-month duration. 
  • There are different levels of corporate sponsorship and the perks include logo placement on the website, event pages, email campaigns from both LaRae and ACT Theatre, printed materials at the event, personal lifestyle and editorial shoots, ACTPass memberships, social media mentions and product placement at the event.

 

How you can be a part

Choose to click the “Contribute Now” button on the right and select a perk that fits your lifestyle.

If you are not able to contribute in the form of money, you can show your support by sharing this fundraising link on your favorite social media site such as Facebook, Twitter, Google+, your own blog or even by word of mouth. There are convenient social media buttons right here on this page to make that “share” easy for you.

Thank you in advance, for all your support and contributions in making this goal happen. I look forward to seeing you at the “Celebration!” exhibit and open house event at ACT Theatre on June 20th, 2013!!!

- LaRae Lobdell

story:
Self Portrait

George Linicomn Jr. is an Artist/Designer in Arlington, Texas and creator of "Participative Art". Participative art is an unfinished composition of artwork that is displayed for the public to participate in by following the artist instructions. "The public is no longer just a spectator but a participant in my creative process." There are different styles of participative art, for example: Grid, Dot To Dot, Freestyle and Signature. Signature participative art displays the artistry of a signature and why an interest in something so common is such an important staple in world history. Two motivating reasons exists for presenting this art form to the public. The first is to record individual & public expression through visual creativity. The second reason is to have compositions that are always changing far beyond the life of the artist.


This project will be a collaborative effort to push the creative boundaries of the art world by creating artwork produced by the collaboration of the artist and it's participants. The goal of this project is to establish a new world record for collected signatures and also introduce a new art movement to the art world.The money raised to fund this project will be used to coordinate and advertise with participating venues around the world willing to help in the project. Funding will also purchase and ship materials(To and from), the venues. In addition the funds will help produce the commemorative book about the project. The book will be shipped to contributors who earn them as rewards.(Production and shipment of the commemorative book is contingent on receiving at least 50% of the projects funding goal.) This is by no means a small project and deserves the proper funding necessary to not only complete it's ambitious mission but also complete the project correctly and in a timely manner.

Answers to questions you may have about this project:

There is an existing signature record of about 40,000. My intention is to collect far more than that of course but how much more will be contingent on how much of my funding goal has been received. A multitude of issues had to be addressed when calculating my funding goal. Here's a list of what the money will be used for in completing this project.

1. Canvases and any art material needed in making the artwork. (I'd like to send canvases to as many countries as my budget will allow!)

2. Shipping of all material to and from each international venue.

3. Promotional material needed to promote the project.

4. Traveling to and from a location where my presence is needed. (This expense would only be needed after all other forms of communications with a venue breaks down or an unforeseen situation occurs.)

5. Any cost associated with paying for the commemorative book.

6. Any cost associated with paying for the prints.

7. Any cost associated with the paying for materials and original art rewards.

8. Shipping cost for all the rewards to be delivered.


How long will this project take?

The time frame on this project will be dictated by how much my budget is.
If I receive the total $20,000 funding goal or more the entire project will be completed within 9 months to one year after receiving the funds. (That estimation is relying on the notion that nothing unforeseen happens to hinder the completion of the project.)


Why those rewards?

There is only so much that can be done given a limited budget and the constraints of the subject matter my project is dealing with. I wanted a commemorative book to record the process, progress, and completion of a project cultivated from an idea but only realized through the collaborative efforts of everyone who supported it. The rewards had to fit within my narrative of the appreciation for the artistry within signatures but also demonstrate my appreciation for all those who help to make it happen. Expressing that gratitude has to be done without extending a budget that hasn't been realized yet.


Why do I create Participative art?

Art is usually exhibiting the artist expressions, views and opinions on their perspective of the world, people, or situations taking place within their time. Creating participative art is my attempt to take a bit of the ego out from the process of creating art. I want participative art to display a multitude of expressions from all walks of life while pushing the boundaries of what the art world is comfortable with promoting, displaying and ultimately selling. I truly feel that when we come together as a collective force, that collective force becomes a power able to change the world.


How will I deal with any challenges that may come with completing my project?

Obstacles and set backs are a fact of life but how we overcome them determines the quality of our experiences! The only foreseeable challenges are all financial and should be overcome by the combined generosity of the supporters contributing to the project.

As an experienced artist of over 25 years, I have the determination to overcome anything that may challenge the completion of this project. I'm sure I won't be alone on this mission so I'm looking forward to the overwhelming positive energy created through the backers who will help to support this project. Please feel free to contact me here or at geeart1@yahoo.com if you have any questions about my art, process or this project. I'm always willing to answer any question and learn from others.

Thank you for the opportunity to present my project to you! I truly appreciate any contribution given towards this effort.

George Linicomn

Artist

story:
Manifesto Jamaica performs

in

A celebration of Glasgow’s industrial past and creative future

The Tin Forest Theatre Festival will bring together 10 youth theatre companies from around the Commonwealth at the Commonwealth Games.

Manifesto Jamaica is one of those 10 youth theatre companies! 

We share this opportunity with theatre groups from Bangladesh, England, Malta, Scotland & New Zealand.


Our Mission

    We must raise

US $35,000 by June 30, 2014

[or 10 plane tickets]

Accommodations in Glasgow are covered by our gracious hosts. 

All we need to do is get to Glasgow and do what we do best…

...Represent the best of Jamaican Art & Culture to di fullest! 

If 1000 art & culture lovers contribute US$35 (J$3,500) each, we’ll be on our way with no delay!

Iron Sharpens Iron

Enable Manifesto Jamaica's mandate and mission to educate, expose and empower Jamaica's most precious natural resources; the people, art and culture. 

Please contribute what you can today.

Can you think of a colour that you've never seen? Can you reminisce on places you've never been? - Damian "Jr. Gong" Marley


Manifesto Jamaica 

Who. What. Where. Why.

Manifesto Jamaica is an art, youth and entrepreneurship-focused enterprise based in Kingston, Jamaica. Our mission is to unearth talent, and create opportunities for healing, development and empowerment of creative souls and economies.

Jodean Tapper, Paula-Gaye Donaldson, Randy McLaren, Renard Anderson, Renee Jones, Sheldon Kelly and Shaneil Orr will represent Manifesto Jamaica at the Tin Forest Theatre Festival. 

The theatre piece is being directed by Shaun Drysdale & Randy McClaren. The actors will be chaperoned by Lesley-Ann & Natalia Welsh.

About the Tin Forest Theatre Festival

The Glasgow 2014 Cultural Programme is a key part of the Commonwealth Games experience for spectators and visitors. The National Theatre of Scotland will take over the South Rotunda in Glasgow to:

  • Host a 7-day festival of remarkable performances based on the common theme 'near nowhere...to somewhere'
  • Reinvent the iconic South Rotunda building as a space for performance and visual art from across the Commonwealth

For information about the festival & performers visit TheTinForest.com


No disposable funds to donate? 

You can support by sharing this page with someone who probably can. 
Run go tell a friend :)


Link up

Lesley-Ann Welsh

Managing Director

lesley.ann.welsh@gmail.com

(876) 868-9422


Natalia Welsh

Tin Forest Project Manager

manifestojamaica@gmail.com


Love & Light

Team Manifesto Jamaica

story:
I was shocked when the Assistant Executive Director of Equinox Village informed me that the art show opening this coming May in Manchester, VT was not a group show as I had been told, but rather all for me to create and run with.  Given I have primarily worked as a decorative painter in order to support myself, this opportunity to share my fine art is a dream come true.  For the first time, I intend to exhibit some of my large acrylic abstracts, my more recent Big-Brush paintings mounted as scrolls, two walls of my photographs, and two of my videos of “Painting with the Five Elements”.

 

                          


Although I majored in “Illustration” in art school to be practical, painting intuitively is what really floats my boat because of it being entirely inner-directed.  Inspired by the highly imaginative and refined work of Ahmed Yacoubi, I have almost always preferred this process of letting a spontaneous brushstroke or color begin the unpredictable development of the end subject and feeling.  For some inexplicable reason rendering the imagined, invisible realms proves more satisfying for me than rendering the external, literal world.  Having been introduced to Big-Brush painting four years ago opened this process even further, allowing me to relinquish even more of the interference of my left brain, yielding a direct hit of undiluted energy, communicating viscerally v.s. rationally.  In my case, as in Chinese philosophy, I believe this energy or “Chi” is the pure essence of life and love itself, translated through each of us as infinitely unique and complex forms.  Therefore, I have decided the name of this exhibition is:  “What Art in Heaven?  An Exhibition of Paintings, Photographs and Videos in Praise of Life on Earth”. 


                                           


This campaign is a daring (and uncomfortable) effort to ask for the funding to cover the expenses of producing this exhibition: the cost of framing, designing the invitation, printing the photographs, postcards, and posters, postage, producing one more video in time for the show (including the video-grapher), paying for my wonderful intern’s help, paying for the wonderful musician on the opening night, and the gas and food for the trip up and back to hang the show.  The gallery is providing a minimal amount of local publicity and I am on my own for the remaining costs so any contributions will not only make an enormous difference but will make it all POSSIBLE!  I do believe the content is worthy from the standpoint of enhancing our appreciation for all that Heaven and Mother Earth are and the pleasure they gives us through their miraculous beauty, as well as it being educational because as we learn more about the Five Elements (Water, Earth, Air, Fire, and Metal) in ourselves and nature, we can achieve inner and outer balance. 

If you like, take a look at this video that illustrates "Painting with the Elements, No. 1- Water":

                       https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qnzd6wYH20E


 My lecture on the Summer Solstice, June 21st, will provide understanding about the basics of Chinese painting and how all of life on Earth is comprised of the Five Elements, including ourselves.  A workshop for those interested in attuning to the Five Elements and doing the Big Brush painting will be offered on the closing weekend of July 12th.  By having financial support for the mounting of this major exhibition and reaching out to a wide variety of people in the area, I believe it will heighten viewers' experience and enjoyment of the exquisite out-of-doors and the very phenomena of energy and the gift of life itself.  Obviously, I hope it will also make a major difference in my career as a fine artist, enabling me to study further and execute larger and more complex pieces that will be beautiful and awe-inspiring.

story:
"rabid delicacies" 

samsonite gill creations

What's happening here?!

i'm a performance artist


turned microsoft paint creator. 



my trajectory has moved me from iowa to colorado to new york city. i started my "rabid delicacies" a year ago, and recently added several more to the collection (there's 15 total...and opportunity for many many more). 


my goal is to print them on a variety of mediums and get them in your life. 

(postcards, posters, framed prints, magnets, greeting cards, and possibly t-shirts, phone covers, coffee cups, and underwear) 

and to possibly provide you with your very own delicacy...


...with a sadist twist.  


Here's the dealio yo...

I need help to get this thing off the ground! By raising $1400, I'll have enough to:

  • pay for supplies/shipping/printing of postcards and prints
  • pay for social media advertising
  • pay for booth costs to sell postcards/prints at independent markets (brooklyn flea market, brooklyn night bazaar, etc)

From your donation now, I will expand the "rabid delicacies" into a variety of products, beyond postcards and prints. 

The "samsonite gill creations" Vision:

By contributing to the "rabid delicacies" cause, you will be supporting a vision that can expand WAY beyond this first project. It has the infinite potential to do so. 


Showing your support shows a tangible idea of what demand there is for such delectable monsters...and the desire for more...


They are a unique combination of child-like sensibility and grim reality. They appeal to the loveable sadistic in all of us...



...and honestly...they're just scary funny. 



 I am confident that these will be loved all over. I am passionate about their creation. And I am positive that with your help, this can become a reality. 




We can do this together!

I would appreciate help in any way! 

Monetarily, yes...but just sharing or liking "samsonite gill creations" on all the social media websites can work wonders as well!


If you choose to donate, contact me on the following Facebook page to claim which "rabid delicacy" you want sent to you and your address.  


Follow me/Like me:

  • https://www.facebook.com/samsonitegillcreations
  • http://samsonitegill.tumblr.com/
  • https://twitter.com/samsonitegill
  • and of course all the Indiegogo share tools!


How could you say no to this face??


Thank you SO MUCH for your consideration! 


I look forward to throwing this idea off a cliff... 


...and watching it fly!

story:
About this Campaign

      “Born Natural Calendar Girlz”

   Hello, my name is Leesa Burt and I started a natural hair challenge three years ago to get African American women to start growing out their own hair and to abandon the over use of Relaxers, weaves and wigs.  Our promotion video lead to over 1,400 Afro-American women signing up to take part in this challenge to Grow out their own Hair without Perms or Relaxers

  Our mission is to create an annual calendar as a way to positively represent ourselves through our own eyes, in all our diversity.

We will create a Beautiful poster-Calendar, size 24” x 36” large

  Calendar selection will come from the many ladies who are participating in the Natural Hair Challenge.  We will select (12) Twelve African American Ladies with Natural Hair who has been growing out their hair for 3 to 8 years and they will receive various prizes and several copies of their own calendars to promote themselves however they chose.

This will be one of the most Fabulous Calendars of Afro-American women professionally photographed with real Long Natural Hair!


What We Need & What You Get

  We want to show that African American women can achieve long healthy hair too just like many women of other races has.

By supporting our project, you will be providing us with the opportunity to create something unique and marks this era in time as we awaken and accept the beauty that we were born with and as a reflection an inspiration to other Sistah’s throughout the United States and abroad.

  We’ve created this crowd-funding campaign in order to raise funds to cover the overhead costs to produce the 2015 calendars.

 You will receive  the most "Beautiful" and unique poster calendar of Afro-American Sistah's with natural long hair... and  we are certain that you will want to hang it on your wall or give it as a gift to someone special.

Please make this campaign a success  and reserve your one-of-a-kind Poster/calendar today!

“Born Natural Calendar Girlz”

Love, Peace and Blessings to you All  !!!

story:
(English below)

Mon travail de réalisatrice et maintenant d'artiste est une réflexion sur les relations humaines. Le projet « Moi & nous » est l'aboutissement concret d'une démarche commencée il y a trois ans sur les réseaux sociaux.

Mon travail consiste à photographier et filmer des rencontres qui ont émané des réseaux sociaux. 420 derrières de têtes d'amis Facebook, une collection de 600 photos reçues divisées par thème, une série de nus anonymes commencés sur Instagram (avant de se faire bannir), des secrets dévoilés en cachette par près de 80 personnes, une chaîne d'objets troqués parmi des gens qui ne se sont jamais rencontrés. Là il est temps d'amener tout dans le réel. D'imprimer ses centaines de photos, d'étaler les objets, de vivre les réseaux, de donner corps à des liens Facebook, à des échanges Instagram, des rencontres Craigslist.

Cette expérience doit devenir concrète et sortir du monde virtuel, en regroupant ces liens dans le réel, en devenant des objets. Il est temps de faire une exposition à Montréal.

Parce qu'en fin d'exercice, c'est en débordant dans le réel que le virtuel trouve son sens.

Je le fais pour moi, je le fais pour nous.

Tous ces projets existent présentement sur les réseaux sociaux et dans l'ordinateur. Convertir tout ça dans le réel coûte de l'argent. Je veux récolter 15 0000 $ pour imprimer, installer, relier, monter, projeter. Afin que nous puissions, ensemble, intégrer les réseaux, pour vrai. 

Tous les donateurs recevront un cadeau en guise d'appréciation et un reçu de dons à une organisation culturelle reconnue au Québec (déductible d'impôt).


Notes sur l'artiste

Sophie Lambert travaille dans le domaine de la photographie, de la vidéo, du documentaire et des réseaux sociaux. Ses œuvres questionnent le corps et l'identité tant dans sa valeur individuelle qu’universelle. Sa démarche est systématiquement collaborative.

Elle pose un regard sur notre société, sur nos façons de rentrer en contact avec les autres, sur l'image qu'on dévoile publiquement et sur nos facettes plus cachées. Elle utilise les réseaux sociaux pour rassembler les gens, tous ces utilisateurs de réseaux sociaux, seuls, derrière leurs écrans. Elle leur propose une expérience commune et rassembleuse. Elle invite les gens à se prêter à des exercices révélant leurs réalités et encourageant certains à sortir de leur zone de confort.

Le résultat donne une fresque de l'expérience contemporaine, tant celle de l'individu que de la collectivité.


Sa série 5 sens, consiste en 5 grands assemblages de plus de 100 photos. Les photos ont été envoyées via les réseaux sociaux suite à l’appel de l’artiste.


Cent corps sans visage est une collection de 100 photos de nus anonymes et inexpérimentés. Ce projet commença sur Instagram et a valu à l’artiste l’expulsion de ce réseau.


Le confessionnal II présente des secrets reçus anonymement, mis en affiche, exposés dans la ville puis rephotographiés.


La série l’envers de la face (book), accumule des derrières de tête où inconnus et personnalités publiques partagent la même humilité clandestine.


The six second body présente quant à lui des courts vidéos où 150 personnes se font demander d’exposer une seule partie de leur corps; les vidéos en boucle sont agencés pour former à toute les 6 secondes un seul corps.


La vente de garage est une chaîne d 'objets troqués entre personnes qui ne se connaissent pas.


Financing for "I & US" 


My work as a documentary director, and now as an artist, is a reflexion on human relationships. The project "I and Us" is the culmination of a project begun three years ago on social media.

My work consists of photographed and filmed encounters that have come to life through social media. Four hundred and twenty (420) backs of heads of Facebook friends; a collection of 600 photos divided into themes; a suite of anonymous nudes begun on Instagram (before being banned); the secrets of 100 people; and a series of objects exchanged between people who have never met.

Now it's time to bring these projects to life, under one roof together, these hundreds of virtual relationships; to give form to Facebook contacts, to Instagram moments, and to Craigslist encounters.   This is the moment to bring the project into focus, to print hundreds of photos, to display the objects, to experience the network, to actually see the artwork, to be in real time – to move virtual reality into physical reality.

Now we must put together an art exhibition in Montreal.

I'm doing it for myself, but I'm doing it for us.


All these projects exist on social media and in my computer. To move them to the real work will take money. I need to raise 15 000 $ to print, install, bind, mount and project.

This exhibition is a way to demonstrate that only by going beyond the digital mode does virtual reality make any sense.

Along the same lines as these collective art projects, I invite people to donate as a means to finance the exhibition. As a token of my appreciation, I will offer gifts and artwork with a tax receipt for a donation to a cultural organization recognized in Quebec (tax deductible).


About the artist

Sophie Lambert works with photography, film and social media. Her artworks are a study of the individual and collective values of body and identity. Her process is systematically collaborative.

She looks with detachment at our society, at the ways we enter into contact with each other, at the image we reveal publicly and at other more hidden sides. All these users of social media are alone, behind their screens; she proposes to bring them together. She invites these people to reveal themselves, their private reality and let themselves move beyond their comfort zone.

The result is a tableau of contemporary society, of the individual and of the group.


The suite, The 5 senses, contains 5 large collections of more than 100 photos each. The photos were sent via social media following the artist’s instructions.


100 Bodies is a collection of 100 photos of anonymous nudes. The project was originally housed on Instagram until the artist was banned from the network for this project.


Confessional II presents posters of anonymously received secrets exhibited around the city and rephotographed.


The suite the Other Side of the Face(book), is a collection of photographs of the backs of heads of the artist's Facebook friends and famous people she encounters.

The six second body presents short videos in which 150 people agreed to expose one part of their body; the video sequences are joined into a loop so that the image of a single body emerges.


The Garage Sale is a chain of objects exchanged through social media.

story: This is to help Ava fix her car and travel to Alabama to visit her aunt who was just diagnosed with incurable cancer that is all throughout her body.
story_txt: This is to help Ava fix her car and travel to Alabama to visit her aunt who was just diagnosed with incurable cancer that is all throughout her body.

story:
The story! 

Here I am...my hands shaking and then I press "send". The application is gone, my fingers are crossed.

It's my first time applying for what's the biggest burlesque competition in the world. And most importantly, for what's the most amazing and touching burlesque meeting that exists. The burlesque Legends from the past meet the new performers, the beginnings of the art form give their blessing to the new faces that will make its future.

And then..one month after, the answer is in my mailbox. My hands are shaking again: I open the message and... I'M IN!!!

I will be competing among the best world burlesque performers for the title of "Best Debut" on Saturday June 1st!  

Yes, I have cried! Of joy! Without any doubt, the best achievement of my carreer! 

But now...how the hell do I get to Vegas from Berlin? 

Unfortunately the participation to the festival is completely on the expenses of the competitor...so:

Give me a little help by getting some Redstar Goodies and I promise to rock that stage for us all! 

 

 

What's BHof?  

The Burlesque Hall of Fame Weekend is the largest, longest-running burlesque event in the world!

Not only is it four days of incredible shows, learning and performance, the Weekender is a fundraiser for The Burlesque Hall of Fame, the only museum of its kind to feature the history and artists of the distinctly modern art form of burlesque.

The Burlesque Hall of Fame is a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization. Our mission is to inspire, educate and entertain the public, fostering an appreciation for and understanding of the unique history and heritage of vintage Burlesque–including but not limited to the art, artifacts and personal histories of the art’s biggest names and brightest stars.

 

 

Let's do it!

Yes, participating to the Miss Exotic World competition is a dream...but it's a damn expensive one! 

What will you help me finance:

-Airplane ticket!

-Accomodation in Vegas! 

-Pass for the Burlesque Hall of Fame Weekend!

-Little big expenses to get there and to fix my costumes!

  

 

...and what do you get? 

Plenty of presents, goodies, collectors, signed pictures, my kisses and perfumes, my feathers...a little glimpse into my showgirl world! 

 

 

Don't forget to share! 

Facebook, twitter, web! 

 

PLEASE READ! 

For the Pin Me Up! donation, you can choose your favorite picture to sign here:

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.215907448539743.51430.215899821873839&type=3

or here:

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.231104340353387.56108.215899821873839&type=3

 

IMPORTANT! Don't forget to specify on Paypal to which address I should ship your goodies! 

And if you're purchasing a picture, let me know which one you prefer!
story_txt:
The story! 
Here I am...my hands shaking and then I press "send". The application is gone, my fingers are crossed.
It's my first time applying for what's the biggest burlesque competition in the world. And most importantly, for what's the most amazing and touching burlesque meeting that exists. The burlesque Legends from the past meet the new performers, the beginnings of the art form give their blessing to the new faces that will make its future.
And then..one month after, the answer is in my mailbox. My hands are shaking again: I open the message and... I'M IN!!!
I will be competing among the best world burlesque performers for the title of "Best Debut" on Saturday June 1st!  
Yes, I have cried! Of joy! Without any doubt, the best achievement of my carreer! 
But now...how the hell do I get to Vegas from Berlin? 
Unfortunately the participation to the festival is completely on the expenses of the competitor...so:
Give me a little help by getting some Redstar Goodies and I promise to rock that stage for us all!

story:
The Krampus Are Coming Back!

December 7, 2013, the Krampus return to Bloomington! All the way from Alpine Europe, the Krampus, St. Nicholas, and the angels will march through the parks, paths, forests, and streets of Bloomington and Indiana University.

Who Are The Krampus?

Krampus Night FAQ

Krampus Night is produced by Krampus Legend & Arts Workshop (KLAW), a diverse collective of friends, artists, and organizers with documented experience creating successful artwork and events.


How You Can Help!

KLAW needs to raise $2,500 from our community to make sure people know about the BEST Krampus event this side of the Alps! 


Donations will go toward:

- Promotions: Stickers, Yard Signs, Postcards, and possibly a Billboard north of town!

- Krampus Kare: Grooming, Horn & Klaw Sharpening, Facials

- Safety: Insurance, Security & Communications Gear, Law Enforcement


In return, contributors receive some great perks!

  • Appreciative recognition on our Facebook page!
  • An autographed 8x10 photo of St. Nicholas and the Krampus!
  • A personal visit from the Krampus!
  • Confinement in the parade float cage during the march!

story:
Short Summary

Based out of San Francisco, featuring artists from San Francisco State University, Holloway is a high quality, biannual, full-color, rigorously juried, printed publication. This way we will be able to showcase talented young artists twice a year — undergoing the same processes employed by galleries and museums. Currently there is no form, printed or otherwise, of connecting the artists who have received education from SFSU to the wider Bay Area community. Our intention is to develop a dialogue between an overshadowed yet highly successful department and its urban surroundings in an extremely polished format rivaling other high profile publications with a political undertone regarding the overvaluation of private universities and art schools above public education. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we receive from this campaign will go directly into the publication of issue one. We have two options in printing:

1) Less than what we are asking for (about $900 less).

This path will allow us to print the magazine without all the bells and whistles. Now, don't get us wrong, the magazine will still be beautiful at this level. We just have a few things in mind that we believe could make the magazine even more stunning...

2) More than what we are asking for (about $900 more).

If we are to obtain more funding than the $5,000 we are asking for, we will be able to print the magazine in an extremely delicate, refined, and polished manner. This is our upper tier, everything-we-could-hope-for-and-imagine kind of quality. 

Either way, Holloway will become a reality and it will be thanks to you. Our aim is to fund the production of issue one entirely through our community. This is something we can all be proud of. 

Should we make enough for option one, but just not enough for option two, the leftover funds will go into our distribution and outreach - shipping the magazine to all kinds of venues around the world. If we make even more than enough to print option two, well, just imagine how Holloway could be sustained. This is a biannual magazine, so start dreaming about issue two!

The Impact

Our aim is exposure. Exposure of a very alternative education, as seen through the dominant ethos of contemporary society. We want to showcase talent regardless of prestige, to work from the ground up within our community, presenting critical artwork and suggesting pathways. The narrative in the United States of assuming tens of thousands of dollars of debt in order to attend a school hopeful students believe will place them into a job or sphere they love is tired and unsustainable. For this reason, Holloway serves as a model, a microcosm of a larger problem stemming from a massively creative section of California. 

We are currently in the process of jurying over thirty-five artists from our first round of submissions. Some of these artists have just finished obtaining their degrees from SFSU, others have been working for years in varying photographic fields post-graduation. All remain passionate about the education they received under the tutelage of engaging, demanding professors.

Submissions ranged from the Bay Area, to New York, to Montreal. The focus of each artist was refined and clear, working complex ideas deconstructed within abstraction, studio portraiture, landscape, darkroom alterations, diptychs, murals, contact prints, and everything in between. As the story goes, most of this work ends up stored away under beds or rolled up into tubes to be thought of fleetingly by the creator. We have already been in communication with local (and national) independent bookstores and have methods of distribution in place post-publication.

Independent of funding from the university, our intention is to remain an autonomous organization responding to creation biannually. As we extend our branches to reach others who have passed through SFSU, our coverage will grow, and the extent to which these artists have flourished will be understood. Due to our model and philosophy, creation may continue ad infinitum. The half-year spent developing Holloway until now has proven there is great interest in the Bay Area and otherwise to see our artists’ work. What is needed next is you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We of course understand if you cannot contribute financially.

But remember, we're in this together! We are building and acknowledging a community. Let your friends and family know about us!

Also, stay in touch at:

hollowaymagazine@gmail.com

And keep an eye out for our post-publication launch party!

story:
The BFA senior thesis show is what students work for their entire scholastic experience. Karl, Jess and Michaela are three senior photography students at the University of Hartford trying to fund their senior thesis show. Costs will included, materials, framing and food or beverage available at the opening. The show acts as a final push from the school and a debut into the art world.

ABOUT THE ARTISTS:

Michaela Boscoe is an artist working in cyanotypes at the Hartford Art School. Cyanotypes are a non-silver photographic process in which iron reacts with UV rays and when develops is a prussian blue color. Using the cyanotype Michaela began exploring the organic forms of trees in her senior year. She uses sawdust as well as other wooden materials to create tree-like forms on the cyanotype-covered paper. The result of this exploration is a white tree form on a prussian blue background. There is no negative made in the process of her trees and therefore each print is a unique, one-of-a-kind, handmade piece.

Karl Mattson is a photography student with an emphasis in creating journeys of fiction, non-fiction and narrative stream of consciousness through an abstracted documentary visual style. He is currently enrolled at the Hartford Art School for his BFA in Photography, with a minor in Printmaking. His current project, titled This Is Me Saying Goodbye, abstractly documents his psychosocial inner world during the journey of mystery, pleasure and collapse of emotions within a past relationship. Embracing a new beginning from an end, his project sees him marking the end by saying goodbye to the after-image of the past relationship.

Jess Emonds is a senior photography student at the Hartford Art School. Her focus is on light and how it affects spaces. The series allows her to further investigate light, as well as become more familiar with the space she lives in. Light finds her. When she goes in search of light, it fades too quickly. Photography relies on light to live. Without light there would be no photograph. Light is constantly changing, as is the medium of photography. Technology persistently shapes our perceptions of the image. As new technology is introduced into the medium of photography, old ideals are pushed out. Film is fleeting, as is light. Jess uses a 4x5 field camera, itself a homage to the beginning of photography. The camera allows light to become tangible. We cannot hold light in our hands, but we can feel it on our faces. Film is an object. With the 4x5 camera, light also becomes an object in the form of the photograph.

Other ways you can help:

We understand that not everyone can donate, but we appreciate your support in sharing our project with your friends, family and coworkers. We are very excited about this and hope that you are too! Thank you for your support.

 

Michaela Boscoe, Karl Mattson, Jess Emonds
