story:
What is this fundraiser for?

A group exhibition called War is for the Living

Curated by Chuong-Dai Vo and Midori Yamamura

Opening reception: February 14, 2013, 6pm-9pm

On view: February 14-March 23, 2013, Tuesday-Saturday 11am-5pm

Sylvia Wald and Po Kim Gallery, 417 Lafayette Street, New York City

 

What is the exhibition about?

The show features installation art, sculpture, films, prints and photographs by 11 artists. These projects are about the relationships and histories formed in times of war, the displacements that people go through, and the humanity that survives.

 

Why is this exhibition important?

We are living in a time of increased militarization of the U.S. and unending war, especially in the Middle East. At the same time, people across the region are demanding a right to shape their own governments and societies. This exhibition speaks to these events.

Update: Since we started this campaign, we've raised 75% of our goal! We've received sponsorship from Japan Foundation, NYU's Asian/Pacific/American Institute, and the Vilchek. We've also received an equipment loan from NYU's APA and in-kind labor for the brochure design and installation. Please donate and help us cover the rest of the costs of the exhibition!

 

What if I can't contribute money, but can offer in-kind help?

We are volunteering our labor to do this show, and would love to have help to put it up! Please contact us. 

 

Who are the artists in the exhibition?

The video and gallery tab has images of most of the works that will be in the show. This is a brief snynopsis of the works:

Simon Leung's video/sculpture War After War is a collaboration with his subject, Warren Niesluchowski, a former World War II refugee and Vietnam War deserter whose life foregrounds the ethical challenge of reciprocity and hospitality. Hiroshi Sunairi’s Tree Project Film features an interview with a tree doctor who cares for trees that survived the atomic bombing of Hiroshima, and who gives the seeds from these trees to people who will plant them. An-My Le’s Events Ashore project show the larger world of the U.S. military, its scientific, exploratory and humanitarian missions. Allan deSouza’s Cityscapes are images of urban landscapes made of material he scavenged from the streets of lower Manhattan in the spring of 2001. Made shortly before 9/11, the images are hauntingly prophetic of that event. Paul Qaysi is presenting a new series of photographs called Misprint. Printed on the reverse side of the inkjet paper, the images engage with the misperceptions that lead to military attacks on civilians and our own blindness to the effects of war on ourselves. Nina Berman’s photographic series Homeland examines the militarization of American life post 9/11, in particular the burgeoning security state and its influence on national and personal identity. Yoshiaki Kaihatsu will install a floor piece called Dust, which comprises debris he collected near the 9/11 Ground Zero site. Made during the Vietnam War, Yoko Ono’s public art project, WAR IS OVER! If You Want It is as relevant for the current time as it was three decades ago. Dinh Q. Lê’s hand embroidery The Texture of Memory and photoweavings remember the dead of the Cambodian Genocide. Performance artist Nancy Hwang will invite artists and audience members to share their stories and memories of lives affected by war. Tomie Arai' silk screens encapsulate the theme of the show in her use of the folk tale Momotaro, to tell a story of the internment of Japanese Americans and their journeys of survival, hope and possibilities.

 

What will the contributions go toward?

Your support will help us pay for material and equipment, transportation and delivery of the art work, and installation.

 

Are the contributions tax deductible?

Yes, the Sylvia Wald and Po Kim Art Gallery Foundation is a non-profit 501(c). The contributions will be sent to the gallery to be used only for the costs of this exhibition.

 

What are the contribution perks?

The artists are making works specifically for this occasion, and they will not be available beyond the fundraiser.

 

Is there a shipping cost?

We will cover the costs of shipping in the U.S. For other countries, the costs will be US$10-15.

 

What are the Dinner Guest and the House Guest contribution perks?

The Dinner Guest and House Guest gifts are two new works that extend Simon Leung's video/sculpture War After War in its contemplation of what it means to be a displaced person, what it means to be hospitable, who gets to be hospitable, and what it means to form reciprocal relationships.

For the Dinner Guest gift, the contributor(s) may buy or cook Warren Niesluchowski a meal in a city, town, or any place where Warren may find himself. For the House Guest gift, the contributor may put Warren Niesluchowski up for no less than 1 night, and no more than 3 nights, at the contributor’s home in a city, town, or a place where Warren may find himself, pending Warren's agreement. The contributor must agree to negotiate specific terms with Warren upon a successful bid.

 

Who are the curators?

Chuong-Dai Vo is an independent curator and writer based in NYC and a Visiting Scholar at MIT. Midori Yamamura is a lecturer at Museum of Modern Art in NYC and a Visiting Assistant Professor in History of Art and Design at Pratt Institute. We are guest curating this group exhibition for the Sylvia Wald and Po Kim Gallery in Lower Manhattan.

 

Who founded the gallery?

Sylvia Wald was a politically and socially conscious artist who fought against racial inequalities during her lifetime. Po Kim was born in Korea under Japanese colonialism, and had to endure political persecution during the post-World War II formation of South Korea. He was able to leave for the U.S. on a fellowship in the 1950s, and eventually came to NYC. He and Sylvia Wald created this nonprofit art gallery to show works of social importance. Po Kim is 95-years-old and continues to paint on a regular basis.

 

We thank you for your support, and hope to see you at the exhibition opening in February 2013.

We thank you for your support, and hope to see you at the exhibition opening in February 2013.

story:
DESCRIZIONE
Il 20e il 29 Maggio 2012 Mantova è stata colpita da un forte terremoto che ha messo in pericolo Palazzo Ducale e tutte le decorazioni pittoriche che vi sono all’interno e molte sale sono inagibili.
Noi vogliamo far tornare agibile una di queste sale, mettendo in sicurezza gli affreschi e restaurandoli, vogliamo farlo con l’aiuto di tutti, con una partecipazione diffusa, con un’iniziativa concreta!
Vogliamo che nelle sale tornino a risuonare i passi dei turisti e degli appassionati, vogliamo che i loro sguardi si perdano nei meravigliosi soffitti e pareti, e rimangano stupiti!
Sono una restauratrice abilitata a fare questo lavoro, lo faccio da oltre 28 anni, è la mia grande passione e amo moltissimo Mantova!
Il Palazzo Ducale è un motore formidabile per il turismo, senza il Palazzo Ducale agibile anche l’economia della città soffre ulteriormente!
Io e la mia squadra, tutta giovane, ci daremo da fare per tenervi aggiornati, per fornire ulteriori particolari, per tenere alto l’interesse e per spronare la “prima grande squadra collettiva virtuale di restauratori”!

DESCRIPTION
The 20th and 29th May, 2012 Mantua was hit by a strong earthquake that has endangered the Ducal Palace and all the decorations that  are inside. Many rooms are unusable
We want to bring back one of these rooms accessible by securing the frescoes and restoring them and can do so with the help of everyone, with widespread participation, with a concrete initiative!
We want to return to the halls echo of footsteps of tourists and fans, we want their eyes lost in the wonderful ceilings and walls, and remain amazed!
I am a restorer empowered to do this job, I do it for over 28 years, it is my great passion and I really love Mantua!
The Palazzo Ducale is a powerful drive for tourism, without the Palazzo Ducale also accessible the city's economy suffers further!
Me and my team, all young, we'll work to keep you updated, to provide further details, to keep up the interest and encourage the "first great collective virtual team of restorers"!

 

CHE COS’E’ IL PROGETTO “MANTOVA – NON DIMENTICATE GLI AFFRESCHI DI PALAZZO DUCALE”?
Il progetto “Mantova – Non dimenticate gli affreschi di Palazo Ducale!” è un progetto che intende raccogliere fondi per restaurare una delle Sale più danneggiate dal terremoto del maggio 2012, la Sala di Manto.
La Sala di Manto, ha un totale dicirca 170 mq.  di affreschi e stucchi, e noi intendiamo restaurare, se raggiungeremo la somma di 65.000$, 70 mq. di affreschi e stucchi.
Tale somma servirà a pagare:

  • Il ponteggio
  • La rimozione dei depositi incoerenti dalla superficie
  • La pulitura degli stucchi, a tampone, con soluzione di pulitura
  • La rimozione dei vecchi ritocchi pittorici
  • Il fissaggio della pellicola pittorica
  • La riadesione degli intonaci e degli stucchi con iniezioni di malta fluida
  • La stuccatura delle lacune
  • Il ritocco pittorico con colori ad acquerello

Per restaurare 70 mq. di affreschi e stucchi, una squadra di tre persone dovrà lavorare per 3.5 mesi.

WHAT 'S THE "MANTUA - DO NOT FORGET THE FRESCOES DUCAL PALACE" PROJECT?
The project "Mantova - Do not forget the frescoes of Palazo Ducale" is a project that aims to raise funds to restore one of the rooms most affected by the earthquake in May 2012, the Hall of Manto.
The Hall of Manto, has a total of ca 170 sqm. frescoes and stucco, and we intend to restore, if we reach the sum of $ 65,000, 70 sqm. frescoes and stucco.
This sum will be used to pay for:

  • The scaffolding
  • The removal of incoherent deposits from the surface
  • The cleaning of stucco, pad with cleaning solution
  • The removal of the old pictorial touches
  • The fixing of the paint film
  • The re-adhesion of the plaster and stucco with injections of fluid mortar
  • The filling of gaps
  • The touch-up painting with watercolors

To restore 70 sqm. frescoes and stucco, a team of three people will be working for 3.5 months.

DI CHE COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO E COME POTETE AIUTARCI?
Abbiamo bisogno di raggiungere il nostro obiettivo di 65.000$, ma potete aiutarci, anche se non contribuirete, trasmettendo il nostro messaggio ai vostri amici, in tutto il mondo.

WHAT WE NEED AND HOW YOU CAN HELP?
We need to reach our goal of $ 65,000, but you can help us, even if you do not contribute, sending our message to your friends all over the world.

L’IMPATTO CHE PUO’ AVERE IL NOSTRO PROGETTO
E’ la prima volta che viene svolta una campagna in questo modo, su una piattaforma internazionale di raccolta fondi collettiva,dove  una volta raccolti i fondi, la stessa squadra si incaricherà di portare a termine il progetto, in accordo con le autorità competenti.
Una partecipazione diffusa e privata, per un patrimonio che è dell’Umanità (Mantova è nei siti UNESCO).

THE IMPACT THAT CAN 'TAKE OUR PROJECT
It 's the first time we do a campaign like this,  on an international crowdfunding platform, where once the funds collected, the team will be responsible for completing the project, in agreement with the competent authorities.
Widespread participation and private, for a  humanity heritage (Mantova is in the UNESCO sites).

DATECI UNA MANO A RAGGIUNGERE IL NOSTRO OBIETTIVO!!!
Mi auguro che alla fine, migliaia di mani virtuali permetteranno a migliaia di occhi reali di ammirare di nuovo la bellezza

Se dovessimo superare il nostro obiettivo, andremo avanti a restaurare più metri quadrati di affreschi e stucchi

PLEASE, HELP US  REACH  OUR GOAL!!!!
I hope that in the end thousands of virtual hands will allow thousands of real eyes to admire once again the beauty

If we exceed our goal, we will continue to restore more square meters of frescoes and stucco

story:
WHO WE ARE AND WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP                                                                           Hello My name Is Rod Becklund and my wifes name is Cindy she is 41 years old.  Cindy and I are wildlife sculptors in Port Charlotte Florida. We have been creating life size reproductions of our waterbird sculptures for the last 15 years . We have had great times and slow times and this is the latter. The reason for this campaign is to raise money to get Cindy a hysterectomy surgery. She has a lot of scar tissue built up from having endometriosis and it is causing her more and more pain.                                                                                                                            We have no insurance so I am trying to raise the money to get her treated. The money you send will make a tremendous impact on her life she currently is unable to work or do any kind of strenuous activity. Seeing her in pain and feeling helpless to stop it is something that kills me . Her Dr. said she needs this surgery as soon as possible that was over a year ago and her pain has gotten steadily worse to this point . We have plenty of art so if you can help we will give back to you with our art.                                                                                                           WHERE THE MONEY GOES                                                                                       So here is what we need the money for . $4000 for the surgery and $1000 for a previous emergency room bill that we must pay. Any funds over this amount will go towards future healthcare and insurance. If anyone knows of a good Gyno/surgeon within 500 miles of Port Charlotte Fl. that can do it cheaper we would like to know that too. Your financial help will save a life and that is the greatest gift you can give. 26 years ago I saved my sisters life with a kidney donation and that was the greatest feeling I have ever felt, it is truly indescribable.

HOW CAN YOU HELP ? DONATE HERE AND SHARE ON FACEBOOK AND TWITTER.

To help Cindy pay for her surgery and medical bills, please click the big RED button at the top or bottom of this page that says "Contribute Now."

You willl be able to enter any amount you would like to contribute. Choose a perk level amount. You can donate with a credit card or PayPal.

To monitor how close we are to reaching our goal, look at the box at the top right of this page.

Naturally, any amount you can contribute is appreciated and will help make a difference. If you can't afford to donate you can still help get the word out on al the social medias like Facebook and Twitter. This is truly going to mean the world to her and me.Thank you for your help.

story:
Our Story - a real Investment in Art

We are a group of 30 UK artists who have been selected to exhibit at the prestigious Orange County Centre for Contemporary Art, bringing some of the UK’s top emerging artists to California. (Dec 21st – Jan 12th).


The list of artists reads like a who’s who of the young, London art scene, including Rosie Emerson, Tahnee Lonsdale, and Agnetha Sjogren. Works by these and other collectible artists are available to you here as part of the fundraising campaign: Our 'perks' in return for your donations are listed to the right, or we have opened an online shop here with more range: http://www.etsy.com/shop/LondonCalifornia


We are a very talented group, pushing the boundaries of the art world even in a time when it is hard to get arts funding to make shows like this happen. To enable the first Museum show of the London art scene in California, we need your help.



The Impact

This is a very exciting and potentially career expanding opportunity for all the artists that have been selected, and will also enable us to help raise support for OCCCA which develops and actively participates in public educational, outreach and community art services. 

Your contributions, big or small, will be helping on many levels.

We are not just shipping work to California – we are providing an interactive, performative presence. We will be turning heads! In order to achieve this we are aiming for as many of us as possible to travel to the show.


What We Need & What You Get

We would love for you to help make this possible - and as we are an extremely talented bunch of lovely artists we have some incredible "perks" to let you know grateful we are for your help!


The artists have kindly donated some stunning art pieces which can be yours if you contribute to this campaign. These artworks are usually at least twice the ‘contribution price’ listed here, so this is really an incredible opportunity to get some original artworks for a fraction of the price – a very rare opportunity with this calibre of artist, and it is only possible for the duration of this campaign. (Any works not claimed will be returning to their original price). More details below.

 

The closer you help us get to our funding target of $9000 (£5000), the more of us will actually be able to get over there and give a taste of British art to California, as well as ship the artwork.


Details:  What we have for you

Firstly we are offering limited edition artwork postcards signed by the artists. 50 of each design will be created to make up this exclusive collection.


Now that's pretty good in itself but we have a really incredible opportunity for you as well: All the artists are offering original works of art! This is a fantastic chance to own artwork from these successful emerging artists –  each very talented and collectible. Currently exhibiting in London and represented by Notting Hill based gallery Debut Contemporary, we have all successfully shown in other locations as well.

A few of the places the artists have exhibited: The Venice Biennale, Tate Britain, Tate Modern, The Southbank Centre, Sommerset House, and galleries in Singapore, LA, Russia, Salzburg, Austria, Germany and Poland. Collectors of their work are in many countries and include Banksy and Bill Woodrow. They have worked with clients such as Jerry Lewis and Groove Armada and have had work auctioned by high profile Christies auctioneer Hugh Edmeades. 

 

This is a wonderful way to get a piece of collectable contemporary art whilst supporting the artists in furthering their careers! Its not just a donation to us, it's also an art investment for you!


We are also offering exciting opportunities like commissioning your portrait for £150 or joining us at a Salon Dinner Party with London's top emerging artists. More info here: http://nicolaanthony.wordpress.com/2011/11/21/join-us-at-a-salon-dinner-party-with-the-artists/

 

The Artists

As a group artists, our unique practices are diverse - You can find out more about our individual artwork by looking at the profiles in the "team" section. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help - Spread the Word

Please spread the word about our cause and use the share buttons above, or email to friends/colleagues to help others to notice our campaign and this incredible opportunity.

Thank you 

Thank you for taking time to read this and if you have been inspired to make a donation then an even bigger thank you to you! You are truly wonderful!


Exhibition Dates:

Dec 21, 2011 – January 12, 2012

Private View Opening – January 7, 2012

Thank you

Exhibition Dates:
Dec 21, 2011 – January 12, 2012
Private View Opening – January 7, 2012

story:
Māyā

We are Rebecca Lindsmyr, Bejoy Sanjeev and Viktor Lysell Smålänning - three creative souls hitting art from different angles.

Our dream is to create spaces where people are invited to get naked with their perspectives and get to know them, challenge them and play with them. We don’t want to push or pull, but we want to take away gravity and let one be dead for a moment, to have the opportunity to be reborn again. 

In the end of August we aim to bring together upcoming artists from over 5 countries for an exhibition at Biscuit Factory during Edinburgh Festival Fringe - the biggest art festival in the world.  The upcoming exhibition will explore māyā - a sanskrit word that deeply explores the space between reality and illusion. We want your help to make it happen in the best possible way! 

For us your support would not only mean that we can ensure a high quality exhibition, but also create the foundation for future projects with other ambitious upcoming artists. 

How your support can be meaningful

For this project we aim to raise as much money as possible to support the event and the specific artists taking part. Money raised will cover as follows

- insurance for the visitors and space
- printed material - including posters, flyers and printed information for the event 
- small costs for hanging and freshening up the space
- documentation of the event - includes photo and video documentation
- transport for the exhibition - including transporting art works 

All participating artists and the organizers of this event are working for free and spending money from their own pockets to make this happen. We have a big wish to help this group with compensation for traveling. This will be our biggest expense and if we get some support with it, our chances to afford booking our next space will greatly increase.
    

                           


Māyā. Biscuit Factory, Edinburgh, 21 - 31, August, 2015.

In māyā we will be exploring the duality of reality. Māyā is a sanskrit word describing the grand illusion of the universe. It is a subtle force that creates the illusion that the phenomenal world that we see is real. Māyā is said to be neither true nor untrue - the world exists but it is not what it appears to be. We want invite to an exploration of this duality. 

The exhibition will be up for 10 days at Biscuit Factory in Edinburgh. We are inviting artists from different artistic fields, areas and backgrounds to unite in exploration of māyā. The location is amazing. It's a big, beautiful old industrial building with an open space. We feel fortunate to have the opportunity to use it and with great support from the space owners we're set on doing something amazing!

Artists booked so far
Miriam Vikman - http://vekling.tumblr.com/
Miguel Onofre - http://cargocollective.com/mokoso
Craig Stewart - http://craig-stewart.com/
Magdalene Wanderlust - http://www.magdalene-wanderlust.com/
Arrache toi un oeil! Duo consisting of Emy Rojas and Gaspard Le Quiniou - http://www.arrachetoiunoeil.com/
Clara Hastrup 
Tilly Gifford - http://www.uniqueceramique.com/
Bejoy Sanjeev - http://bejoysanjeev.tumblr.com/
Viktor Lysell Smålänning - http://viktorlysell.com/
Rebecca Lindsmyr - site will be updated soon

We're deeply thankful for any support we can get! Check out the perks and keep scrolling if you want to get to know us a bit more. 

This facebook event will be our main platform for communicating about the exhibition. 

Drop us a line if you have any questions. 

                           


Get to know us better

The organizing group met on dance floors and have been united by a strong desire to create together.

Bejoy Sanjeev aim to remove the ground under our feet to create a space where one can move freely. With his origin in India he is in this initiative also connecting western expressions with Indian philosophy. He has a wide experience from working in clubs, both as DJ and as organizer of events. He has been playing in various venues and is the creator of Reverb Glasgow where he brought together DJ's ,musicians, performers and other artists to create nights that leave visible traces while working as a connection point for creative people. Bejoy has a career in modeling for fashion shows and photo shoots, mainly for upcoming designers. Today he is a art and fashion photographer. He has worked relentlessly for the last 5 years to be able to bring something to the creative life in Glasgow. He puts his heart into creating something extraordinary.

Rebecca Lindsmyr is a feminist artist working primarily in painting with cross overs to text and installation/object. Her interest lies in questions of gender and equality from a health perspective. Through her practice she aim to open up for discussion about how we regard physical and mental health from an intersectional perspective, with a special focus on female representation. Rebecca is about to enter her last year of undergraduate education at Glasgow School of Art and has a background of art and textile education in Sweden. She is currently working as a lecturer and mentor for the National Organization for Eating Disorders in Sweden and have upcoming projects in Sweden involving the relationship between art and health. She has a wide experience from putting on and exhibiting in spaces from smaller venues and industrial facilities to government owned art institutions.

Viktor Lysell Smålänning calls himself a Ritual Designer. He is exploring how to work with ceremony and ritual in today's world. The methods he is using allows for creating rituals outside of cosmologies and traditions. Allowing ritual to be a tool for freedom of the mind, the individual and the group. He’s an experienced event organizer and is intrigued by creating spaces for sharing moments, sharing ourselves and sharing ideas. 


                                  Thanks for reading!
story_txt:
Māyā We are Rebecca Lindsmyr, Bejoy Sanjeev and Viktor Lysell Smålänning - three creative souls hitting art from different angles.
Our dream is to create spaces where people are invited to get naked with their perspectives and get to know them, challenge them and play with them. We don’t want to push or pull, but we want to take away gravity and let one be dead for a moment, to have the opportunity to be reborn again. 
In the end of August we aim to bring together upcoming artists from over 5 countries for an exhibition at Biscuit Factory during Edinburgh Festival Fringe - the biggest art festival in the world.  The upcoming exhibition will explore māyā - a sanskrit word that deeply explores the space between reality and illusion. We want your help to make it happen in the best possible way! 
For us your support would not only mean that we can ensure a high quality exhibition, but also create the foundation for future projects with other ambitious upcoming artists. 




How your support can be meaningful For this project we aim to raise as much money as possible to support the event and the specific artists taking part. Money raised will cover as follows
- insurance for the visitors and space
- printed material - including posters, flyers and printed information for the event 
- small costs for hanging and freshening up the space
- documentation of the event - includes photo and video documentation
- transport for the exhibition - including transporting art works 

All participating artists and the organizers of this event are working for free and spending money from their own pockets to make this happen. We have a big wish to help this group with compensation for traveling. This will be our biggest expense and if we get some support with it, our chances to afford booking our next space will greatly increase.
                               



Māyā. Biscuit Factory, Edinburgh, 21 - 31, August, 2015.

In māyā we will be exploring the duality of reality. Māyā is a sanskrit word describing the grand illusion of the universe. It is a subtle force that creates the illusion that the phenomenal world that we see is real. Māyā is said to be neither true nor untrue - the world exists but it is not what it appears to be. We want invite to an exploration of this duality. 



The exhibition will be up for 10 days at Biscuit Factory in Edinburgh. We are inviting artists from different artistic fields, areas and backgrounds to unite in exploration of māyā. The location is amazing. It's a big, beautiful old industrial building with an open space. We feel fortunate to have the opportunity to use it and with great support from the space owners we're set on doing something amazing!


Artists booked so far
Miriam Vikman - http://vekling.tumblr.com/Miguel Onofre - http://cargocollective.com/mokosoCraig Stewart - http://craig-stewart.com/
Magdalene Wanderlust - http://www.magdalene-wanderlust.com/

Arrache toi un oeil! Duo consisting of Emy Rojas and Gaspard Le Quiniou - http://www.arrachetoiunoeil.com/

Clara Hastrup 
Tilly Gifford - http://www.uniqueceramique.com/Bejoy Sanjeev - http://bejoysanjeev.tumblr.com/Viktor Lysell Smålänning - http://viktorlysell.com/
Rebecca Lindsmyr - site will be updated soon

story:
CONTEXTILE is an international event, and celebration, of TEXTILE ART. It is also an occasion to reflect, discuss and divulge the latest trends in artistic expression that use textiles as a medium, in a city shaped by the textile industry.

The CONTEXTILE concept emerged as a winning proposal for the GUIMARAES 2012 – European Capital of Culture, in which the traditional and industrial economic base of that historical town would be rediscovered through the vision of artists from around the world. However, it was rapidly clear that there was a void to be filled in the international dissemination and promotion of textile arts and artists. A void that CONTEXTILE and the city of Guimarães (Portugal) are happy to fulfill.

With strong ties to a territory and a society rich of textile tradition, CONTEXTILE quickly became a truly unique platform for the discovery and promotion of new and recognized talent as well as a chance to interact with a community engaged in many forms of textile production.

Who we are

CONTEXTILE is a project by Ideias Emergentes, a multidisciplinary collective dedicated to the advancement of new cultural dynamics at local, national and international levels.

Led by team members with a solid background in both textile and art, Ideias Emergentes became increasingly involved with international textile art scene by participating in several international events such as Kaunas Biennial. Subsequently, IDEIAS EMERGENTE choose textile art as a production idea for the 2012 European Capital of Culture, that would be held in Guimarães (Portugal), a city with great tradition in the textile industry. Thus CONTEXTILE was born.

What we need

The success of CONTEXTILE first edition and the expectations it raised, both to the textile and artistic communities, warranted a follow on edition with at least the same level of quality.

That is therefore our goal. A goal made more challenging by less than perfect economic climate.

So in order to meet the challenge, we opted for a new funding model that seeks to rally the support of as many stakeholders as possible. The idea is to keep improving the overall quality of CONTEXTILE 2014, a small contribution at a time.

In this case we are seeking funding for our networking programme, our training and dissemination programmes as well as general production improvements to the event.

The networking programme is directed towards the artistic community and is composed of series of “textile talks” and other networking events. The training programme is directed at students, professionals and the general public and intents to showcase the best practises in TEXTILE ART today. Finally, your contributions will help create a better dissemination package, increasing our budget for communication and editorial materials (site, catalogue, audio-visual editions).

The bottom line is that we need your help to keep CONTEXTILE a truly significant beacon of TEXTILE ART in the international art scene.

CONTEXTILE 2014 – General Programme

Following the general conceptual matrix of the first edition, CONTEXTILE 2014 programme will comprise the following activities: international exhibition, artists residencies, satellite exhibitions (Lausanne biennial collection, Fibers Future/NGO Japan, invited countries and art schools), TextileTALKs, workshops, performances and interventions in the public space.

How to help

We are asking for small monetary contributions, raging from 15€ to 500€, to complement our budget in order to fulfil our operational needs.

What you get

You get a unique event that provides an international spotlight to textile art and artists. An opportunity to learn, interact and network with artists, producers, designers and artisans. And the chance to discover a historic city set in a valley region rich in textile tradition.

Other ways to help

You are welcome to disseminate information about CONTEXTILE to everyone you think might be interested in participating.

story:
I'm an Oakland artist, with an imagination that would like to run wild. Will you help me? I need paint, quality paint, paint that can spread across canvass and walls and phone covers and shirts and seep into your reality. I'd like some paint that can reveal the deep and profound beauty of my brain. I see a world that I'd like to show you, would you like to see?  Buy me one can of paint and together we will build a beautiful world. If you help me by purchasing one or more cans of paint, I will use those paint cans in public spaces where we could all enjoy a little extra imagination and beauty. 


It doesn't take much to help. One can of quality spray paint is $7. If 10 people donate I have enough paint to cover one public wall. Tell me one animal, color, or oakland space you would like to be involved in the project and I will make it a communally developed concept. I know together we can produce a beautiful piece of art that will last years in the public Oakland sphere. With so much constant change in Oakland it will be nice to make something together to commemorate our experiences here together.  

Trust me, I can do this! Check out my other work @noonesart on instagram. 

Please buy me one can of paint, it'll be awesome.

story:
About SPEAKeasy

Almost two years ago, two creatives set out to illuminate Downtown Dallas as the close-knit community it is. Josh David Jordan (Two Cans & A String) interviewed each participant to create an original short film, while Steve Hunter (Hunter Creates) painted each subject’s canvas. 

This poster was designed by Maggie Kennedy as a way to celebrate those that participated in this fun event.

Please NOTE: this campaign will be open for 30 days, which means you have until the end of August to place your order. Posters should be distributed by mid-September.

Please make sure your contact info is up-to-date upon "claiming" an order so that I may get into contact with you quickly and drop off your new work of art! THANK YOU for your support!

story:
AIRY Yamanashi


My name is Dre Britton, I'm a fine artist based in Baltimore, Maryland. I attended the Maryland Institute College of Art for my undergraduate studies where I studied General Fine Arts. I was given many opportunities to develop myself as a studio artist and as a teen transitioning into an independent adult. Growing up in Baltimore, I developed a strong sense of community both inside and outside of MICA.  With this trip, I intend to expand my sense of community beyond that of my own city.


Images from work created during my undergraduate period.

Last year, I was blessed with the opportunity to have a show with a friend and colleague of mine at Subbasement Artist Studio titled 'Strange Arrangement.' The work consisted of sculptures made from found objects around Baltimore City, specifically furniture & building materials. The show was warmly received and provided me with a good idea of where I would go next. 

Sculptures from 'Strange Arrangement'. See more art at drebritton.com

In order to push my interest in structures and cultures further, I have opted to take part in Air-Y's residency In Kofu in Yamanashi, Japan. There I intend to produce work for an exhibition, hold an open studio for the residents in Kofu, conduct research on identities (both domestic and foreign) as well as a cultural exchange presentation. I'm very lucky to be traveling to AIR-Y during their 10th anniversary.  I've gone through a great deal of preparation to get with this point, so its with all I am that I ask for your assistance to make this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

For me, this funding is absolutely essential. While I am able to cover my airfare and residency fee, I've had difficulty gathering funds for material costs and miscellaneous living expenses. Along with the creation of artworks, the funding will be used to hold the workshop & open studio.

Risks & Challenges

Right now, my biggest obstacle is financing for studio materials. While I adept at collecting materials in my home city, I will face challenges in Japan that will require me to go beyond relying on such methods. I want to make sure that I make the most out of the resources I have available during this opportunity!

Other Ways You Can Help

JUST KEEP SHARING THIS LINK! Even if you aren't able to donate money, giving me your time and passing this along is a big deal for me.

story:
We are an upcoming theatre troupe preparing to stage the longest running play of all time ‘The Mousetrap’ by Agatha Christie.

About ‘The Mousetrap’

‘The Mousetrap’ by Agatha Christie opened in the West End of London in 1952, and has been running continuously since then. It is by far the longest initial run of any play in history, with its 25,000thperformance taking place on 18thNovember 2012. It is the longest running show (of any type) of the modern era. The play is also known for its twist ending, which the audiences are traditionally asked not to reveal after leaving the theatre.

The play starts with a group of strangers stranded in a boarding house during a snow storm, one of whom is a murderer. The suspects include the newly married couple who run the house, and the suspicions in their minds nearly wreck their perfect marriage. Others are a spinster with a curious background, an architect who seems better equipped to be a chef, a retired army major, a strange little man who claims his car has overturned in a drift, and a jurist who makes life miserable for everyone. Into their midst comes a policemen, traveling on skis. On the very next day, the Jurist is killed. Two down and one to go, to get to the rationale of the murderer’s pattern, the policemen probes the background of everyone present, and rattles a lot of skeletons. Another famous Agatha Christie switch finish. The excitement never lets up and the search for the murderer never ceases which keeps the audience at the edge of their seats.

The show is designed, choreographed & directed by Kevin Cruze and will be presented by Cold Theatre 7 featuring exemplary performances by a range of actors.

The performances will be held at the Lionel Wendt Theatre, Colombo 7, Sri Lanka on the 30th, 31st January & 1stFebruary 2015 from 7.30pm with an additional matinee performance on 1stFebruary.

About the Director

Kevin Cruze is a dramatist who has been involved in theatre for over a decade. He has primarily acted in and directed multiple productions for the All Island Shakespeare Drama Competition for St. Joseph’s College, Colombo and has also been involved in multiple productions directed and produced by his guru Jehan Aloysius.

Kevin first started his directing career in 2004, directing and acting in Hamlet, which was placed third at the All Island Shakespeare Drama Competition. Kevin helped St. Joseph’s College win the competition in 2005 which garnered him the award for best director that same year.

Kevin staged his first public show ‘Lankawe Twins Kalabala’ in March 2012 which was a great success. He then formed his own theatre troupe ‘Cold Theatre 7’ in March 2013 and launched his company by staging one of Agatha Christie’s famous stories ‘And Then There Were None’ which was a theatrical success. He is now concentrating on continuing the good momentum he has gained in mainstream theatre.

About Cold Theatre 7

Cold Theatre 7, a brainchild of Kevin Cruze, was founded by him and 6 others in March 2013. Its vision is to ‘Create a pool or artistes with a variety of talents and develop their skills to a state where they could tell a familiar story in the most unfamiliar and surprising way.’

The Challenge

Theatre in Sri Lanka is largely unfunded. This makes staging quality and experimental creative work difficult and unprofitable. Staging THE MOUSETRAP depends heavily on the support of benefactors such as you.

In order to be able to mount the production of The Mousetrapin Sri Lanka, we need to raise USD 11,500.

We aim to raise USD 3,000 through this crowd-sourcing campaign.

Why support us?

By contributing to The Mousetrap you will be investing in the vision of Cold Theatre 7, an upcoming theatre troupe that provides opportunities for young talented individuals to showcase their skills to public audiences. You will be contributing to something much wider and greater than a single theatre show. You will be investing in a mission to support the nourishment of local theatre and literature, rather than through corporate or donor funding alone.

We also hope to use our theatrical experiences in helping develop drama & theatre among school children in Sri Lanka. Additionally we hope to donate the funds generated from our matinee show as well as all income generated by the sale of our souvenir for a worthy charitable cause.

We sincerely hope you will support our artistic endeavours by partnering with this production!

story:
Introduzione

Padania Classics è un progetto di ricerca visiva formalmente iniziato nel 2011 con l’intento di identificare i ‘Classici Padani’ nel campo dell’estetica, dell’architettura e dei comportamenti umani nel territorio del nord Italia, in vista di Milano Expo2015.

Da due anni fotografiamo, cataloghiamo e diffondiamo  sulla nostra pagina facebook il paesaggio contemporaneo del nord Italia in maniera tragicomica, tralasciando volutamente centri storici e aree naturali, sottolineando il patrimonio costruito negli ultimi 30 anni.

Finanziando la pubblicazione dell'Atlante dei Classici Padani ci aiuterai a diffondere la consapevolezza di quello che siamo diventati (al netto della ritenuta d'acconto).



Cosa ci serve & cosa avrai in cambio

Per pubblicare L'Atlante in forma completa abbiamo bisogno di molto aiuto ma siamo già a buon punto, grazie al lavoro gratuito messo a disposizione dai dipendenti aziendali di Padania Classics: abbiamo a disposizione un archivio di oltre 850 fotografie e un team editoriale composto da graphic designer, teorici della comunicazione e un giornalista!

Ora servono i maledetti 11.000 € (se solo ci fosse ancora la Lira!) per comprare la carta, stampare immagini e testi, rilegare in maniera decorosa tutti e 4 i volumi ed inserirli in un contenitore!

  • carta 2.000 €
  • stampa 6.500 €
  • rilegatura e cofanetti 2.500 €


Ovviamente non ci sogneremmo mai di chiedere Euro in cambio di nulla!
Abbiamo pensato ad una serie di premi degni della MacroRegione a seconda dell’importo della donazione effettuata.


5€  ➡︎  DONATORE DISOCCUPATO

Donando 5€ riceverai ottimo Karma e il tuo nome sarà inserito nella pagina dei finanziatori del progetto.


10€  ➡︎  DONATORE REGIME DEI MINIMI

Donando 10€ riceverai la nostra gratitudine e un tatuaggio trasferibile della Macroregione applicabile sul fondoschiena.


20€  ➡︎  DONATORE A PROGETTO

Donando 20€ riceverai il volume ‘Architettura e Paesaggio’ contenuto all’interno dell’Atlante dei Classici Padani


45€  ➡︎  DONATORE DIPENDENTE

Donando 45€ riceverai L’Atlante dei Classici Padani in tutti e 4 i volumi, nella confezione aziendale, ad un prezzo di preordine. Il prezzo di vendita dopo la raccolta fondi sarà di 60€



100€  ➡︎  DONATORE S.N.C.

Donando 100€ riceverai L’Atlante dei Classici Padani in tutti e 4 i volumi nella confezione aziendale, più una stampa fine-art 40x30cm firmata a tua scelta fra quelle dell'archivio (Ti contatteremo via mail dopo la donazione!)



500€  ➡︎  DONATORE S.R.L.

Donando 500€ avrai la possibilità di inserire la tua pubblicità aziendale a piena pagina all’interno dell’Atlante dei Classici Padani, e riceverai L’Atlante dei Classici Padani in omaggio.


1500€  ➡︎  DONATORE S.P.A.

Donando 1500€ ti offriremo la consulenza per aprire una società intestata ad un prestanome esistente, ma della quale deterrai piena proprietà garantendoti un imponibile fiscale pari al 4% annuo tutto compreso. L’azienda avrà sede ad Hong Kong, virtual-office a Bangkok, conto corrente dedicato in un paradiso fiscale con situazione politica stabile ed otterrai una carta di credito internazionale al fine di scaricare comodamente dagli sportelli Bancomat di tutto il mondo; inoltre studieremo il branding della tua nuova attività e ti consegneremo un sito internet funzionante.


  • Se non dovessimo raggiungere l'obiettivo finale di 11.000 € i soldi arrivati entro la chiusura della raccolta fondi diventeranno comunque la base per pubblicare l'Atlante dei Classici Padani, che integreremo con altri sponsor per arrivare ad avere il libro di qualità che abbiamo progettato.


    Perché il crowdfunding

    Avremmo potuto chiedere il finanziamento pubblico come il politico furfante, ma abbiamo scelto questa strada proprio perché questo progetto ci riguarda tutti: Il paesaggio siamo noi!
    La piana è asfaltata da Torino a Venezia e l'alto voltaggio ci collega anche la notte, fumiamo tutti la stessa sigaretta elettronificata e quando ci fermiamo per una pausa aziendale pensiamo tutti che qualcosa c'è al di là della nebbia, nei pressi del traliccio dietro l'azienda accanto al cavalcavia del centro commerciabile.


      Rischi & Sfide

      Editare una pubblicazione come questa è un lavoro lungo, e l'obiettivo di presentare il L'Atlante dei Classici Padani in occasione di Milano Expo2015 non è facile da centrare, ma se iniziamo determinati come i fatturatori che son riusciti a rendere Macro la Regione ce la faremo!

        Altri modi per aiutarci

        Sappiamo bene che il periodo non è facile per le finanze aziendali, e pure che quel poco che resta a fine mese basta a malapena per acquistare la polvere annusabile, ma se proprio non detieni il maledetto euro nel taschino puoi sempre:

        • Aiutarci condividendo ovunque puoi questa campagna
        • Parlarne a qualcuno che condivide queste tematiche
        • Effettuare una falsa fatturazione al fine di aggirare il fisco e trovare le risorse per la donazione

story:
http://www.station14.ca/video.html?id=956

https://www.flickr.com/photos/the-artel/

The Artel is a live-in artist-run gallery, venue and collective committed to fostering artistic growth by providing emerging artists with a supportive and stimulating environment. The Artel is an inclusive and safe space for community art production and facilitation. It fosters self-expression through a variety of mediums and opportunities for community and student initiated events. The Artel seeks to contribute to the development of a dynamic and diverse arts scene in the greater Kingston community. It does so by encouraging an open dialogue among artists, arts institutions and organizations as well as community groups and local organizations.

The Artel seeks to contribute to the development of a dynamic and diverse arts scene in the greater Kingston community. It does so by encouraging an open dialogue among artists, arts institutions and organizations as well as community groups and local organizations.

story:
Cindy was a visual artist, a friend, daughter and big sister. Creation was her calling. When she wasn’t working in esteemed museums like MoMA or MOCA, she was making videos, photographing, designing, drawing and inspiring friends to follow their creative passions.  Cindy Yeh left us too early leaving many projects unfinished. Among those projects was a zine called “Urban Velocity,” a love letter to the energy of New York created in collaboration with her friends.

She had been folding the first 10 copies of the zine the morning of the accident. The copies were not perfect—the printer created an unattractive big white margin in the middle of the booklet. However, Cindy was proud with this first attempt. She knew that with a couple more tries, the perfect print would have been soon shared among friends and art spaces, spreading her love of creation.


The people who worked on the project, and people who've known Cindy and her talent, would want all want her creations to go on. Through her work, Cindy will always be present with us.

To honor Cindy

we're hoping to create 300 professional prints of her zine, “Urban Velocity.” The copies will be shared with friends, family, strangers, art spaces, zine and book fairs on both the East and West coasts. We're hoping that you might find it in your hearts to contribute any sum you can afford to our fundraiser. Radix Media in Brooklyn, the city’s only worker-owned union print shop, will making our prints for us. The zine will come in a booklet format with saddle stitching binding the 52 pages together. The cover and back pages will be made of #80 cardstock and the interior will be #60 cardstock, both uncoated. The zine itself contains photography, personal essays, stories, drawings and more ways a group of friends have express their love for the speed of a city that never sleeps. Radix will charge us $835.00 for 300 prints. This is a pretty good price but we’ll need help from friends, family, zine fanatics and people that want to preserve Cindy’s legacy. Shipping the copies will then be the second main expense. We’re counting on the financial support from people interested in zines and art books. Even if you can only donate a few dollars that will help our cause.  

We plan to charge a small amount of $4 per zine in festivals and bookstores. With the profits we'll publish more copies of the zine to give away for free and print a second book of the most recent series of photographs Cindy had been working on. She hasn't had time to curate and share her series yet so we want to give her a way to show her creations. These unseen photographs will come as rewards for donations too.

Below is a list of people involved in the zine (by order of appearance):

- Cindy Yeh
- Shabnam Moallem
- Alexandre Cheval
- Francois Huyghe
- Lara McCaffrey
- Anton Haugen
- Jacqueline Fontugne
- Candace Ming
- Marietta Zafirakos
- Berat Chavez

Thank you

for reading our project proposal! I hope you can help us out or at least spread the word.

story:
Who Are We?

FCC Katy is a welcoming church community extending its arms to all people located in the heart of Katy, Texas. We are a marvelous mosaic of five generations of members – truly a family church.

  • We are located on 11 acres of land,
  • We currently use landscapers to mow our land and so we use only a very small portion of our land,
  • We are looking to purchase a riding lawnmower so that we can open our facility in new and creative ways to the Katy community.  We currently host a Fall Pumpkin Patch, Trunk or Treat, Beer & Hymn Sing, and an Easter Egg Hunt, but hope with this contribution we can add new space (a prayer space) for area people to fellowship, bring the family, come for prayer and contemplation.  We would also like to add a walking path.  This contribution would allow us to more fully use the grounds that we have and open them up to the larger Katy community around us as it continues to grow.

What We Need & What You Get...

  • We have matching funds for the first $500, but we need to raise $1200 total here.  This will allow us to purchase the mower, two additional benches and create the space for the walking path and prayer area.
  • There are all sorts of great perks from naming a bench, picking music in worship, a unique 3D printing of a FCC Katy Cross, to influencing the pastor's style.
  • The first funds we get will go straight to the mower.  This is the first step to creating this fun, safe community space.  From there, the addition of benches and the walking path will be added.  If we raise more funds, the money will go to the creation of a labyrinth in our prayer space.

The Impact

This campaign will allow the growing Katy community to have a safe prayer and community space.  

  • This will be a space of peace and calm in a crazy and chaotic world.
  • We have a long standing connection to the Katy community though ministries, the Interfaith Alliance and community projects and we hope to continue that relationship.
  • We are excited to be on this journey with the Katy community as we continue to grow and thrive in the suburbs of Houston

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?

  • Get the word out.  Share this with your friends and family and people you don't know.  Share on Facebook and social media, talk about it and check in to see how it is going.
  • Pray with us.  Continue to pray.

story:
Short Summary

I am DaniLeigh, singer/songwriter/dancer/actress, 21 years old, Born and Raised in Miami FL.

  • This campaign is so important to me. Nothing but blood, sweat and tears has been put into this project. Sessions til 4am writing and recording in the studio. I would love the opportunity for my project to be placed in the right hands. This requires money that I do not have right now and would love the opportunity to have. 
  • With you donating this will allow me to pay for a publicists, which will put my project on Apple music, MTV/Billboards website, VEVO, Big DJ/Radio Pages, Revolt, Important SoundCloud Repost pages, etc. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Funds will only be used to promote my project. I will also use the funds for mixing and mastering all of my songs, which is a huge expense. The funds will also go towards Branding. I believe my project will go as I expect it to. As soon as my EP reaches the pages it should be on, I feel like it will organically grow on it's own. Really letting the music do the talking. 
  • My EP consists of 6 songs. Each song having a different approach/back story. 3 uptempo records that will make you dance/feel super confident while also saying goodbye to your bad habits and the past. Then to finish, 3 urban based tracks that'll get you the right vibe. I try to be extra original when it comes to my music.Trying to Make you feel a different way when you listen to DaniLeigh
  • If I do not reach my entire goal for this Campaign I will still feel super satisfied. The fact that I am letting my ego go and showing the world that I am not afraid to ask for help, lets me know that I am confident in what I have created. Again, anything I make for this campaign will go towards my project and making new music for you and I.  

The Impact

  • My project is valuable to the contributor and to the world because I feel like my music can be an outlet for the occurrences in others lives. The type of music I make can be relatable to the young or the older woman and gentlemen. I write lyrics that script my life and others around me. The most valuable thing to me is writing down events as they happen and then creating the lyrics. That is where the magic of the song comes alive.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute, please help me spread this word. The more it's out, the more possibilities I can get to gain the funds I need to get my project out. 
  • Please don't forgot to use the IndieGogo Share tools, that will be the easiest way to share my campaign with the world.

story:
Introduction

Because of my last two major art projects, "Out of Balance" at Kunstraum Engländerbau in Liechtenstein and "Turmmatt" in a former workers' settlement in Altdorf, Switzerland, in which I was dealing with breaking down borders and boundaries and connecting people, I was invited by the director of the international artist collective Nine Dragon Heads, Byoung Uk Park, to participate in the Art Politic-Border Crossing ONSAEMIRO.

This art project likewise is site-specific with a research component about space and borders. My participation in this project requires two trips to Korea, a multi-day research on site, time to conceptualise and develop my work, and a journey to set up the completed work.

About me: martinwohlwend.com


What I Need & What You Get

The cost for the project is as follows (approx. in EUR):

  • 2 round-trip tickets to Seoul, Korea: EUR 1800
  • Participation fee for board and accommodation (Sept./Oct.): EUR 1227
  • 1  week board and accommodation incl. workshop (April): EUR 630
  • Food for 3 weeks (April/Sept./Oct. = 21 x EUR 22.50): EUR 472.50
  • Public transportation cost in Korea and independent site visits: EUR 180
  • Material for art work and transportation cost including artist fees: EUR 4501

Total Project Cost: EUR 8810.50 

Contributions already received by other means than crowdfunding: EUR -4501.50

Amount still needed: EUR 4309

Transaction fees by INDIEGOGO (2.9%) = EUR 125 
Transfer fee for payout: EUR 25

Fundraising goal: EUR 4459

As a sign of appreciation and acknowledgment for your contribution, you can receive an original drawing or painting signed by me (see perks) or contribute without receiving perks.

In addition, I will keep you updated on the progress of my project.

--------------------------------------------

Project Details

 

 

Contributors:

 

Nine 
Dragon 
Heads 

Introduction 

Nine Dragon Heads aspires to generate positive environmental and spiritual legacies for the future. This is in a context where humankind benefits from manipulating and dominating its natural surroundings; regarding the natural environment as a target and challenge for conquest, a test of its ability to transform and possess nature. 

Our desire and ingenuity to exploit and develop the natural environment through domination and control implies superiority. Reflecting on the history of the planet however, many species of all forms became extinct when the friendly environmental conditions that firstly nurtured their birth later changed and became hostile. 

The question of when will humankind disappear hangs over us. No matter how 'special' we Homo Sapiens think we may be, we have to realise we are a part of the greater natural world and the product of a unique environment that supports our life. 

How can we lead a life with understanding and respect for the world of nature? How can we maintain a life peacefully and fairly for the survival of mankind? 

Nine Dragon Heads changes ‘I’ into ‘we’, a community of artists, who explore and re-consider the relationship and equilibrium between people and the natural environment. 

Nine Dragon Heads joins with other communities to share their imagination, experience and ideas through creative art practices, to reveal and celebrate both diverse and common consciousness and to further co-operation. 

Nine Dragon Heads aims to further greater understanding of human nature and the world through restorative creative action and engagement and in so doing aims to leave a healthier environment - the heritage of the future - to posterity. 

Director of Nine Dragon Heads 
PARK BYOUNG UK 

 

“DMZ & JSA" 2019
Art Politic-Border Crossing ONSAEMIRO

"DMZ & JSA” is the fourth project from the Nine Dragon Heads' series of events that emphasize a new component in NDH’s current activity. It is working on the subjects of mutual influences and connections between a art event and the geography of its realization, a international art politic, and a large-scale art event with a fixed location and periodicity. Alongside the usual mode of NDH such as open-air symposiums, research-oriented workshops, exhibitions and conferences, these projects will be held in the Demilitarized Zone and Joint Sceurity Area (DMZ & JSA), the 155mile from West to East Borderline that divides the North and South Korea, and will be realised through both an exhibition and research presentation at the Suwon Museum of Art, Experimental Space UZ, Space NOON. 

The research destination of DMZ is a weapons-free buffer zone between North and South Korea. The area was established on July 27, 1953 when the Armistice Agreement was signed during the Korean War, and created a the 2km-wide stretch of land both north and south of the demarcation line. The DMZ extends largely from Gyeonggi-do to Gangwon-do, includes seven different cities and smaller counties of Paju, Yeoncheon, Cheorwon, Hwacheon, Yanggu, Inje and Goseong. As a results, The zone has been protected from human disturbance for the last six decades and has unintentionally become a haven for wildlife. 

With the project "DMZ & JSA" Nine Dragon Heads continues its journey on important geographic routes and the locations of special environmental, cultural and historical significance. Working within the DMZ & JSA will be especially rewarding for the NDH artists-researchers for several reasons. 

As a multimedia art project, "DMZ & JSA" will examine the complexity of environmental and social issues as well as the political, geographic, historical, and cultural aspects of the DMZ & JSA. This will be presented through an Archive Show and include installation, video, sculpture, photography, and performance. 

The title "Border Crossing ONSAEMIRO" refers to an artistic investigation of the nature of borders. On the one hand, the title underlines the vital importance of something happening inside the restricted and exceptional environment of the DMZ & JSA, while on the other it offers the possibility of going outside the visible or hidden limits - not only physically, but also intellectually, in order to research differences and commonalities that can be found at the DMZ & JSA . 

“DMZ & JSA” presents the works of the International Environmental Art Symposium - Nine Dragon Heads. Nine Dragon Heads is an interdisciplinary platform where artists from across the 5 continents work in locations that may be environmentally, economically or politically troubled, following important cultural, historical and geopolitical routes. Initiated in South Korea in 1995 in response to the destruction of an important historical site, Nine Dragon Heads has evolved to address varying crises and transitory situations in localized and situation-specific ways. The title of the project “Border Crossing ONSAEMIRO” refers to the inherently spontaneous nature of the International Environmental Art Symposium which will react to the particular geographic and environmental situation of the DMZ & JSA 2019. The project accompanied by an exhibition of working traces, artifacts and performances from within the DMZ at the Suwon Museum of Art, Space UZ , Space NOON from 22th, Sept to 5th, OCT, 2019.

“DMZ & JSA” brings together site-specific work, installation, video, sculpture, photography and performance. It synthesizes and facilitates joint and individual works, while threads of overlapping artistic inquiry are produced in a process of evolving collaborative association. Participating artists do not aim to place full stops or to answer specific questions. Rather, they look for the creation of a space where experimental open air and public art-practice results in an ethical artistic message. 

“DMZ & JSA ”is not supported by any formal umbrella institution or major foundation. The majority of organizational functions are implemented directly by the Nine Dragon Heads participating artists, with directorial overview and coordination provided by Park Byoung Uk, the project’s artistic director.

“DMZ & JSA” is organized in collaboration with the SHUROOP art group and dedicated to the support and promotion of contemporary visual arts. The project is curated by Magda Guruli.

 

Research & Workshop

Through the DMZ 155 mile https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demilitarized_zone 

1st Part : 22th~ 23th. SEPT – West Area : DMZ & JSA ( Panmumjom ) 
2nd Part : 24th~ 25th. SEPT – Middle Area : DMZ ( Yeonchoen / Cheol Won ) 
3rd Part : 26th~ 27th. SEPT – East Area : DMZ ( Unification Observatory )  

“DMZ & JSA” is similar in structure to previous NDH location specific symposia, with one key difference: it is expected that works will be researched in advance and planned.

About Venues - DMZ & JSA 

DMZ ( Demilitarized Zone )

The Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) is a weapons-free buffer zone between North and South Korea. The area was established on July 27, 1953 when the Armistice Agreement was signed during the Korean War, and includes the 2km-wide stretch of land both north and south of the line. The DMZ extends largely from Gyeonggi-do to Gangwon-do, including seven different cities and smaller counties of Paju, Yeoncheon, Cheorwon, Hwacheon, Yanggu, Inje and Goseong. The zone has been protected from human disturbance for about 6 decades and has unintentionally become a haven for wildlife, making it a popular destination for nature lovers.

Location 

The Korean Demilitarized Zone intersects but does not follow the 38th parallel north, which was the border before the Korean War. It crosses the parallel on an angle, with the west end of the DMZ lying south of th e parallel and the east end lying north of it. 

The DMZ is 250 kilometres long, approximately 4 km wide. Though the zone separating both sides is demilitarized, the border beyond that strip is one of the most heavily militarized borders in the world. The Northern Limit Line, or NLL, is the disputed maritime demarcation line between North and South Korea in the Yellow Sea, not agreed in the armistice. The coastline and islands on both sides of the NLL are also heavily militarized. 

History 

The 38th parallel north—which divides the Korean Peninsula roughly in half—was the original boundary between the United States and Soviet Union's brief administration areas of Korea at the end of World War II. Upon the creation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK, informally North Korea) and the Republic of Korea (ROK, informally South Korea) in 1948, it became a de factointernational border and one of the most tense fronts in the Cold War. 

Both the North and the South remained dependent on their sponsor states from 1948 to the outbreak of the Korean War. That conflict, which claimed over three million lives and divided the Korean Peninsula along ideological lines, commenced on 25 June 1950, with a full-front 

DPRK invasion across the 38th parallel, and ended in 1953 after international intervention pushed the front of the war back to near the 38th parallel. 

In the Armistice Agreement of 27 July 1953, the DMZ was created as each side agreed to move their troops back 2,000 m (2,200 yards) from the front line, creating a buffer zone 4 km (2.5 mi) wide. The Military Demarcation Line (MDL) goes through the center of the DMZ and indicates where the front was when the agreement was signed. 

Owing to this theoretical stalemate, and genuine hostility between the North and the South, large numbers of troops are still stationed along both sides of the line, each side guarding against potential aggression from the other side. The armistice agreement explains exactly how many military personnel and what kind of weapons are allowed in the DMZ. Soldiers from both sides may patrol inside the DMZ, but they may not cross the MDL; ROK soldiers, however heavily armed, patrol under the aegis of military police, and have memorized each line of the armistice Sporadic outbreaks of violence have killed over 500 South Korean soldiers, 50 US soldiers and 250 soldiers from DPRK along the DMZ between 1953 and 1999. Daeseong-dong (also written Tae Sung Dong) and Kijŏng-dong are the only settlements allowed by the armistice committee to remain within the boundaries of the DMZ. Residents of Tae Sung Dong are governed and protected by the United Nations Command and are generally required to spend at least 240 nights per year in the village to maintain their residency. In 2008, the village had a population of 218 people. The villagers of Tae Sung Dong are direct descendants of people who owned the land before the 1950–53 Korean War. 

To continue to deter North Korean incursion, in 2014 the United States government exempted the Korean DMZ from its pledge to eliminate anti-personnel landmines. On October 1, 2018, however, a 20-day process began to remove landmines from both sides of the DMZ. 

The above is taken from Korean Demilitarized Zone, 

http://military.wikia.com/wiki/Korean_Demilitar...

JSA ( Joint Security Area ) 

The Joint Security Area (JSA) is the only portion of the Korean Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) where North and South Korean forces stand face-to-face. It is often called the Truce Village of Panmunjom (the Truce Village; or simply, Panmunjom) in the media and various military accounts. 

The JSA is used by the two Koreas for diplomatic engagements and, until March 1991, was also the site of military negotiations between North Korea and the United Nations Command (UNC). In 2018, North and South Korean officials ordered the JSA to be cleared of all landmines, weapons, guard posts, and personnel. This withdrawal was complete on October 25, 2018 and the JSA now just contains 35 unarmed security guards. The area will also no longer function in its current state and it was agreed that it will now just serve as a tourist attraction. 

The Joint Security Area is located at 37°57′21″N 126°40′36″ECoordinates: 

37°57′21″N 126°40′36″E lying within the village of Panmunjom. 

The original village of Panmunjom encompassed a larger area than the current inter-military complex of the JSA, and consisted mostly of farms. The JSA itself is actually about 800 meters (1⁄2 mile) south of where the village proper used to be, though still within the village's old farming area. It is because of this proximity that there is often ambiguity between the terms JSA or Panmunjom. Panmunjom no longer exists as an inhabited village as it was destroyed during the war, and all that now remains on the site of the village is the building constructed for the signing of the armistice agreement, now the North Korea Peace Museum. 

Residing within the North Korean half of the DMZ, the village has not been rebuilt or repopulated, but the name carries on and the name is now used to usually refer to the JSA. The village gained lasting fame as the site where the Korean Armistice Agreement was negotiated. General Nam Il of North Korea and General William Harrison, Jr. of the United 

Nations Command signed the armistice agreement at 10:00 am on July 27, 1953, in a hastily constructed pavilion at Panmunjom. 

General Mark W. Clark, Commander-in-Chief, UNC, later countersigned the document in a separate ceremony at Munsan, approximately 18 kilometers (11 mi) south of the DMZ; and Marshal Kim Il Sung, Korean People's Army (KPA) Supreme Commander, along with Peng Dehuai, Commander, Chinese People's Volunteer Army (CPV), countersigned it at Kaesong, approximately 10 kilometers (6 mi) to the north in another separate ceremony. 

The JSA has been the site of numerous major events since its establishment in 1953, the first of which was the repatriation of prisoners of war (POWs) after the cessation of hostilities, across the Bridge of No Return. 

Map of the current Joint Security Area (JSA) showing the red Military Demarcation Line (MDL) and the buildings; solid black are occupied by North Korea (KPA) and the white are occupied by South Korea (ROK) and the United Nations (UN)
 

About Venues - Yeongang Gallery

A GROUNDBREAKING ART GALLERY NEAR THE NORTH-SOUTH KOREAN BORDER

Above the South Korean Civilian Control Line, 

which runs alongside the Demilitarized Zone (commonly known as the DMZ), the gallery is the first of its kind to open near the heavily armed border.

The Korean DMZ seems like an unlikely place to find contemporary art. Yet, 

the Yeongang Art Gallery is perched on the edge of it, in an area known as Yeoncheon county. The gallery exhibits art from around the world and serves as a concert venue. 

"It's extremely interesting to see the contrast between the military and the geography here 

Since the ceasefire in 1953, to enter the Civilian Control Zone in Yeoncheon, all visitors should go through a guard post. In a short moment when sentries check our ID cards and the number of visitors, we leave one reality and enter another. After running through the uninhabited CCZ, we reach the Yeongang Gallery, which was renovated from a building used as a security museum and opened in June 2016. It is the first art space established in the CCZ in 60 years. "Yeongang" is another name for the Imjingang River. 

https://edition.cnn.com/style/article/yeongang-...

https://ggc.ggcf.kr/p/5b5b43687a74c422d68411f1

 

About Venues -Suwon Museum of Art

Suwon I’Park Museum of Art was established in 2015 in the plaza of the Hwaseong Haenggung Palace, which was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site. 

Suwon is home to one of Korea’s representative cultural heritage landmarks, the Hwaseong Fortress The museum sought to establish the identity and cultural development of Suwon arts and form a cultural space where the citizens of Suwon can enjoy high-quality exhibitions. Suwon Museum of Art aims to develop Suwon’s art culture through various exhibitions and educational programs that reinterpret Suwon’s historicity and cultural symbolism in a modern sense.

Facilities 

The museum has total 5 galleries, gallery 1, 2 and 3 on the ground floor and gallery 4 and 5 on the second floor. The contemporary art in various kinds of genres is presented in the galleries.

https://sima.suwon.go.kr/eng/index.do
story_txt:
Introduction
Because of my last two major art projects, "Out of Balance" at Kunstraum Engländerbau in Liechtenstein and "Turmmatt" in a former workers' settlement in Altdorf, Switzerland, in which I was dealing with breaking down borders and boundaries and connecting people, I was invited by the director of the international artist collective Nine Dragon Heads, Byoung Uk Park, to participate in the Art Politic-Border Crossing ONSAEMIRO.
This art project likewise is site-specific with a research component about space and borders. My participation in this project requires two trips to Korea, a multi-day research on site, time to conceptualise and develop my work, and a journey to set up the completed work.
About me: martinwohlwend.com


What I Need & What You Get
The cost for the project is as follows (approx. in EUR):

2 round-trip tickets to Seoul, Korea: EUR 1800
Participation fee for board and accommodation (Sept./Oct.): EUR 1227
1  week board and accommodation incl. workshop (April): EUR 630
Food for 3 weeks (April/Sept./Oct. = 21 x EUR 22.50): EUR 472.50
Public transportation cost in Korea and independent site visits: EUR 180
Material for art work and transportation cost including artist fees: EUR 4501

Total Project Cost: EUR 8810.50 
Contributions already received by other means than crowdfunding: EUR -4501.50
Amount still needed: EUR 4309
Transaction fees by INDIEGOGO (2.9%) = EUR 125 Transfer fee for payout: EUR 25
Fundraising goal: EUR 4459
As a sign of appreciation and acknowledgment for your contribution, you can receive an original drawing or painting signed by me (see perks) or contribute without receiving perks.
In addition, I will keep you updated on the progress of my project.
--------------------------------------------
