story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Phoebe and I am an animation graduate and multidisciplinary artist from Brisbane, QLD Australia.
  • Having grown up with a guitar in my hand and many musician family members, I have always been passionate about music, and started making my own at 14. I am ready now to properly record and produce my first EP. 
  • By contribution to this campaign, you will be funding my production of the music as well as the creation of a zine that will come with the EP.
  • You can hear some of my older music here: http://www.soundcloud.com/ellababicci

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Most of the funds of this campaign will go towards the manufacturing (designing, printing, producing, studio hire) of the zine and music, as well as distribution and living expenses.
  • When you donate, you will receive fun things like digital downloads of my back catalog of music, original artwork and prints, and even original animations and songs written to your briefing.
  • If I don't reach the full campaign amount, I will still go ahead and make both the EP and zine, but both will be much more humble projects, and the zines will be very limited edition (10-20 copies in total)

The Impact

  • When you support this project, you are supporting a local artist, and will get your hands on original and personalised content.
  • If I reach my campaign goal, I believe the finished project would be wrapped up in early August.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute to this campaign, but would still like to support me in some way, you can like my facebook page:

  • Ella Babicci
  • And follow me on soundcloud, under the same name.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read through!

story:
Introdução

É notório que existe na cidade do Porto um grupo rico e prolífico de criativos, com capacidade e vontade de se dar a conhecer, ainda que as oportunidades para a divulgação do seu trabalho não abundem. Nós acreditamos que a cidade não pode ficar aquém das demais metrópoles europeias, as quais têm vindo a apoiar os jovens artistas, mantendo em mente que o ilustre desconhecido nos centros urbanos de hoje pode ser o próximo Keith Haring ou Jean-Michel Basquiat. De facto, apesar de na cidade do Porto existirem óptimos profissionais dentro destas áreas, cuja reputação tem vindo a crescer fora de portas, a cidade tem-se mantido à margem dos roteiros artísticos mundiais, no que se refere à arte urbana.

Neste sentido iremos realizar em Setembro de 2014, com o apoio da Câmara Municipal do Porto, o Festival Push Porto. Um evento multi-disciplinar a decorrer na cidade Invicta com especial foco na arte urbana, o qual seguramente permitirá chamar a atenção do público em geral para estas áreas criativas, bem como propiciar a sua divulgação por parte dos órgãos de comunicação social.

O que nos motiva e nos faz sentir confiantes em relação ao sucesso deste evento é a possibilidade de estar a trabalhar no que se designa como “art for all”, qualidade intrínseca à arte urbana e que serve de grande atrativo para a mesma. Refira-se que esta é uma iniciativa sem fins lucrativos porque todos os dias o Porto nos surpreende com o melhor que tem e acreditamos está na altura de retribuirmos com o que de melhor temos para dar.



Festival

O Push Porto pretende ser um festival multi-cultural com foco na arte urbana e ilustração. À semelhança de muitas outras metrópoles mundiais, a cidade Invicta deve tomar o seu lugar no circuito do graffiti de qualidade e para tal nada melhor que um evento que concentre alguns dos melhores artistas nacionais e internacionais da área. Para além de ser uma óptima oportunidade de proceder a um embelezamento do espaço urbano degradado, é uma forma de conectar os cidadãos com a sua cidade, criando um sentimento de pertença e orgulho pelo património público. A possibilidade de assistir in loco à efervescência artística da cidade é algo que de certo marcará qualquer pessoa que se cruze com uma das muitas atividades do festival. É de considerar também que esta é um bom modelo para cativar o público estrangeiro amante deste tipo de arte. Desta forma, consideramos que um evento desta envergadura é uma mais valia para Invicta neste ano em que é considerada o melhor destino Europeu.

O festival irá englobar diversas atividades que percorrem este tipo de artes emergentes como por exemplo pintura de murais e exposições que formarão um roteiro criativo por toda a cidade do Porto:

Para além disto vamos também ter diversas atividades a acontecer durante toda a semana, como workshops, palestras, festas, instalações e acções de sensibilização. 

Tal como observamos em cidades como Lisboa, com a GAU e a Underdogz, e em Ponta Delgada, com o festival Walk and Talk, este tipo de iniciativas tem sempre grande apoio e admiração por parte dos cidadãos. O impacto nas cidades é sempre positivo. Cria-se um novo tipo de turismo, cultivam-se os cidadãos e acima de tudo combate-se a degradação das cidades através da arte. 


O que precisamos

Pretendemos que este festival seja gratuito e aberto a toda a população e desta forma necessitamos de toda o apoio possível de forma a conseguirmos concretizar todas as actividades que temos planeadas para esta semana de grande criatividade.

Para além de apoio monetário estamos à procura de:

  • Alimentação para os artistas que vêm pintar os murais e para os oradores que vêm dar palestras;
  • Viagens e estadias para os mesmos;
  • Andaimes;
  • Tintas (tanto tintas de rolo como tintas spray);
  • Impressões de cartazes, flyers e mapas;
  • Voluntários para filmarem, fotografarem e ajudarem no que for preciso durante o festival.
Para este ou outro tipo de apoios por favor contactem-nos por e-mail: 

festivalpushporto@gmail.com

story:
Why We Need the Oinks to Fill the Piggy Bank

If you've been reading Vine Leaves for a while, you know that we've been up and running since December of 2011. 

Well ... we're getting bigger and bigger every year, and that means it's costing us a lot more money to keep the piggy bank full of mud. We are getting more than 4000 unique views a month and the compliments via email take our breaths away. Which is pretty damn excellent for a magazine running only a little under three years.

That is thanks to YOU. 

We are now publishing single-author vignette collections through Vine Leaves Press and offering a 70% royalty on both paperback and eBook. We are big (HUGE!) supporters of writers, so anything less just feels like robbery. But this means we don't make money. Because any money that we receive goes straight back into the journal and paying contributors for their work.

We have tried to get grant support through the Australian Council for the Arts, but in order to be eligible, we would have to publish only Australian literature. We are not willing to do that. There is a world of amazing writers out there. We can NOT make that sacrifice for arts funding.

Can you help us?

Please do us the honour of donating a few bucks to our mission: to give the vignette, a forgotten literary form, the exposure and credit it deserves. 

Just think of it as buying two coffees one morning, instead of one, for the greater good of the vignette!

What We Need

  • We need about 6000 Euros to be able to run the magazine the way we want to in 2015. At the moment we are paying contributors a measly 3.5 Euro for their work no matter its length, which we are struggling to afford. We would really love to pay generously. If possible, 30 Euro per acceptance. We publish 4 issues a year, and 40 writers per issue. That's 4800 Euros. The extra 1200 Euro is much needed for costs such as website hosting, advertising, and paperback publishing. All staff at Vine Leaves will remain volunteers. We will not be keeping any of this money ourselves.
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, we will still use the money for the journal and for paying contributors as much as possible in 2015.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Please get the word out by making some noise about this campaign on social media. You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools.
      • If you'd like to alert us on Twitter that you've shared this, our Twitter handle is @VineLeavesLJ

      Thank you thank you thank you for your support!


      Please note: We are an Australian journal, but the Publishing Editor is currently living in Greece and it's therefore being run from there at present.

story:
I can't believe this is our third year anniversary!
It's been quite the journey!  We've made some amazing friends and lost some friends along the way.. but in the end, what was once just a Playa dream has manifested into something truly amazing. 

Building an Art Car of this size is A LOT of work.  More then I have ever anticipated, but the rewards are there.  I've learned so much over the past two years.... that I can finally say... XUZA is just about PLAYA READY! 

We just need to raise some more funds to get her there!  
She needs a new coat of the WildfireFX.com UV Reactive White Paint, we we in such a rush last year that she wasn't properly sealed.  This year she needs 5-6 gallons of paint @ $195.00 per gallon, and worth every drop!

We need to get new tires all the way around, that's 6 new high weight rated tires at $265 ea.  We have ripped out all the electrical and need to finalize the brand new wiring, and electronics....  I never realized how expensive good high amp rated wire is. Plus....tune ups for the motor and generators...   We also need do some minor maintainence repairs on XUZA's 49' Trailer. At least three new tires need to be purchased and we need to replace some of the wood Deck Rails. 

We couldn't be more ready to BURN!!!

We will be arriving on the Playa Monday night before gates open so that this year .... XUZA will be ready for you as soon as the gates open on Sunday Night!

Thanks again!

We Love You!

Mike C.
Justin - Case

Check out our new 8' x20' programmable LED Ceiling!


We are offering a four hour LED 101 class with 5- five meter rolls of ws2812 assignable led's so you can started on your own LED Art Project!

Amazing Perks

Last year our 2015 green LED Slap Bands were a hit.. everyone wanted one. Make sure you guarentee yours today!


We are only offering three custom Burn Barrels this year!

Make sure you select the perk so we can have yours created and brought to you at Black Rock City!

story:
The show explores the echoes and the subtle relationships that are established between works that are sometimes critical, and always fascinating. It has been a long time discussion about the erroneous statement, “Cuban artists working outside Cuba, their creations for some art organizations, galleries and institutions in the United States are not considered Cuban art”. With this exhibition we are sending a clear message, “We are Cuban artists”. The focus of attention is centered on artists from different generations. Many of the works selected have in common the fact of working with different levels of meaning at the same time and show in parallel a special taste for the common, the popular and the everyday, aspects that are conferred poetic status and a strange and attractive beauty. The works comprise a broad spectrum of interests, although their diversity does not prevent the interaction between all of them.

The contributions and fundings as a resolt of this campaign will help us the amplifite the magnitud of cuban artists that continue working at a professional level. We are planing to plublish a book and conduct a series of artists talk related with all the aspects of this show.

story:
"We shape our homes, and then our homes shape us."  - Winston Churchill


"A house is much more than mere shelter.  It should lift us emotionally and spiritually." - John Saladino, American Architect and Interior Designer


"Even a glimpse of beauty feeds our soul."  - Barbara Barry, Interior Designer


Dear Friends,


As some of you many know, I am an interior designer and Founder of a nonprofit organization called Her Haven.  Her Haven was formed out of my belief that a well-designed, comfortable space makes a difference in our lives: by lifting spirits, affirming our dignity, and offering hope.  Her Haven brings this gift of design to deserving women, but I as a designer remain committed to serving clients from all walks of life, and to anyone in need of a nurturing, well-designed space.  


I have recently had the wonderful honor of working to bring beauty to Prospect House, a homeless shelter operated by Recovery Network of Programs (RNP),  a nonprofit social service agency that has been serving the Greater Bridgeport Community since 1972 to restore hope, health and well being for individuals in recovery.  Named among the Top Workplaces in CT for the past 3 years, their commitment to using a holistic approach while embracing compassion, dignity and respect is second to none.  I am in awe every day by the dedication of the staff, who provide not only food and shelter, but also comfort, dignity and hope for their clients.


RNP is embarking on a long-range development of their facilities, including freshly painted interiors, new flooring, and new furniture.  But we can’t stop there.


ART IS IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERY


“There is a substantial body of evidence to support the role that the arts can have in promoting and maintaining satisfactory levels of health and well being” according to the Arts and Health Program; and this report identifies improvements widely experienced and attributed to participation in arts and health programs. These include: improved motivation; increased social engagement; enhanced self confidence and self esteem; increased resilience and a more relaxed state of mind; better concentration; increased self expression and self understanding; and a stronger more positive sense of self.”


THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT IS IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERY


The built environment is an integral part of our everyday experience as human beings. It “speaks” a language that transcends countries and borders, and for which no dictionary is required.  More than providing shelter from the elements, the built environment can tell us that we are worthless, poor, and without hope... or it can inspire, confer a sense of dignity, and tell us that we deserve good things.  


Most of us have a comfortable home, a favorite room, or at least a special chair or nook to curl up in at the end of the day.  If we are not fortunate enough to have a home that affords us these “simple” luxuries, we can always turn to nature to recharge our psychic batteries--there is nothing like the smell of a forest, the spray of the ocean, or the beauty of a sunset to center and ground us. Whether in our homes or in nature, we need periods of calm and tranquility to serve as tonics to the stresses of everyday life.


Unfortunately, there are those among us who have neither. 


Without a home or a means of transportation to escape to nature, the beauty and tranquility of an urban shelter takes on great urgency. For shelter residents -- indeed, for any low-income families or people struggling with the stresses of overcoming illness, addiction or trauma, beauty is not a luxury. It is beauty they need to make their own,  to begin the process of building beautiful lives. 


COMMUNITIES ARE IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERY


Communities are vital to our lives and wellbeing, and when we reach across barriers and support each other, we ALL benefit.  


We are opening Art & Artists to bring together GOOD DESIGN and GOOD PEOPLE to do GOOD THINGS, and make a powerful improvement in people’s lives.


HOW YOU CAN HELP

Please help us help others by supporting ART and ARTISTS for PROSPECT HOUSE and DONATE TODAY!   No donation is too large or too small, and every dollar will make a difference to improve lives.  


Thank you,
Carey Dougherty
story_txt:
"We shape our homes, and then our homes shape us."  - Winston Churchill"A house is much more than mere shelter.  It should lift us emotionally and spiritually." - John Saladino, American Architect and Interior Designer"Even a glimpse of beauty feeds our soul."  - Barbara Barry, Interior DesignerDear Friends,As some of you many know, I am an interior designer and Founder of a nonprofit organization called Her Haven.  Her Haven was formed out of my belief that a well-designed, comfortable space makes a difference in our lives: by lifting spirits, affirming our dignity, and offering hope.  Her Haven brings this gift of design to deserving women, but I as a designer remain committed to serving clients from all walks of life, and to anyone in need of a nurturing, well-designed space.  I have recently had the wonderful honor of working to bring beauty to Prospect House, a homeless shelter operated by Recovery Network of Programs (RNP),  a nonprofit social service agency that has been serving the Greater Bridgeport Community since 1972 to restore hope, health and well being for individuals in recovery.  Named among the Top Workplaces in CT for the past 3 years, their commitment to using a holistic approach while embracing compassion, dignity and respect is second to none.  I am in awe every day by the dedication of the staff, who provide not only food and shelter, but also comfort, dignity and hope for their clients.RNP is embarking on a long-range development of their facilities, including freshly painted interiors, new flooring, and new furniture.  But we can’t stop there.ART IS IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERY“There is a substantial body of evidence to support the role that the arts can have in promoting and maintaining satisfactory levels of health and well being” according to the Arts and Health Program; and this report identifies improvements widely experienced and attributed to participation in arts and health programs. These include: improved motivation; increased social engagement; enhanced self confidence and self esteem; increased resilience and a more relaxed state of mind; better concentration; increased self expression and self understanding; and a stronger more positive sense of self.”
THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT IS IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERYThe built environment is an integral part of our everyday experience as human beings. It “speaks” a language that transcends countries and borders, and for which no dictionary is required.  More than providing shelter from the elements, the built environment can tell us that we are worthless, poor, and without hope... or it can inspire, confer a sense of dignity, and tell us that we deserve good things.  Most of us have a comfortable home, a favorite room, or at least a special chair or nook to curl up in at the end of the day.  If we are not fortunate enough to have a home that affords us these “simple” luxuries, we can always turn to nature to recharge our psychic batteries--there is nothing like the smell of a forest, the spray of the ocean, or the beauty of a sunset to center and ground us. Whether in our homes or in nature, we need periods of calm and tranquility to serve as tonics to the stresses of everyday life.Unfortunately, there are those among us who have neither. Without a home or a means of transportation to escape to nature, the beauty and tranquility of an urban shelter takes on great urgency. For shelter residents -- indeed, for any low-income families or people struggling with the stresses of overcoming illness, addiction or trauma, beauty is not a luxury. It is beauty they need to make their own,  to begin the process of building beautiful lives. COMMUNITIES ARE IN THE SCIENCE OF RECOVERYCommunities are vital to our lives and wellbeing, and when we reach across barriers and support each other, we ALL benefit.  We are opening Art & Artists to bring together GOOD DESIGN and GOOD PEOPLE to do GOOD THINGS, and make a powerful improvement in people’s lives.HOW YOU CAN HELPPlease help us help others by supporting ART and ARTISTS for PROSPECT HOUSE and DONATE TODAY!   No donation is too large or too small, and every dollar will make a difference to improve lives.  Thank you,Carey Dougherty

story:
Our Story

Roots and River Productions grew from the small seed of an idea. Artistic Director Azure D. Osborne-Lee moved to New York City and experienced firsthand how difficult it can be for an emerging artist, especially an artist of color, to make headway in the theatre. And so, out of a desire to foster artistic community for queer artists of color, Roots and River Productions was born.

 

Roots and River's mission is to produce creative work grounded in the community. The company is an artistic home for artists of color residing in the New York City metropolitan area. Roots and River serves as an incubator for new work, a site of artistic exploration, and an agency for community outreach.

 

The company's primary programming consists of the Roots and River Emerging Artist Mentorship Program and a portable, sustainable model for creating new work, simply called the Voicebox Workshops. Roots and River Productions has a particular interest in supporting the work of emerging interdisciplinary and performing artists. In 2012 Roots and River will kick off an artist residency program.

The Impact

Roots and River's team has been hard at work since the beginning of the year producing the Voicebox Writing Workshop series internationally and setting up a mentorship program for emerging black queer artists in Brooklyn, New York, which will launch this fall. We have a vision and the drive, but we need your help to keep us going! 

What We Need & What You Get

Making work in the big city isn't cheap! Our goal is to raise at least $3000 for the 2011/2012 Roots and River Emerging Artist Mentorship Program. This will cover stipends for our mentors as well as the cost of workshops for our mentees. Additionally, your contributions will help defray other program costs such as rehearsal, meeting, or studio space rental and transportation fees.

Other Ways You Can Help

Roots and River accepts donations in all forms. If you have goods, services, or supplies that you would like to contribute, then we would be happy to receive them. Examples include paper, envelopes, photocopying privileges, and studio and/or rehearsal space. Every little bit counts and is much appreciated!

story:
Hi, my name is Linda Wicker. I am a single parent of four wonderful kids. I take care of my family, and make my living by creating and selling art. While I have had no professional training in the art field, my imaginative style and often humorous artwork has been collected around the world, and I have many return buyers as well as many who seek me out for commissioned pieces.

There is a running joke about most artists being "starving artists", until they are dead of course. I'm sure $120 million would have been a great benefit to Mr. Edvard Munch when he was alive ;) While I don't need quite $120 million, I do need help.

I am here campaigning to raise funds to purchase supplies and equipment that I need to further my success as an artist. These materials and the equipment I am in need of will give me a strong foundation and a sturdy platform to reach the next level of my goals. Not only will these things allow me to stock prints for shows and sale, it will also give me a great start on my goal of having a gallery showing in the near future.

With the ability to produce quality prints and keep a stock of my work, I will be able to sell prints, publish art books, cards, and decorative items, sell my work through galleries and publications, and travel to various locations for art shows.

Your help will not only boost my career as an artist, but it will give me the ability to produce the income I need, and allow me to gain the financial security to be able to care for my family without struggling or being dependent on others to help us through.

Why am I asking for $5,000?

Here is a list of my needs:

  • A wide format, art quality scanner and printer.
  • 10 complete ink refills for the printer to keep me going while I get better established.
  • Website upgrades and self-promotion: business cards, labels, advertising products, packaging
  • Paper supplies: stock of quality art paper to print, art papers, cards, and canvases for current sales and large canvases for my future gallery showing.
  • To stock up medium that I use: a variety of paints, pens, pencils, and additional woodworking tools. Also a larger supply of oil paints to accomplish my collection of large gallery paintings. These larger tubes sell for between $18 and $35 each.
  • Misc. items: brushes, thinning oils, cleaners.
  • Light table.
  • Lighting and table for my work space.
  • Small furnishings for storage.

Up to this point, I have been working off of an end table in my living room, spreading out on my kitchen table between meals, or working on a clip board in my lap, wherever I can sit. I have been getting small supplies a couple times a month with my coupons, and making the best with what I have. I now have a studio space to work in, that is currently standing empty. I need your help to build my studio, my art career, and my LIFE.

I am offering acknowledgement at any and all shows I attend in the future, and to include you in any future mailings or updates on my progress via email or postal mail. I am also offering custom original art as 'perks' for my funders. These will be your choice of medium and subject, and left to my imagination to interpret your ideas ;) ALL donation amounts can receive custom art, just send me a note!

In closing, I humbly ask you to contribute anything you can. If you can't help financially at this time, please take a moment to pass along my link and my story so that others may be able to help. Thank you so very much for taking the time to look over my campaign :)

Please use the Indiegogo tools to share, or copy and paste ;)

Thank you!

Linda Wicker

story:
"One of the many mystical figures that leads you into a hole of psychological discovery." 

- Urban Dictionary: white rabbit


WHO ARE WE? 

Emily & Sophie, co-founding coeditors of White Rabbit, and our managing editor Bianca, students at NYU's Gallatin School of Individualized Study. The three of us met last year in an extremely awesome, life-changing course called The Social Construction of Reality, taught by Stephen Duncombe, and decided to create White Rabbit in order to share and continue this experience with others JUST LIKE YOU. 


WHAT IS WHITE RABBIT?

White Rabbit is an interactive 3-D art book inspired by philosophical & literary themes. We've asked over thirty young artists to create pieces as their own individualized response to a selected quote and concept that will be featured in the book. 

The central theme of this book is reality as a social construction. Some of the featured concepts include gender performance, the non-binary spectrum, consumerism, the male gaze, femininity, effects of media on perception and identity, double-consciousness, technology and the constructed concept of “America.” 

Artists are responding to quotes from those such as Judith Butler, John Berger, Walter Lippmann, Jean Baudrillard, Susan J. Douglas, Slavoj Zizek, Nietzsche, Plato, Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, and the films It Felt Like A Kiss and Paris is Burning.


HOW?

With everything so fast paced and transient in today’s world of mass media and technology, we've decided it's extremely important for White Rabbit to be made in print as a physical book that is highly interactive and engaging in a unique way. This will be achieved through the addition of colorful plastic layovers, foldouts, 3-D graphics and glasses, scratch-off materials, thermochromatic ink, and of course, shiny materials. This kind of specialty printing is where the majority of the costs will go.  


CO$TS:

We’ve already raised ⅓ of the necessary funds but still need your help to see this project all the way through. We’ve found a specialty printer that has agreed to make the book with all of the features mentioned above that we’ve envisioned. 

In addition to printing, costs will also go towards our gallery opening and book launch event, which will take place in New York City in January 2015. Any profits will go towards the funding of our next White Rabbit project. 


PERKS!

We’re working with a group of extremely talented, wonderful artists and individuals who have offered to gift pieces of their work to backers, as a personal gift of thanks for helping to support our project. We've also provided a number of unique and exciting prizes we hope you will enjoy.  


FUNDING GOALS:

Even if we do not reach our goal, we will still use any amount of funding received towards the creation of White Rabbit, but will be highly limited in what we can use in terms of features and materials for the book. This would likely mean not having the envisioned gallery opening for our artists, where we would have installations and original works from the book on display for the public. 


BUT WHY ARE WE DOING THIS??

We’re making this book in response to what we see as a frustratingly high amount of negative, superficial and unhealthy art that’s out there in the world, often specifically marketed towards and consumed by people our age.

With White Rabbit we aim to make something both sincere and meaningful that will encourage individuals to engage with thought-provoking and perspective changing works and ideas, which we hope others will find as helpful and inspiring in their own lives as we have in ours. 


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

We truly appreciate every little  bit of support. If you can't donate, please spread the word and share our campaign with others on Facebook or IRL (!!!)

Thank you so much for all of your continued support!


We love you!!! <3

Emily, Sophie & Bianca

story:
We all have an opportunity to shape our own future. Every single one of us Thinks, Acts and Votes, and every day we create a future that we choose.


Hi. My name's Amisha Ghadiali. In early 2010, as a way to initiate a new and creative conversation about politics and daily life, I set up Think Act Vote (?!X) a radical think tank that explores the new and creative ways we can and are shaping our future lives and communities.


Run by a powerhouse of volunteers and a vibrant community of collaborators and supporters, Think Act Vote (?!X) have spent the past two years asking thousands of individuals to think deeply about, and to believe in a future that they choose. Throughout this journey we have met some truly incredible people and heard thousands of dreams and fears about the future. And so, to capture some of this we're making a book all about the future and it's open to everyone to contribute thoughts and to get involved.


This is a collaborative book and we hope that the process of its creation will inform and inspire us, as it will others. So, please support us, talk to us and join in, in whatever way you can.

Thank you!

Amisha & the Think Act Vote team x
www.thinkactvote.org


The ?!X Story

It all started from a conversation with friends that presented a simple reality - when you flip an election on its head, it's really just about choosing a future. And with that Think Act Vote (?!X) was founded and immediately set out to playfully ask people that very question; What is the Future You Choose?


We started with a ballet box and asked hundreds of people to think about and vote for the future they choose. The most powerful of these futures have recently been visualised by over fifty amazing illustrators - we'll be revealing this incredible work in the new year. We ran a t-shirt design competition, judged by an esteemed creative panel, including Fashion Designer Katharine Hamnett, Social Entrepreneur Cyndi Rhoades and Stylish Illustrator Daisy de Villeneuve, and the winning design by Jesson Yip was lovingly made into t-shirts by ethical fashion superstars, Komodo. We then ran an event called ?!X Refashioned that saw leading ethical fashion designers Tara Starlet, Ada Zandtion, Beautiful Soul, Junky Styling and others design a one off piece and customisations for any one to do at home. And, with our travelling photobooth we've travelled to events and festivals across the country, including Vintage Goodwood and Latitude Festival and snapped hundreds of people in the ?!X t-shirts. 

 

In 2011 we launched our Futures Interviews series, asking people to share their chosen futures and some of the ways we can think, act and vote to create them. The Futures Interviews are continuing to fly into our inbox thick and fast, and we're publishing many interviews online every week. Whilst we're super excited about this we really don't want the older stories to be lost in a digital archive. We want to pause for a moment and capture some of the best responses we've had in a book, all about the future.



The Futures Book Project

In the book, insightful interview responses and stories will be presented alongside the work of visual artists, designers, illustrators and photographers, and will feature among some leading thought pieces.

We'll be challenging our design team to explore the most sustainable print methods and to add some equally exciting creative surprises too. And, with the help of our wonderfully inspiring printers we'll be researching some new eco-papers and making sure we're on track to produce something to inspire the future.

The final book will be published in Spring 2012 and will available to buy in limited edition. We're also planning to present both the project and book to the British Prime Minister and leading politicians, to raise awareness of a new collaborative and creative future.

 

The Funds

So, where's this money going? A large chunk of it will be sunk into production costs, and after that a smaller bit will be used to allow a small team to focus on it for a few months - writing, designing, producing and promoting it. The money will pay to print 1000 copies of a 200-page limited edition book, and cover some distribution costs. It will also cover a little brand refresh, to design and print some cool postcards, produce a DIY Futures toolkit, and will help toward a book launch event. And, there's a very small contingency to account for the crowd-funding fees and exchange rates.

Any additional money we raise will be going towards things like hiring a professional editor, invested in the launch events and marketing, and maybe a few surprises in the book as well. Anything significant will go toward paying a team to design and build a website for ?!X.

Exchange Rate
Please note that the $/Â£ exchange rate is based on 1.55, the average rate at time of campaign launch. Therefore the donation exchanges are estimations. ?!X are unable to do anything about the exchange rate conversions once donations are made.



The ?!X Impact & Press

In our first two years, Think Act Vote (?!X) has reached and empowered thousands of people, asking them to consider and to create their own futures. We've received some wonderful support from an array of high profile individuals too - check out what they've been saying about us, here. And, read some of our press coverage here too.


** January Donation SPECIAL! **  Win a chance to dine with TV Historian Dan & ?!X Friends

Everyone who backs us in December 2011 will be automatically entered into a special competition draw. In early January we will be selecting a winner at random to join us on 9th February 2012 for a wonderfully inspiring and unmissable ?!X Dinner in London, with some of our high profile supporters including TV Historian Dan Snow. Exciting stuff!

 

Other ways to help

There are countless other ways to get involved too, here's just a few ideas:

 

  • Spread the word! Forward this page to friends, family and colleagues, post it on Facebook, Tweet it, Blog about your future and share our campaign video too. Send this to anyone who believes in a creative future!
  • Share your future: Have you filled in your Futures Interview yet? Submit yours online at thinkactvote.org.
  • Give time: Can you volunteer or donate your skills? We'd love that!
  • Donate swag:  Does your company have something cool that we can give as perks for our funders?
  • Get creative: On January 14th-15th 2012 we're holding Futures Project 36 - a 36hr event bringing together a community of artists, thinkers, actors, voters, poets, journalists and photographers to collaborate on a series of future related briefs. We're planning it now, but we promise - it's going to be creative and a lot of fun! Register on Eventbrite here if you'd like to take part, or email us at info@thinkactvote.org if you'd like to help us run it.
  • Donate space: Do you have spare desk spaces, an empty corner in your office or a free studio where Think Act Vote's Futures Project team can work? We're on the look out for an inspiring London base :)
  • Sponsor or partner with us: Do you work for or represent an organisation or project who are interested in partnering or sponsoring Think Act Vote? Please get in touch.


Get in touch

Want some more information, fancy a chat or want to discuss ways to get involved, email us at info@thinkactvote.org


Artwork Credits:

Campaign Image - Think Act Vote Paper Dolls, Holly Berry, www.hollyberryprojects.com

Photograph at Museum of Childhood/Dan Snow Quote - Maciej Groman, www.mgroman.co.uk

Photograph at Alternative Fashion Week/Chris Arnold Quote - Poulomi Basu, www.poulomibasu.com

Photograph at Vintage at Goodwood/Solitaire Townsend Quote - James Wick, www.jameswicksphoto.com

Photograph at Nozstock Festival/Kriss Akabussi Quote - Amisha Ghadiali, www.amisha.co.uk
story_txt:
We all have an opportunity to shape our own future. Every single one of us Thinks, Acts and Votes, and every day we create a future that we choose.

Hi. My name's Amisha Ghadiali. In early 2010, as a way to initiate a new and creative conversation about politics and daily life, I set up Think Act Vote (?!X) a radical think tank that explores the new and creative ways we can and are shaping our future lives and communities. 

Run by a powerhouse of volunteers and a vibrant community of collaborators and supporters, Think Act Vote (?!X) have spent the past two years asking thousands of individuals to think deeply about, and to believe in a future that they choose. Throughout this journey we have met some truly incredible people and heard thousands of dreams and fears about the future. And so, to capture some of this we're making a book all about the future and it's open to everyone to contribute thoughts and to get involved.

This is a collaborative book and we hope that the process of its creation will inform and inspire us, as it will others. So, please support us, talk to us and join in, in whatever way you can.
Thank you!
Amisha & the Think Act Vote team xwww.thinkactvote.org


The ?!X Story
It all started from a conversation with friends that presented a simple reality - when you flip an election on its head, it's really just about choosing a future. And with that Think Act Vote (?!X) was founded and immediately set out to playfully ask people that very question; What is the Future You Choose?

We started with a ballet box and asked hundreds of people to think about and vote for the future they choose. The most powerful of these futures have recently been visualised by over fifty amazing illustrators - we'll be revealing this incredible work in the new year. We ran a t-shirt design competition, judged by an esteemed creative panel, including Fashion Designer Katharine Hamnett, Social Entrepreneur Cyndi Rhoades and Stylish Illustrator Daisy de Villeneuve, and the winning design by Jesson Yip was lovingly made into t-shirts by ethical fashion superstars, Komodo. We then ran an event called ?!X Refashioned that saw leading ethical fashion designers Tara Starlet, Ada Zandtion, Beautiful Soul, Junky Styling and others design a one off piece and customisations for any one to do at home. And, with our travelling photobooth we've travelled to events and festivals across the country, including Vintage Goodwood and Latitude Festival and snapped hundreds of people in the ?!X t-shirts. 
 
In 2011 we launched our Futures Interviews series, asking people to share their chosen futures and some of the ways we can think, act and vote to create them. The Futures Interviews are continuing to fly into our inbox thick and fast, and we're publishing many interviews online every week. Whilst we're super excited about this we really don't want the older stories to be lost in a digital archive. We want to pause for a moment and capture some of the best responses we've had in a book, all about the future.



The Futures Book Project
In the book, insightful interview responses and stories will be presented alongside the work of visual artists, designers, illustrators and photographers, and will feature among some leading thought pieces. 
We'll be challenging our design team to explore the most sustainable print methods and to add some equally exciting creative surprises too. And, with the help of our wonderfully inspiring printers we'll be researching some new eco-papers and making sure we're on track to produce something to inspire the future. 
The final book will be published in Spring 2012 and will available to buy in limited edition. We're also planning to present both the project and book to the British Prime Minister and leading politicians, to raise awareness of a new collaborative and creative future.
 
The Funds
So, where's this money going? A large chunk of it will be sunk into production costs, and after that a smaller bit will be used to allow a small team to focus on it for a few months - writing, designing, producing and promoting it. The money will pay to print 1000 copies of a 200-page limited edition book, and cover some distribution costs. It will also cover a little brand refresh, to design and print some cool postcards, produce a DIY Futures toolkit, and will help toward a book launch event. And, there's a very small contingency to account for the crowd-funding fees and exchange rates.
Any additional money we raise will be going towards things like hiring a professional editor, invested in the launch events and marketing, and maybe a few surprises in the book as well. Anything significant will go toward paying a team to design and build a website for ?!X.Exchange RatePlease note that the $/Â£ exchange rate is based on 1.55, the average rate at time of campaign launch. Therefore the donation exchanges are estimations. ?!X are unable to do anything about the exchange rate conversions once donations are made. 




The ?!X Impact & Press
In our first two years, Think Act Vote (?!X) has reached and empowered thousands of people, asking them to consider and to create their own futures. We've received some wonderful support from an array of high profile individuals too - check out what they've been saying about us, here. And, read some of our press coverage here too.

** January Donation SPECIAL! **  Win a chance to dine with TV Historian Dan & ?!X Friends
Everyone who backs us in December 2011 will be automatically entered into a special competition draw. In early January we will be selecting a winner at random to join us on 9th February 2012 for a wonderfully inspiring and unmissable ?!X Dinner in London, with some of our high profile supporters including TV Historian Dan Snow. Exciting stuff!
 
Other ways to help
There are countless other ways to get involved too, here's just a few ideas:
 


Spread the word! Forward this page to friends, family and colleagues, post it on Facebook, Tweet it, Blog about your future and share our campaign video too. Send this to anyone who believes in a creative future!

Share your future: Have you filled in your Futures Interview yet? Submit yours online at thinkactvote.org.

Give time: Can you volunteer or donate your skills? We'd love that!

Donate swag:  Does your company have something cool that we can give as perks for our funders?

Get creative: On January 14th-15th 2012 we're holding Futures Project 36 - a 36hr event bringing together a community of artists, thinkers, actors, voters, poets, journalists and photographers to collaborate on a series of future related briefs. We're planning it now, but we promise - it's going to be creative and a lot of fun! Register on Eventbrite here if you'd like to take part, or email us at info@thinkactvote.org if you'd like to help us run it.

Donate space: Do you have spare desk spaces, an empty corner in your office or a free studio where Think Act Vote's Futures Project team can work? We're on the look out for an inspiring London base :)

Sponsor or partner with us: Do you work for or represent an organisation or project who are interested in partnering or sponsoring Think Act Vote? Please get in touch.


Get in touch
Want some more information, fancy a chat or want to discuss ways to get involved, email us at info@thinkactvote.org

story:
A Citywide Drawing Festival? Let's Do It.

This October, experience Chicago in a whole new way--through drawing! Join us for nearly 30 art happenings at iconic cultural sites and unexpected spaces in the city.

And these will not be your grandmother's trips to the musuem. Doodle on the animal houses at the Lincoln Park Zoo, draw wild things onto the pages of Maurice Sendak's masterpiece at Open Books, contribute to a group image of the Pacific Ocean at the Smart Museum, sketch slam poets' work at the Green Mill, and so much more.

Go to new (to you) neighborhoods and cultural organizations, and discover that everyone can draw--the professional sketcher (maybe that's you) and the budding artist (or maybe that's you). 

Hey--and all of the programs (with one exception) are FREE!

This isn't our first time at the drawdeo. (Oh no we didn't.) We produced the festival last year too--drew in a dozen different neighborhoods and reached about 10,000 Chicagoans. We can't wait to see what this year will bring.

But Wait...We Can't Do This Without You!

We need your support to pay stipends for teaching artists and to purchase zillions of crayons, markers, pencils, sketchpads, and specialty items (like transfer paper and glass slides...aren't you dying to know what we're using those things for? come see us in October to find out!). 

We opted for crowd-sourced funding, because we like the idea of the festival being "for Chicago, by Chicago." 

All contributions are tax-deductible, thanks to our fiscal agent and program partner, Chicago Arts Partnerships in Education.  

Can't Give?

If you are unable to support the festival financially, there are other meaningful ways you can help.

  • Forward this email to friends/family who might be interested in supporting the festival.
  • Spread word about the Campaign to your social media communities. 
  • Come to programs in October! 

Go Big Draw Chicago!

Thank you for your support!
