story:
Perk pictures available below or at the Gallery.

Hi! My name is Jo, I am a Music Technologist turned t-shirt maker!

In June 2013 I started bleaching and dying t-shirts. What began as a hobby, turned into a bigger dream, and I am now starting a creative arts group that seeks to extend to all art forms. Please help me get it off the ground! There is still much work to do, and much funding is necessary to get it up to speed!

LTC

Love the Christ has as its most urgent mission supporting anyone who dreams of getting involved in the arts but lacks a chance. We are specially concerned with Christians who find it hard to get the expose and support they need, and are tempted to hide their faith [or put it aside altogether] to get their foot in the door. At LTC we encourage them to embrace the arts, while holding on to Christ tighter than before!

My passion and motivation for creating a group such as LTC comes from my own experience of being rejected in the sound industry simply because of my quasi-teetotaller lifestyle, i.e. I don’t accept booze as payment. However, my talent and work ethics are well praised and recognized. Similar situations happen to many talented young artists whom sometimes get the comment, “You are super talented, but this Jesus thing, it’s gotta go, it doesn’t sell...”

The Campaign

This campaign was designed to help me get LTC off the ground. I am looking for exposure, funding, feedback, a customer base, and I also hope that through this campaign new (and experienced) artists may become interested in joining the team - even at this early stage.

The items here presented are part of LTC’s project Bleacherize. In this project we transform plain items into something unique, thus every item is different from any other, and no one else in the world will have one exactly the same as yours! We have t-shirts to offer (5 of them are truly special!) and academic diaries. [Scroll down to see item pictures].

The Perks

All the items are unique. They are all transformed by hand, and include a degree of randomness in their making. You will not find one the same anywhere else in the world.

Mailing List – All contributors will be added to LTC's mailing list, so please let us know if you would like to be excluded, but why would you want that?! You will receive the latest news, the heads-up about future projects, events, and new products; a periodical update on how LTC is going (every 3 or 4 months), invites to secret events for mailing list members only, and limited promotions once we have upgraded our online store.

The Thank-You Electronic Message – This is for contributors who donate less than £2. It will be totally personal, i.e. I will not copy and paste, it will not be a mass recipient message, but I will actually sit down and work on a ‘letter’ specifically for you. I will try my best to understand who you are by the information I know (name, location, etc.) and tailor my many thanks to you!

Prints – This is a new addition to the campaign, as we have recently launched our photography project. Each photograph is unique, and we will only give out one copy of it. There are 202 7"x5" prints. Available individually or in bundles.

The Thank-You Letter – This is for all contributors who have given £2 or more, and have left a mailing address. Similarly to the electronic message, it will be truly personal, but it will be handwritten (I will try my best to keep it neat and tidy!) It will include small LTC souvenirs, but these will large vary from letter to letter as I tailor it to you (again, truly unique, truly personal). If you have pledged for a perk it will be included in the package.

The Diary – Inspired in the covers I used to make (and maybe you did too) for my notebooks and schoolbooks with magazine paper and see-thru Sellotape! There is an assorted collection of covers available, from magazines, comic books, old photos, wallpaper, newspaper letters, posters, maps, music sheets, you name it! Each one will be unique! The inside is largely identical for all of them - though there may be slight variations. It is a standard A5, week-view, casebound 2014-2015 academic diary, coming in handy for the school year that is about to start!

Diary DIY Kit - I still have fun making these covers! So go ahead and have some fun too. I will send you all the parts necessary to make the LTC Diary, and you can make it yourself (and even add your own personal twist). It is also cheaper than getting it made by me :)

The Bleach Tee – This style of t-shirt is what started it all off. I began dreaming about this project and planning it while I was bleaching some t-shirts during my holiday break. Each one is unique and turns out different from the previous. They come in kids and adult sizes, and in a range of colours. I will contact you after you have made your contribution to enquire about size. Below is a list of the available sizes:

Men's / Unisex : S to 5XL                                Ladies' Fit : XS to 2XL

Kids' Unisex : 1-2yrs to 14-15yrs                    Girls' Fit : 3-4yrs to 14-15yrs

Note we will send you an assorted colour. If you want to be able to choose colour, have a look at our Custom Pack.

[See Size & Colour Chart in the Gallery]

No. x Bleach Tee – The more you buy, the greater the discount! Notice you still get assorted tees, but you can choose size and even mix and match sizes. If you want to choose your colours, take a look at our Custom Pack.

The Custom Pack – You get 3 Bleach Tees and a Diary. You will be able to pick the colour for each of your t-shirts, and you will be able to customise the cover of your Diary.

The 5 Tees

We also have 5 very special t-shirts that you can take away in addition to a Custom Pack! They make up the 5 Tees Collection, which was the first ever work made within LTC. Remember when I said above that I had conceived LTC whilst bleaching and dyeing a number of t-shirts? Well, these are it! What makes them special? They have a lot more work put into them! They were dismantled and rearranged; each component of the t-shirt is a different colour; there is a mixture of bleaching and dyeing; they have flown twice over the Atlantic with me [having started them in the UK, finished them in the US, and brought them back again to the UK]; one of them has even been worn to a concert! Each of them has a story and a message, and they are monuments of LTC's life, as well as my own personal life. So, in buying them, you will really be buying a piece history, and who knows one day they may be worth millions :)

The Burn Tee – This is by far my favourite t-shirt, and by far the biggest and most beautiful accident! It includes bleaching, dying, holes, and light chemical damage, which altogether surprisingly make the most comfortable and stunning of all these t-shirts. This was an unplanned design, made on the fly, the last t-shirt to be completed from the leftovers of all the others. Size is 38'' Chest Fit.

The Love Tee – This t-shirt is inspired in my favourite Bible text, in which I have based LTC’s personality; 1 Corinthians 13:4-7 which reads: “Love is patient and kind; love does not envy or boast; it is not arrogant or rude. It does not insist on its own way; it is not irritable or resentful; it does not rejoice at wrongdoing, but rejoices with the truth. Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.” Because I am a bit of a maths nerd, I have converted the text into an equation, the front of the t-shirt comprising the positive elements for love, and on the back the negative elements, which mar love. This stands as my personal trademark, X + Y = Love. Size is 40'' Chest Fit.

The Lyrics Tee – This is not a t-shirt at all, but a tank top! And it was the most laborious, taking 3 months to complete! All of it is handwritten. The motivation behind this one was that I really wanted to make a t-shirt to take to September 2013 Paramore show in Nottingham, featuring lyrics of the Self-Titled album. So I planned ahead, spent many afternoons working over it, and I did indeed wear it to the concert! Size is 40'' Chest Fit.

The Pain Tee – This was the first concept to be developed, and initially I only intended to make this t-shirt, the issue was: to make this one I had to buy several in order to get the right colours. So really, the other 4 t-shirts are what is left of the Pain Tee. The truth is, I dreamed the design and woke up thinking, “Cool! Let’s do it!” I incorporated the message found in Paramore’s lyrics “Hate To See Your Heart Break” because I thought this t-shirt - and indeed these 5 t-shirts altogether - embody perfectly that message: they have been taken apart, cut, burned, disfigured, put through all kinds of stress and pain, however, they have been fixed, put together, healed, and the result is more beautiful now than ever before. This is the message: though we undergo much suffering and sorrow, altogether it works to build us up, and make us more beautiful. We see images of this truth in the work of God in us, and indeed even in Christ! Size is 37'' Chest Fit.

The Palms Tee – Okay, this is a bit of a random one! So, in my momentary obsession with Paramore, and having made 2 t-shirts incorporating Paramore themes, I though, “There are 3 in Paramore, it seems logical there should be 3 Paramore Tees.” And it was so. I looked at the other t-shirts and the Pain Tee screamed out Taylor York at me, while the Lyrics Tee screamed out Hayley Williams, so now it was left to do one in honour of Jeremy Davies. For some reason, and I am not sure why, the first thing – and only thing – that came to mind were palms. Size is 36'' Chest Fit.

What else on perks...

The Lifelong Pack - if you have invested £4403 or more in this campaign, then I want to believe you are passionate about this cause, and you share our desire to make a difference in the world of arts and in the life of artists. LTC would like to keep an on-going relationship with you by forever sharing freebies made by our artists and within our projects. You will receive an item every Birthday, Valentine's Day, Wedding Day/Anniversary (if you are married), 3rd of June (LTC's birthday), and Christmas. Each of them will be accompanied by a short letter with greetings from all at LTC. Your first pack will come after the end of the campaign, containing a t-shirt and a diary made especially for you! - P.S.: You don't need to worry about adding shipping to your order, wherever you are in the world ;)

The One-Year Pack - you will receive everything included in the Life-Time Pack, except only for one year, and the pack includes UK shipping only [if you live in the Channel Islands or anywhere outside the UK please add £48]. Your last pack will arrive approximately on LTC's 2nd anniversary (June 3rd 2015).

Packaging & Shipping – UK Packaging and Shipping is included in all the prices, but please add £8 to your donation if you live in the Channel Islands or anywhere outside the UK.

Fulfilment – perks will be fulfilled as soon as possible, even before the end of the campaign. However, there may be cases where it will take up to the first week of July to complete fulfilment [this is specially true if you live outside the UK, as delivery may span over 1 or 2 weeks].

The Impact

By donating to this campaign, you will be funding a group that offers a much needed environment of Christ-centreness for young artists.

The main focus of this campaign isn't to introduce a great product, but to introduce an idea, that became concept, and is now coming into reality! A place where all those who love Christ - and want not to step outside His way - can embrace art with all their efforts, without having to cover up their faith and hide it, but rather proclaim Christ through their artistic endeavour!

We want to hold on to Christ tighter than before, and we want to embrace art, and we want to bring about a change in society and in the world of art.

We want to see great artists with a great love for Christ come about and be culturally and morally influential in the world, and a great help in the mission of the Gospel.

How do you benefit? You will get the first fruits of the work done within LTC. With your contribution you get a unique item, and some of them are the very items that triggered this whole idea! You will be part of LTC's history, and you will retain part of LTC's history!

The general public will benefit from art that is based not on hatred, profanity nor moral corruption, but on Love, on Christ; from artists whom are not driven by greed nor narcissism, but by humble love and a passion for art and for the Creator!

The Money

Earlier this year I conducted a similar campaign, the 2XL Collection. This was a campaign in US Dollars (because LTC was in the States for a while!), and it focused on promoting LTC, displaying the work done within Life Renewal (another project within LTC) and helping another Christian ministry. We raised $501 (complete funding!), 60% went to PTSE (more about them below), 21.99% went to Indiegogo fees (including a $25 fee for Non-US bank transfer. Madness!) and what was left was used to pay expenses such as shipping, etc, but it was not enough to cover it all. So, though the campaign was successful and reached goal, the end result left LTC with £5.53 of debt, hence why I am doing a new campaign, but this time I will do things a little different!

This time, because the campaign is in British Sterling Pounds (£), I am expecting Indiegogo to take 7% if the campaign reaches goal, and 10% of the profit (that is, of the money that gets to us) will go to PTSE. Since the expenses for this campaign have mainly to do with t-shirt prices, packaging, and shipment – which have already been included in the perk values – this should leave LTC with much more substantial profit!

Why have I set the goal to Indiegogo’s minimum of £500? Because even £270 (approximate profit in a worst case scenario after fees, expenses, and the 10% share to PTSE) would come to great aid! However, if we raise a little or a lot more, then that's great! Another reason I have set it to the minimum is because it helps to ensure we reach the 'safe zone' sooner (that is, avoid Indiegogo taking a bigger share because we haven’t reached goal!) I have set the perk values so that LTC has a good profit margin, and we do not end up in a similar situation as in the previous campaign.

What do we need the money for?

At the moment LTC needs it most desperately for registration purposes. I am still getting LTC registered and up to speed as a corporate body. The money is also necessary to invest on equipment, materials, and supplies! I wish to widen the product range within LTC's yet small online store, and this will require payment of fees and a certain amount of upfront investment! The fashion and recycling & renewal projects have already seen the light of day, but I wish to kick-off photography, creative writing, and short film production projects before the end of 2014 [you can read more on these here]. Going into 2017 I dream LTC will have it's own music label, and a music festival. Basically we are really talking in the thousands if we are going to grow LTC into what I have been dreaming. However, more than funding, we need people, so please get involved! – more on that below.

What if we don’t reach £500?

Like I explained above, any amount of money will be useful, and the exposure alone helps LTC tremendously, but my personal desirable minimum is of £372, to account for expenses and cover the investment made to even produce the campaign.

What is PTSE?

LTC's mission is not only to support new and aspiring artists, but also to use part of the profits to fund Christian ministries all over the world, especially those that are in most need. I have set it as a rule that from now on 10% of all LTC's profit will be invested in a Christian ministry as an offering. PTSE is the only ministry benefiting from us at the moment. They are a Gospel-centred non-profit organisation based in North Florida that raises awareness for human trafficking, and offers help to those addicted to pornography, prostitution, and other types of sexual misconduct. My hope is that LTC will be able to help many other ministries of differing focus in the near future.

My challenge to you is: no matter how much you give, or what perk you go for, Participate In Positive World Change!

Here are some ways you can help us further:

  • Share this campaign! This should be the first thing you do, whether you contribute or not. Please share on your social networks, share by word of mouth, share at home, at work, at school, with your church, with your family and friends, with your neighbours, with everyone!
  • If you are from in and around Hereford, and you would like to give me a hand getting these perks ready, please get in touch.
  • If you are an experienced artist, (or even renowned!) please consider getting involved and helping us! We are keen on learning from artists that love Christ and have been working in the creative arts at a professional level.
  • If you would like to get involved in the arts, then check out our website! We look forward to take you in and support you as you go through a journey of learning and growing in the arts and in Christ!

Thank you for reading this far! Thank you for checking out the campaign! Thank you for giving! Thank you for getting a perk! Thank you for supporting aspiring artists! Thank you for sharing with everyone you know! In essence, thank you for being faithful to Christ, loving God and being a good neighbour!

Jo Pires - Founder of LTC


FAQ

Can I pledge even though I don't have a credit card? Yes. Because we accept PayPal, this means you can use any bank card you normally use to buy online. You may also pay with your PayPal account, or a bank account you have previously linked to PayPal. You do not need to have a PayPal account in order to donate.


Supporter Feedback

"Your designs are awesome!" Cory J.

"I like the diaries." Joe P.

"I like your diaries!" Becca S.

See Your Heart Break” because I thought this t-shirt - and indeed these 5
t-shirts altogether - embody perfectly that message: they have been taken apart, cut, burned, disfigured, put through all kinds of stress and pain,
however, they have been fixed, put together, healed, and the result is more
beautiful now than ever before. This is the message: though we undergo much
suffering and sorrow, altogether it works to build us up, and make us more
beautiful. We see images of this truth in the work of God in us, and indeed even in Christ! Size is 37'' Chest Fit.
The Palms Tee – Okay, this is a
bit of a random one! So, in my momentary obsession with Paramore, and having
made 2 t-shirts incorporating Paramore themes, I though, “There are
3 in Paramore, it seems logical there should be 3 Paramore Tees.” And it
was so. I looked at the other t-shirts and the Pain Tee screamed out Taylor
York at me, while the Lyrics Tee screamed out Hayley Williams, so now it was left
to do one in honour of Jeremy Davies. For some reason, and I am not sure why,
the first thing – and only thing – that came to mind were palms. Size is 36'' Chest Fit.What else on perks...
The Lifelong Pack - if you have invested £4403 or more in this campaign, then I want to believe you are passionate about this cause, and you share our desire to make a difference in the world of arts and in the life of artists. LTC would like to keep an on-going relationship with you by forever sharing freebies made by our artists and within our projects. You will receive an item every Birthday, Valentine's Day, Wedding Day/Anniversary (if you are married), 3rd of June (LTC's birthday), and Christmas. Each of them will be accompanied by a short letter with greetings from all at LTC. Your first pack will come after the end of the campaign, containing a t-shirt and a diary made especially for you! - P.S.: You don't need to worry about adding shipping to your order, wherever you are in the world ;)The One-Year Pack - you will receive everything included in the Life-Time Pack, except only for one year, and the pack includes UK shipping only [if you live in the Channel Islands or anywhere outside the UK please add £48]. Your last pack will arrive approximately on LTC's 2nd anniversary (June 3rd 2015).Packaging & Shipping – UK Packaging and Shipping is included in all the prices, but please add £8 to your donation if you live in the Channel Islands or anywhere outside the UK.Fulfilment – perks will be fulfilled as soon as possible, even before the end of the campaign. However, there may be cases where it will take up to the first week of July to complete fulfilment [this is specially true if you live outside the UK, as delivery may span over 1 or 2 weeks].
The Impact
By donating to this campaign, you will be funding a group that offers a much needed environment of Christ-centreness for young artists.The main focus of this campaign isn't to introduce a great product, but to introduce an idea, that became concept, and is now coming into reality! A place where all those who love Christ - and want not to step outside His way - can embrace art with all their efforts, without having to cover up their faith and hide it, but rather proclaim Christ through their artistic endeavour!We want to hold on to Christ tighter than before, and we want to embrace art, and we want to bring about a change in society and in the world of art.We want to see great artists with a great love for Christ come about and be culturally and morally influential in the world, and a great help in the mission of the Gospel.How do you benefit? You will get the first fruits of the work done within LTC. With your contribution you get a unique item, and some of them are the very items that triggered this whole idea! You will be part of LTC's history, and you will retain part of LTC's history!The general public will benefit from art that is based not on hatred, profanity nor moral corruption, but on Love, on Christ; from artists whom are not driven by greed nor narcissism, but by humble love and a passion for art and for the Creator!
The MoneyEarlier this year I conducted a similar campaign, the 2XL Collection. This was a campaign in US Dollars (because LTC was in the States for a while!), and it focused on promoting LTC, displaying the work done within Life Renewal (another project within LTC) and helping another Christian ministry. We raised $501 (complete funding!), 60% went to PTSE (more about them below), 21.99% went to Indiegogo fees (including a $25 fee for Non-US bank transfer. Madness!) and what was left was used to pay expenses such as shipping, etc, but it was not enough to cover it all. So, though the campaign was successful and reached goal, the end result left LTC with £5.53 of debt, hence why I am doing a new campaign, but this time I will do things a little different!This time, because the campaign is in British Sterling Pounds (£), I am expecting Indiegogo to take 7% if the campaign reaches goal, and 10% of the profit (that is, of the money that gets to us) will go to PTSE. Since the expenses for this campaign have mainly to do with t-shirt prices, packaging, and shipment – which have already been included in the perk values – this should leave LTC with much more substantial profit!Why have I set the goal to Indiegogo’s minimum of £500? Because even £270 (approximate profit in a worst case scenario after fees, expenses, and the 10% share to PTSE) would come to great aid! However, if we raise a little or a lot more, then that's great! Another reason I have set it to the minimum is because it helps to ensure we reach the 'safe zone' sooner (that is, avoid Indiegogo taking a bigger share because we haven’t reached goal!) I have set the perk values so that LTC has a good profit margin, and we do not end up in a similar situation as in the previous campaign.What do we need the money for?At the moment LTC needs it most desperately for registration purposes. I am still getting LTC registered and up to speed as a corporate body. The money is also necessary to invest on equipment, materials, and supplies! I wish to widen the product range within LTC's yet small online store, and this will require payment of fees and a certain amount of upfront investment! The fashion and recycling & renewal projects have already seen the light of day, but I wish to kick-off photography, creative writing, and short film production projects before the end of 2014 [you can read more on these here]. Going into 2017 I dream LTC will have it's own music label, and a music festival. Basically we are really talking in the thousands if we are going to grow LTC into what I have been dreaming. However, more than funding, we need people, so please get involved! – more on that below.What if we don’t reach £500?Like I explained above, any amount of money will be useful, and the exposure alone helps LTC tremendously, but my personal desirable minimum is of £372, to account for expenses and cover the investment made to even produce the campaign.What is PTSE?LTC's mission is not only to support new and aspiring artists, but also to use part of the profits to fund Christian ministries all over the world, especially those that are in most need. I have set it as a rule that from now on 10% of all LTC's profit will be invested in a Christian ministry as an offering. PTSE is the only ministry benefiting from us at the moment. They are a Gospel-centred non-profit organisation based in North Florida that raises awareness for human trafficking, and offers help to those addicted to pornography, prostitution, and other types of sexual misconduct. My hope is that LTC will be able to help many other ministries of differing focus in the near future.My challenge to you is: no matter how much you give, or what perk you go for, Participate In Positive World Change!Here are some ways you can help us further:
Share this campaign! This should be the first thing you do, whether you contribute or not. Please share on your social networks, share by word of mouth, share at home, at work, at school, with your church, with your family and friends, with your neighbours, with everyone!
If you are from in and around Hereford, and you would like to give me a hand getting these perks ready, please get in touch.If you are an experienced artist, (or even renowned!) please consider getting involved and helping us! We are keen on learning from artists that love Christ and have been working in the creative arts at a professional level.
If you would like to get involved in the arts, then check out our website! We look forward to take you in and support you as you go through a journey of learning and growing in the arts and in Christ!

Thank you for reading this far! Thank you for checking out the campaign! Thank you for giving! Thank you for getting a perk! Thank you for supporting aspiring artists! Thank you for sharing with everyone you know! In essence, thank you for being faithful to Christ, loving God and being a good neighbour!Jo Pires - Founder of LTCFAQCan I pledge even though I don't have a credit card? Yes. Because we accept PayPal, this means you can use any bank card you normally use to buy online. You may also pay with your PayPal account, or a bank account you have previously linked to PayPal. You do not need to have a PayPal account in order to donate.Supporter Feedback"Your designs are awesome!" Cory J."I like the diaries." Joe P."I like your diaries!" Becca S.

story:
What is this all about?

Basement Creative has been working hard on creating a database of original loveable creatures with an attitude. We want to bring them out of the basement and into the world, through beautiful prints and wrapping paper.
 
Are you or someone you know...about to have a baby?
  • how bout some cute artwork to spruce up the baby's space?
  • or cute and quirky wrapping paper to wrap up that present
 
Do you just like to look at things that make you happy inside?
  • we get it, we totally do too...so get some for yourself!
 
Do you love animals?
  • how can ya not? any one of these characters is sure to set a smile on your face

**UPDATE!

PAWS UP Series for the SPCA now available!

We’ve been working hard to bring you delightful dog illustrations and we love animals, so we’re happy to announce that we’ve teamed up with the BC SPCA on these prints! With every purchase from this series we will donate 15% of the selling price to the BC SPCA. Please see below for the Paws Up Series!
 
The BC SPCA does not receive any federal or provincial government funding and needs help to raise much needed donations for the almost 29,000 animals the they care for each year. We’re happy to do our part for this wonderful cause - and you can too by supporting the Paws Up series or making a direct donation at http://www.spca.bc.ca/support/donate/
PAWS UP for this great cause!

 
**please note there are two series - Zoology and Paws Up for the SPCA
 
 

 

Introducing the first 20 characters in ZOOLOGY:

 

Paws Up for SPCA - We will donate 15% of sales from this series to the BC SPCA

Our 25 canine friends - waiting for you to take them home!

 

Why are we here & What you get

We're testing out to see just how lovable our creatures are! We all work 9-5 jobs and do this in our spare time, we'd love to take it to the next level if the response is good, so let us know what you think! Check out the perk packs below...

**PAWS UP FOR THE SPCA!

If we are able to reach our goal, we will release three wrapping paper prints! These require a minimum order amount, so that's why we have them as our stretch goal.

**Please be sure to select the PAWS UP perk pack if you would like prints from that series!
 
**We will contact you once your order has been placed to find out which animals you want, and hope to be able to ship to you around Oct 2013.
 
** If we aren't able to reach our goal, don't fret - we will still fulfill all orders made during this campaign
 
**NEW! FREE SHIPPING to Singapore & Hong Kong!
 

 

A little about us...

Hailing from the west coast of Canada, Basement Creative has been around since 2008, but we've been on a bit of a break for the last couple of years. We work on print/graphic design and branding and are working on expanding our horizons. Reinspired we've dusted ourselves off, and are back and ready for some action!

Not your thing? Maybe it's someone else's that you know...

We know these characters aren't for everyone, but if you do know someone that would love them, please help us spread the word!

Share this indiegogo link! (http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/basement-creative-zoology)

Follow us on pinterest!(http://pinterest.com/basementc/)

Tell your friends on Facebook! Twitter! Email! Phone! Face to Face!

 

THANK YOU!!

 

FAQ

What is the size of your frame?

Frame size is 10'x12' inner picture size is 8'10'

Do you have other colors available for the frame?

Sorry, at this time, we only have white frames available

How do I choose my animal?

We will email you once your perk has been choosen to find out your preferred animals!

What if I want to mix and match between Zoology and Paws Up?

Please select the PAWS UP perk, and we'll email you to confirm the animals/dogs of your choice. We will still donate that portion to the BC SPCA.

I forgot to add shipping!  What should I do?

Please click 'contribute now' and type in the shipping amount but select no perk.  We will match your contributions up.

story:
WHAT IS THE WORLD OF GOLMA?!?!?!?!!

The World of Golma is a compendium exploring the lives of the twelve chosen for the Glorifa's seventh tournament. Featuring comics, short stories, essays, and historiography by our writing team and artwork by Zach Bradley, this book will tell the story of Golma from every angle. 

The book is 8 ½” by 11” and is currently 70 pages and growing!!!! We want to create a rich world that fully immerses the reader. We are tirelessly creating more and more content to give you the consumer the most bang for your hard earned buck. 

 

 Zachary Bradley: Illustrator and Creator

Zach Bradley is a freelance illustrator and concept artist who has a passion for visual storytelling. 

An interview with Zach: http://www.rsquaredcomicz.com/2013/05/26/christian-comic-creator-interview-76-zachary-bradley/

Zach's website: http://zacharydavisbradley.wix.com/outsidetheline

 Paul von Soosten: Writer

Paul von Soosten is a writer and documentary filmmaker who wants to go out and live in the woods for a while.

 Cheyenne Martin: Writer

 Jayson Gober: Writer

 Alex Locklin: Writer

 

Why are we doing this?

First off let us say one thing, THIS PROJECT IS GOING TO HAPPEN. We have too much passion for the world we are creating and the characters that inhabit it for it not to happen. So what you will be doing is essentially pre-ordering the book and whatever awesome sauce rewards you desire.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is the funds to buy the merchandise and print the book. This is where you the contributor come in-

What you get is the blood sweat and tears of a group dedicated to a specific goal. (also whatever reward you buy, that might be important)

 

Down to business!

We recently found an awesome book printing press that allows us to produce a book at the highest quality while giving us the flexibility to make completely original content. The part we are most excited about is how the ordering works. The more books that we can order the better the quality the book will be. What we mean by this is the base book will start as a softcover 8 ½” by 11”, but if we get 50 books ordered we can upgrade them to hardcovers. If we hit 100 we can produce SUPER HARDCOVERS WITH DUSTJACKETS!!!! The coolest thing about that is that it does not affect the cost to you the consumer!!!  

 

What some of the rewards look like!

T-shirt comes in Black, White, and Grey!!!!

 

Hoodie comes in black and white!!

 

Tote bags come in grey and black!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Remember the more people that buy the the book the better the book will be! Even if you can not buy the book you can help by sharing the book!

We Even Have A Facebook Page???? (must make it offical or something)

https://www.facebook.com/GolmaWorld

 

 

(All tiers limited to one of each item, example: Super Bundle = 1 book, 1 shirt, 1 tote bag, 1 hoodie, 1 poster, 1 print.)

story: $12000 is the estimated amount I need to publish 5000 photo books destined for aspiring designers. Every dollar collected will go towards printing and distribution costs.

story:
Dear Friends and Supporters,

I hope that no one is disappointed with the results of the campaign which ended today. We did in fact raise over $2000 which will provide 2-$1000 cash scholarships for 2 deserving student veterans next year at SJSU. As a current grad student at SJSU, I can tell you first hand, $1000 is nothing to be disappointed about. Your support made this happen. I can't thank you enough. My love and respect to those of you who contributed so generously and for helping me to promote the campaign. I still have t-shirts already paid for so if you would like to buy one, I will continue to sell them for $20 and then use that money to contribute to the Veteran Student Organization at SJSU, a very worthy cause. Please continue to tell others about the tragedy of veteran suicide, continue to engage with veterans...I know you will! 

Peace

Mark Pinto

www.markpintoart.com
